Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our product is all about collaboration and innovation. So are our people. We‚Äôre a small team, but we‚Äôve got a big vision: to build a brand-new infrastructure for operational risk management. It‚Äôs not easy. We‚Äôre redefining the way some of the world‚Äôs biggest financial services companies and banks work with data. There are a lot of challenges ‚Äì but a lot of opportunities to think and act creatively, too.

Backed by banks (JP Morgan, Citi, Barclays, Lloyds, BNP) and ratings agencies, Acin helps banks objectively manage their risk control landscape. Based on a network of peers, Acin‚Äôs data protocols connect a bank‚Äôs risk control data across their firm and industry leading to greater cost savings, and creating huge efficiency savings across the bank both in front and back-office operations.

The role:

The Data Analyst role within the Data Operations team is instrumental in delivering value to our customers. In this role you will connect customer data to the Acin Network, assisted by senior colleagues and while building a good knowledge of what‚Äôs important in a risk and control framework. You will also be involved with ensuring that Acin‚Äôs Network data continues to represent a consensus view of customers‚Äô risk and control data.

The Data Operations team is responsible for delivering the data that drives the Acin Platform. The team connects customer risk and control data to the Acin Network, which customers interact with via the Platform and during meetings with the team‚Äôs subject matter experts. The team defines and maintains Acin‚Äôs consensus-based risk and control inventories, defines and applies Acin‚Äôs data connectivity protocols, maintains the business rules used to build Network consensus and ensures all Acin data is of the highest quality.

Responsibilities:

Connect customer data to the Acin network via Acin‚Äôs data matching protocols and tooling
Collaborate closely with senior analysts and the firm‚Äôs subject matter experts to deliver more accurate results and grow your own knowledge
Work with Acin‚Äôs product and Engineering teams to facilitate faster and better data processing
Support the team‚Äôs Data Specialists in preparing materials for customer meetings
Ensure consistent and quality application of Acin‚Äôs technical standards to our core risk and control content and beyond


Requirements

You have 1-3 years‚Äô experience in a data focussed role
You can work in a fast-pace FinTech environment
You're a self-starter with a down-to-earth approach and a high level of pragmatism and proactivity
You have strong organisational skills, with impeccable attention to detail
Can work under time pressure
You would enjoy being part of the Acin team ‚Äì we're looking for someone who is flexible, supportive, collaborative and will contribute positively to our strong team dynamic and culture from day one
You have strong MS Office skills, particularly Excel
You have concise written and verbal communication skills


Benefits

This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing, dynamic fintech that is creating huge momentum in the market. Alongside a friendly, dynamic, and inclusive culture, we offer‚Ä¶

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Share options ‚Äì we like to offer our employees a stake in our success
A company pension to help save for your future
Enhanced Private Health Insurance for you and your family
Life insurance, including access to their Smart Health services such as unlimited access to an online GP as well as a range of other health and wellbeing experts
Enhanced maternity and paternity leave policies
Perkbox - a discount platform and wellbeing resource centre.
Employee Assistance Program ‚Äì access to free counselling sessions and support through Perkbox.
Cycle to work scheme
A laptop and home office equipment ‚Äì whatever you need to do your best work
Hybrid working options. We currently we have offices in Farnborough and Central London.
Regular company events and socials ‚Äì we call these events InterfAcin
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together. Our core company values are get up and go, keep going, and always further.


Acin is an equal opportunity employer. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, sex, colour, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation and gender identity or expression.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
GoHenry is a London and New York-based fintech company that pioneered the youth fintech and financial education category. We are on a mission to make every kid smart with money and to delight our community of 2 million parents, kids, and teens with innovative, market-leading tools to help parents raise financially healthy kids.

GoHenry offers a debit card and app for kids and teens and companion apps for the family, with in-app tools for sending money, automating allowance, managing chores, setting savings goals, giving to charity, and in-app financial education lessons where kids can watch videos, take quizzes and earn points & badges. This is all designed to help kids and teens build good money habits that will last a lifetime.

The Tech team at GoHenry is looking to recruit a Mid-Level Data Analyst to closely work with the Growth Product teams and other areas in the business. We are a rapidly growing fintech company and are looking for a self starter looking to make an immediate impact across the business. The successful candidate will leverage their business knowledge and technical skills to develop analysis and reporting capabilities to extract, deliver, and present data insights. These will be used to measure the impact of new initiatives, product improvements and overall company OKRs. The role will report to the Growth Analytics and Strategy Lead, while also working closely with the Onboarding PM and their team.

What You Will Do

Work with the Growth Product team to understand, document, and conduct relevant analysis
Present findings to high level stakeholders on a regular basis
Perform in depth data analysis to identify and understand anomalies
Use creative thinking to identify new tests to run, and new ways to measure results
Analyze, interpret, and extract results from various data sources
Build and maintain KPI reporting
Analyze and evaluate results of A/B tests, providing plans of action based on the measured results
Work across different stacks to ensure that you have a holistic knowledge of the Growth funnel and how it impacts the business as a whole
Use your knowledge of the business to identify areas of opportunity for growth and measurement


What We Are Looking For

At least 2-3 years work experience as a Data Analyst
Very strong knowledge of SQL
Self-motivated individual
Demonstrable experience working with Python
Experienced in B2C business, signup funnels, A/B testing, and analytic platforms
Experienced in creating and delivering reports/dashboards using tools such as Google Data Studio, Looker or others
Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in STEM field, or relevant bootcamp course


Nice-to-have Skills

Looker/LookML
Experience working in a B2C Fintech business
Google Analytics
dbt
Airflow


Benefits

goFlex - flexible working that lets you choose how (& where) you work best (office / home / a mix of both)
33 days of holiday (including public holidays)
An additional birthday day off
Family-friendly leave policies
Enhanced maternity and paternity leave
Westfield Cash Health Plan (for you and your children)
Westfield surgery plan after 3 years‚Äô service
Westfield Rewards (receive discounts at over 600 retailers)
Cycle to work scheme
Training opportunities to further develop your craft
Choose your own equipment


We are proud to say...

We help over two million members improve their money skills every single day.
We are one of Tech Track‚Äôs top 50 fastest growing UK companies.
We were nominated for ‚ÄòBest Personal Finance App‚Äô at the British Bank Awards 2020.
We were voted 'Best Children's Financial Provider' at the British Bank Awards 2021.
Our kids and parents have donated over ¬£200,000 of their own money to NSPCC via their GoHenry accounts.
We won the Kids' Cards category of Finder's Customer Satisfaction Awards 2022.


GoHenry is an equal-opportunity employer, and we are on a mission to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace. Individuals seeking employment at GoHenry are considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Want to join our mission?

If GoHenry sounds like a place you would like to be, please apply using the link below.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
THE BUSINESS

Illuma is an independent contextual ad-tech company which runs proprietary machine-learning tools to provide clients with intelligent and privacy-friendly way to scale their most valuable audiences online.

We are at an exciting stage in our journey, having just received Series A funding, and we are now investing in our team as we set our sights on global expansion.

At Illuma we are curious, innovative and progressive, committed to seeking new, intelligent solutions to business problems. You will be working with and learning from some of the brightest minds in AI, tech and data science, and you won‚Äôt be just a cog in a wheel, you will have an active voice with the opportunity to make real impact and grow your career with us as we scale.

Our technology has been developed by leading academics in data science and artificial intelligence, combined with input from senior advertising and publishing professionals. Our core clients are premium publishers, specialist media buyers and major programmatic advertisers including Microsoft, American Express, TUI, Aviva and Pernod Ricard. Our work was been recognised in The Guardian‚Äôs Publishing Trends Report 2019 and by the Digiday Media Awards Europe 2020, where we were finalists for ‚ÄòBest Social Good Campaign‚Äô.

We differentiate in a cluttered technology sector by challenging most of the norms of mainstream data-driven advertising: instead using AI to work reactively in real-time; re-thinking relevance and expanding success.

Requirements

We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst to work within our technical team, helping to drive efficiency through innovative solutions. Technology is central to our continued growth, and you will be supported by and work alongside other engineers. Moreover, as illuma focuses on digital advertising, and you will be exposed to the industry domain knowledge and will have the opportunity to develop your career path towards technical account manager.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a truly dynamic company under inspiring leadership, where you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting technologies in the sector and support the account managing team and sales team.

On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for and take the lead on a number of projects where you will use your analytical skills to understand the given brief and foresee any technical challenges that may arise. Alongside others, you will be responsible for data retrieval and analysis, campaign management, and advertising platform support.

Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities

Using a combined knowledge of computer science and applications, modelling statistics, analytics and maths to solve problems
Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Performing statistical analysis of data from multiple angles, looking for trends and insights that highlight problems or opportunities
Preparing reports and presenting these to management or clients
Monitoring metrics and developing ways to improve campaign performance
Assisting trading desk platform setup and troubleshoot
Understanding legacy code and executing programmes
Brainstorming for new ideas and technologies to improve development delivery
Continually updating technical and domain knowledge and skills
Following all best practices and procedures as established by the company


Knowledge, Skills And Experience

2:1 degree or higher in Data Science, Statistics, Maths, Operational Research or related area of study
Excellent written and spoken English
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL) for data retrieval
Proficiency in Python-Statistical Programming or R (especially packages/libraries for data science & analysis)
Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Microsoft PowerBI, Metabase, Tableau, etc)
Experience with Linux infrastructures & shell scripting
Knowledge & experience of machine learning, and data visualisation are preferable
Knowledge & experience with digital advertising (e.g. demand-side platforms, sell-side platforms, Ad exchanges, etc) are preferable
Up-to-date on latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potential clearly and confidently


You are:

Communication - able to get one's message understood clearly by adopting a range of styles, tools and techniques appropriate to the audience and the nature of the information.

Team working - enthusiastic about helping to build and maintain effective working relationships, working cooperatively with others to be part of a team and lead a team.

Strategic thinking - capable of identifying a vision along with the plans that need to be implemented to meet the end goal. You evaluate situations, decisions, issues, etc. in the short, medium and longer-term.

Analytical Thinking - able to simplify complex problems or projects into component parts, exploring and evaluating them systematically, and identifying and resolving problems.

Planning and organising - capable of prioritising and planning activities taking into account all the relevant issues and factors such as deadlines, resources, with line manager guidance at the outset as required.

Flexibility ‚Äì able to adapt and work effectively with a variety of situations, individuals or groups. Able to understand and appreciate different and opposing perspectives on an issue, to adapt an approach as the requirements of a situation change

Details:

This role will be based at our London office in Farringdon.

Benefits

25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Private medical insurance
Half price gym memberships
Pension
Team socials, stocked fridge, snacks - fun
We operate a Hybrid working model with initially the opportunity to work remotely for up to one day per week increasing to two days after successful completion of the probation period.


Equal Opportunity Statement

We embrace diversity fully and promote an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

Our Values

United
Driven
Focused
Innovative

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Contract type: Permanent

Place of work: Black Sheep Coffee Support Office, Southwark, Central London

Department: Finance

Reports to: Finance Manager




Position Profile & Role summary




An exciting and wide ranging opportunity for a proven Data Analyst in a rapidly scaling retail business, driving insights.




This role works across a number of exciting data sources, including inventory, workforce, sales, products and socials with this list continuously growing! This role requires partnering with all aspects of the business, deriving insights from our data sources and presenting this back to inform our leaders with the quality information they need to make important strategic and day to day decisions. This role is fundamental to our growth and ability to change and react quickly and you have a direct impact on our direction, decisions and growth.




Role responsibilities




Use data analysis techniques to produce analysis and insights across our varied datasets to drive key strategic decisions (such as pricing decisions, sales reporting, wastage, stock and labour requirements)
A conduit between the data and the business, communicating key trends and insights to our investors, our senior leaders and our operational teams.
Take ownership of Power BI and build and continuously improve quality and insightful dashboards and reports that will be used across the business.
Ad hoc data requests that continuously arise in a rapidly scaling retail business.




Essential requirements ‚Äì Skills, Qualifications & Experience




At least 2 years demonstrable experience in a data analyst / data science position.
Proven experience of analysing data and building quality dashboards in Power BI
Proven experience and aptitude in SQL and similar languages.
Experience in data visualisation and presentation to stakeholders.
Commercial acumen is essential due to the nature of the role.
The ability to communicate and build relationships with colleagues at all levels of the business and with external partners is essential.
A genuine interest and enjoyment in deep involvement in data.







Qualities




Self-starter and willing to go above and beyond to ensure the job is completed
Analytical skill set with an attention to detail and prioritise.
Proven problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to synthesise complex information in layman‚Äôs terms.
Highly organised
Great attitude and team player







The Perks




We are a relatively young company with a very ambitious future. You will be paid competitively and of course, can have as much free coffee and tea as you can drink as well as a great discount on our coffee beans, food items in store, merch and booze. We work hard and we play hard too. Our summer and Christmas parties are not to be missed!







About Black Sheep Coffee‚Ä¶




Founded in 2013 when a group of friends decided to quit their jobs on the same day to ‚ÄúLeave The Herd Behind‚Äù and embark on a coffee mission of ridding the world of boring, average-tasting coffee. Black Sheep Coffee is famous for launching the first 100% specialty grade robusta coffee and the only premium robusta bean on the market (X2 caffeine ‚Äì get your buzz on!). Our Founders, Gabriel and Eirik, travel to origins throughout the year to source the best beans in the world. In fact, we are one of the few shop retailers that purchase our beans directly at the plantations, looking after the picking, drying, and washing process according to the strictest of guidelines ‚Äì all in search of the perfect bean.

HTML:
Contract type: Permanent

Place of work: Black Sheep Coffee Support Office, Southwark, Central London

Department: Finance

Reports to: Finance Manager


Position Profile & Role summary


An exciting and wide ranging opportunity for a proven Data Analyst in a rapidly scaling retail business, driving insights.


This role works across a number of exciting data sources, including inventory, workforce, sales, products and socials with this list continuously growing! This role requires partnering with all aspects of the business, deriving insights from our data sources and presenting this back to inform our leaders with the quality information they need to make important strategic and day to day decisions. This role is fundamental to our growth and ability to change and react quickly and you have a direct impact on our direction, decisions and growth.


Role responsibilities


  • Use data analysis techniques to produce analysis and insights across our varied datasets to drive key strategic decisions (such as pricing decisions, sales reporting, wastage, stock and labour requirements)
  • A conduit between the data and the business, communicating key trends and insights to our investors, our senior leaders and our operational teams.
  • Take ownership of Power BI and build and continuously improve quality and insightful dashboards and reports that will be used across the business.
  • Ad hoc data requests that continuously arise in a rapidly scaling retail business.


Essential requirements ‚Äì Skills, Qualifications & Experience


  • At least 2 years demonstrable experience in a data analyst / data science position.
  • Proven experience of analysing data and building quality dashboards in Power BI
  • Proven experience and aptitude in SQL and similar languages.
  • Experience in data visualisation and presentation to stakeholders.
  • Commercial acumen is essential due to the nature of the role.
  • The ability to communicate and build relationships with colleagues at all levels of the business and with external partners is essential.
  • A genuine interest and enjoyment in deep involvement in data.



Qualities


  • Self-starter and willing to go above and beyond to ensure the job is completed
  • Analytical skill set with an attention to detail and prioritise.
  • Proven problem-solving skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to synthesise complex information in layman‚Äôs terms.
  • Highly organised
  • Great attitude and team player



The Perks


We are a relatively young company with a very ambitious future. You will be paid competitively and of course, can have as much free coffee and tea as you can drink as well as a great discount on our coffee beans, food items in store, merch and booze. We work hard and we play hard too. Our summer and Christmas parties are not to be missed!



About Black Sheep Coffee‚Ä¶


Founded in 2013 when a group of friends decided to quit their jobs on the same day to ‚ÄúLeave The Herd Behind‚Äù and embark on a coffee mission of ridding the world of boring, average-tasting coffee. Black Sheep Coffee is famous for launching the first 100% specialty grade robusta coffee and the only premium robusta bean on the market (X2 caffeine ‚Äì get your buzz on!). Our Founders, Gabriel and Eirik, travel to origins throughout the year to source the best beans in the world. In fact, we are one of the few shop retailers that purchase our beans directly at the plantations, looking after the picking, drying, and washing process according to the strictest of guidelines ‚Äì all in search of the perfect bean.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst‚Äì Permanent

Location: Central London

Up to ¬£35,000 per annum




The client

A think-tank who are committed to creating poverty indexes to help governments create policies.




Your responsibilities

Develop and maintain knowledge and expertise in microsimulation of poverty impacts.




Use survey data to create analyses of UK poverty, including the nature and lived experience of poverty in the UK.




Use the microsimulation model to produce a large number of assessments of policy impacts, ensuring these are statistically and economically robust, and appropriately reflect the inherent uncertainties involved.




Build knowledge and expertise on key aspect of poverty measurement and the drivers of poverty reduction.




Use results to create impactful written materials that meet the needs of a range of audiences, including summaries for senior management and detailed reports for more technical audiences.




Your experience

Strong data manipulation and analytical skills, ideally rooted in a quantitative degree or field.




Experience with Python or R. Some experience with the os and subprocess modules (or analogues in R) would be desirable.




Knowledge of ‚Äì or interest in ‚Äì policy issues related to relative poverty and low-income.




Experience in handling and manipulating large datasets, including UK household surveys (e.g. Family Resources Survey, Understanding Society, Labour Force Survey).




Some experience with Stata/SPSS/SAS is desirable.




Experience in producing high quality analysis in written and presentation form.




Some experience using git for version control would be desirable.




Excellent general IT skills with experience of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) is essential.




What‚Äôs next?

If you believe you have the desired skills and experience, please follow the link to apply and attach a copy of your latest CV. If successful, a Consultant will be in touch to discuss in more detail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Townhouse

Townhouse was created with a single goal: to disrupt and reinvent the global nail salon industry. We are the fastest growing beauty brand in the UK and are driven by a passionate and disruptive team in achieving our mission. We grew 300% last year and that‚Äôs just the beginning!

We‚Äôve brought together a world class team from a wide range of industries. And as we‚Äôre growing extremely fast, we need brilliant people (like you!) - to join us on our journey and help us deliver our goal.




Reporting directly to the CTO, you will be an experienced Analyst who has a track record in delivering excellent results. Working alongside an experienced Team, you will be assisting with all areas of the business to build and grow the Data function and team.




Your responsibilities include (but are not limited too):

Conducting full life cycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design
Developing our data science function and frameworks from scratch - having a wide range to choose the right technologies, framework and processes needed to achieve world class results
Building sophisticated predictive models to support our operations, acquisition and marketing teams
Building out our analysis and reporting capabilities
Working with complex datasets to extract valuable business insights, and work with other stakeholders across the business to understand business needs, and turn these insights into strategic actions
Monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.




Qualifications:

BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics (or other data science type course)
Experience in Data models, database design, data mining & segmentation
Experience with programming languages such as Python, R, Javascript, SQL
A sound knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analysing datasets
Very strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at report writing and presenting findings.
Excellent communication skills, and ability to work with a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders across the business, up to the C-Suite.




Benefits

Competitive salary
Scope for rapid career progression
Hybrid working environment (on agreement with managers)
‚ÄúTownhouse Perks‚Äù comprehensive benefits package




Work

Full time, 40 hours / week
Right to work in UK required
Office based in Tottenham Court Road

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kantar is the world‚Äôs leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies. Kantar‚Äôs 25,000 people based in more than 100 countries help the world‚Äôs leading organisations succeed and grow. Nobody knows people better than Kantar. We provide insight and inspiration to help our clients, our people and society to create and flourish in an extraordinary world.




Our media colleagues are expert in understanding the changing media landscape. This includes audience measurement, consumer targeting and in-depth intelligence into paid, owned and earned media. Their global coverage and local expertise enable clients to better understand media audiences and their relationships with brands to optimise investment.




Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London, Westgate

Salary: Competitive

Full time/Permanent




Role Description

Kantar is the leader in providing digital TV audience and advertising measurement tools and intelligence. With a proven track record in audience research services across 50+ countries, Kantar is at the forefront of technological developments in audience measurement in the media industry, working with broadcasters and advertisers, media agencies and industry committees.




The Data Science team provides research and technical expertise, support, oversight, and methodological development to our global operating services.




Within the team the data analyst supports other data scientists and developers with necessary data queries and runs periodic Quality Control analyses on live services. Critical thinking, analytical mind and clear communication are crucial as the data queries and checks should be mostly initiated and designed by the data analyst to facilitate the modelling workflow, and then communicated to the rest of the team.




Job Role Requirements

Strong understanding of numerical and data analytical skills
Data investigation for quality and completeness of model input data
Able to spot anomalies and gain conclusions
Quality control of modelling outcome data ‚Äì generic models and client specific applications
Support with client‚Äôs liaison on technical issues
Represent the business at industry events

Role Requirements

Intermediate level of programming with Python (preferable), or other programming languages (e.g., R, MATLAB)
Strong communication capabilities (peers and, occasionally, clients)
Capability of taking initiative, working independently, driving results
Attention to details and accuracy
Critical thinking

Education and experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in highly numerate discipline
Excellent understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts




At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.




We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that‚Äôs out of the ordinary and join us.




We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.




At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.




Privacy and Legal Statement




PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (‚ÄúKantar‚Äù). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:




This full-time contract position offers a hybrid working model with 3 days onsite per week in the Central London Kings Cross offices.




Onsite days are Tuesdays, Wednesdays & Thursdays. Remote days are Mondays & Fridays.




This role is paid on a PAYE basis and you'll be entitled to 33 days paid holiday, inclusive of bank holidays, per annum, pro rata.




There is also a company bonus plan that you could be eligible for.




The Opportunity:




Our client, a multinational technology company, is searching for a Data Analyst to join them for a period of 6 months.




The successful candidate will be tasked with contributing to solutions for straightforward problems and executing the solutions to analytical tasks with guidance from more senior analysts or management. You will also drive analyses that are pertinent to the core business priorities and impact decisions with material user implications and revenue at stake, with some guidance from more senior analysts or management.




In return, you can expect to receive an hourly rate of ¬£25 p/h (52k) PAYE.




Your other responsibilities will include but are not limited to:




Escalating unanticipated issues to management.
Partnering with cross-functional teams within Marketing and the business, to develop deeper context to inform analysis.
Providing input to and collaborating closely with junior and mid-level MA counters to better understand data or products.
Adopting best practices for the organisation, collecting and tracking core metrics, and avoiding duplication of existing work.
Developing expertise with broader awareness of other analytical techniques to understand limitations.




About you:




The successful candidate will have extensive experience in the following:

SQL
Strong presentation skills
A good understanding of data extraction, dashboarding/visualisation, experimental design, statistical analysis, basic predictive modelling, and/or qualitative and quantitative research techniques.
Creation of reports, and the ability to present these to senior stakeholders







** Please note, if you have not received a response within 48 working hours, your application has been unsuccessful at this time**




Client Description:

Our Client is a multinational technology company, specialising in Internet-related services and products; including online advertising technologies, search engine, cloud computing, software, and hardware. The atmosphere is relaxed with a diverse and innovative culture. Opportunities for growth and progression and networking with like-minded people across the business and beyond.




Aquent is dedicated to improving inclusivity & is proudly an equal opportunities employer. We encourage applications from under-represented groups & are committed to providing support to applicants with disabilities. We aim to provide reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, to those with a medical condition, disability or neurodivergence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: London

Salary: Up to ¬£70,000 DOE + bonus + company benefits




Forsyth Barnes are excited to be partnered with a fast growing cosmetics company. You will support the team with new product Incubator and Integration function. In this role, you will support the everyone within the business with data insights on the effectiveness of new products as well as quantitative market and competitor analytics. You will work closely with the founders and be a crucial part of the wider business.




Key Responsibilties:




You‚Äôll deliver market and competitive analysis on the cosmetic market and drive product development as well as potential M&A activity within the industry.
You‚Äôll own the entire analytics lifecycle - from opportunity / problem definition to discovery, analysis and data product development.
You‚Äôll build data pipelines or formulate requirements for data engineers.
You‚Äôll support the corporate development function around M&A all the way from sourcing to due diligence and integration.
You‚Äôll drive a culture of data storytelling across the business and the wider analytics department.




Key Requirements:




Numerical/Analytical minded (degree in a numerical subject is ideal).
Minimum 2 years of experience as a data analyst.
Proficient in SQL or Python.
Experience with dashboarding/reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.
Excellent stakeholder and time management skills.
Experience with owning multiple projects from start to finish.




If you‚Äôre interested, please apply by emailing a copy of your most up to date CV and your current availability.




Please feel free to pass this on to anyone you think it may suit/ anyone you know may be interested.




Apologies if this is not wholly relevant, or at the desire level. Please feel free to view all of our jobs at www.forsythbarnes.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join our team. If you are a compassionate, dedicated, and curious individual with excellent organizational skills, a self-motivated nature, and a passion for producing high-quality solutions, we want to hear from you - regardless of your level of experience. As a Junior Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with large data sets, analyze trends, create reports, and provide insights to help the organization make better decisions.




We are looking for candidates who possess the following qualifications:




A 2:1 degree in a field related to data analysis, statistics, mathematics or computer science (preferred, but not required)
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively
A love for problem-solving and the ability to make sense of complex data
Proficiency in tools such as Excel, Python, R or SQL (preferred, but not required)




Benefits




Health insurance
Pension Plan
Flexible work schedules
Professional development opportunities
Employee wellness programs (e.g. gym memberships, on-site fitness classes)
Generous holiday and time off policies
Employee discounts and perks (e.g. discounted products or services, tickets to local events)




Application Instructions




New London HR is a leading recruitment firm, and our clients will be viewing the applications for this role. Don't miss this chance to take the next step in your career. To apply, follow the steps outlined by New London HR. Upon completion of the virtual job specification, you will be able to negotiate salary, location, and company preferences.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Wise is a company that specializes in solving airport business problems and delivering projects from solution design to end user training. We have seen rapid growth in the last four years due to our team's energy, agility, and commitment to doing the right thing.




Our Analytics team helps clients make decisions from their data and our goal is to become experts in the business questions that we help to answer. Instead of relying on endless reporting, we work closely with customers to advise and educate them on targeted data solutions. We work with a variety of tooling and invest time in learning whatever technology is needed.




We are thrilled to be expanding our team and are on the lookout for a talented junior data analyst to join us! As a junior data analyst, you'll have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects and make a real difference. You'll be responsible for analysing data, uncovering insights, and helping drive business decisions.




Responsibilities




Wrangling data from various sources into usable and accessible formats.
Analysing and understanding processes using the data they generate
Reporting on findings in an engaging and understandable way.
Collaborating with the team to prototype tools for analysis of airport processes.




Requirements




Familiarity with SQL and experience querying databases.
Experience in visualising data.
Strong analytical skills and ability to gain insight from complex datasets.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Familiarity with at least one analytical programming language (R, Python, MATLAB etc.)
An interest in logistics and systems for physically moving people or things.
Bonus: experience with unstructured data storage, airport or material handling environment, or a degree in a numerical subject.




Benefits




Access to company pension scheme
Long term sick salary insurance
Free car parking
Laptop
Mobile phone allowance
Christmas Bonus
Access to our on-site spinning and fitness studio
Show more Show less
HTML:
Wise is a company that specializes in solving airport business problems and delivering projects from solution design to end user training. We have seen rapid growth in the last four years due to our team's energy, agility, and commitment to doing the right thing.


Our Analytics team helps clients make decisions from their data and our goal is to become experts in the business questions that we help to answer. Instead of relying on endless reporting, we work closely with customers to advise and educate them on targeted data solutions. We work with a variety of tooling and invest time in learning whatever technology is needed.


We are thrilled to be expanding our team and are on the lookout for a talented junior data analyst to join us! As a junior data analyst, you'll have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects and make a real difference. You'll be responsible for analysing data, uncovering insights, and helping drive business decisions.


Responsibilities


  • Wrangling data from various sources into usable and accessible formats.
  • Analysing and understanding processes using the data they generate
  • Reporting on findings in an engaging and understandable way.

  • An interest in logistics and systems for physically moving people or things.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Profile Summary
Grade IResponsible for supporting the delivery of business analysis and consulting processes and procedures for the defined specialism using basic technical capabilities, developing working relationships to provide support with queries, issues and ad-hoc requests and assisting with quality assurance services. Specialisms: Business Analysis; Data Management and Data Science; Digital Innovation.

Job Advert
Responsibilities

Part of a cross-disciplinary team, working closely with other data analysts, product managers, data scientists, data engineers, software engineers, data managers and business partners
Provide concrete, data-driven business and product insights by combining deep statistical skills, data manipulation capabilities and business insight
Define, instrument and maintain metrics and build dashboards
Proactively identify impactful opportunities and autonomously implement data analysis
Be a bridge between business and digital organizations, combining in-depth understanding of both areas
If needed, build and maintain data pipelines to unblock your analysis
Enforce and advocate for data analytics standard methodologies
Present results to peers and senior management, influencing decision making


Qualifications

Hands-on experience (typically 2+ years) carrying out data analytics, data mining and product analytics in complex, fast-paced environments
Applied knowledge of data analytics and data pipelining tools and approaches across all data lifecycle stages
Thorough understanding of underlying mathematical foundations of statistics, including knowledge of experimental design and analysis and causal inference from observational data
Advanced SQL knowledge
Scripting experience in R or python is helpful
Ability to write and maintain moderately complex data pipelines
Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, and Spark) is a plus
Customer-centric and pragmatic approach. Focus on value delivery and swift execution
Good communication and collaborator management skills. Ability to lead large organizations through influence
Continuous learning and improvement mindset
MSc in a quantitative field, preferably statistics, is advantageous
No prior experience in the energy industry required

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Entity
Customers & Products

Job Family Group
IT&S Group

Relocation available
No

Travel Required
No

Time Type
Full time

Country
United Kingdom

About BP
INNOVATION & ENGINEERING
Join us in creating, growing, and delivering innovation at pace, enabling us to thrive while transitioning to a net zero ‚Äéworld. All without compromising our operational risk management.

Working with us, you can do this by:


deploying our integrated capability and standards in service of our net zero and ‚Äésafety ambitions
driving our digital transformation and pioneering new business models
collaborating to deliver competitive customer-focused energy solutions
originating, scaling and commercialising innovative ideas, and creating ground-breaking new ‚Äébusinesses from them
protecting us by assuring management of our greatest physical and digital risks

Because together we are:


Originators, builders, guardians and disruptors
Engineers, technologists, scientists and entrepreneurs‚Äé
Empathetic, curious, creative and inclusive


Experience Level
Intermediate

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A central member of the EMEA Growth Operations team, the role provides business partners and senior Growth Operation colleagues with support on analysis of sales and client data, ensuring quality of data in our CRM and providing data-backed insights in support of client servicing initiatives. The team enables colleagues to bring the best of Aon to our clients!




This is a hybrid role with the flexibility to work virtually and from an Aon office.




Aon is in the business of better decisions




At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world. As an organisation, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.




What The Day Will Look Like




Sales and pipeline reporting & analytics
Proactively connecting with colleagues across the region to discuss data challenges and seek data quality updates from other teams such as country sales ops and marketing colleagues
Assisting with production of analytics and data-backed insights from different data-sources and ensuring that relevant updates are imported back into the CRM
Building and maintaining dashboards and analyses using data visualisation tools
Developing deep knowledge of data management requirements of different commercial initiatives and contributing to EMEA data strategy




How This Opportunity Is Different




This team empowers leaders to make more informed, insight driven decisions to fuel growth, and delivers advanced analytics that allow us to innovate in how we meet client needs. This role will be central in helping Aon achieve its growth objectives.




Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success




Analytical mindset and strong data management skills with experience in processing, manipulating, analysing and presenting data are essential
Ability to be consultative with strong communication skills both verbal and written. Comfortable leading groups of people in discussion
Ability to work in a team environment and demonstrate ability to form strong relationships with stakeholders of all levels of seniority whether in person, over the phone or via email
Ability to work independently with excellent workload management and able to prioritise effectively, allowing you to develop and improve our processes
A commercial interest: Able to understand the importance of serving clients, delivering profitable growth and capable of thinking globally and acting across business lines.




In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two ‚ÄúGlobal Wellbeing Days‚Äù each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!




Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.




We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com




Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.




NB. Dependent on regional requirements, please include specific benefits where applicable and relevant accommodation criteria and enhanced equal opportunities statement.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Hybrid




About the role:

As a Data Analyst at SamKnows you will work on the internet measurement studies that we run for ISPs and Governments across the world. The reports and outputs from these research projects help to improve the internet for everyone. We use R (including the Tidyverse, Shiny, R Markdown, and custom in-house packages), BigQuery, MySQL databases, Excel for data handling and GitHub for code versioning, so knowledge on any of these would be highly desirable.




SamKnows mission is to provide impartial and accurate data on how the internet really performs so that everyone, everywhere, has access to better, more reliable internet services. We do this by measuring internet performance, analysing the data and providing insights to our customers around the world. Our ideal colleague is someone who is inquisitive, a problem solver, has experience with R, and is comfortable responding to change as we develop continuously.




We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to work within a supportive and growing team to:

Interpret data, quality check datasets, perform statistical analysis, and produce data visualisations for internal and external stakeholders.
Prepare statistical reports, working with analysts and other colleagues.
Ensure that the work being produced follows established standards.
Identify and define opportunities for process improvement and automation.
Work with the Director to prioritise business and information needs.
Be organised, have attention to details, and be curious to ask a lot of questions.




You should have:

Experience using R in a professional setup.
Experience as a data analyst, working with large datasets and preparing detailed reports.
Curiosity to learn more about the internet.
The understanding about statistics to the level of linear regression, confidence intervals, distributions, and sampling.
A keen interest to work in a small but established team, with clients across the globe.




Recruitment process:

Screening Call (20 mins)
Technical Assessment (At-Home Assessment)
Technical Interview (1h)
Cultural Contribution Interview (1h)




What we offer:

Team: Friendly team from all over the globe and a supportive company culture
Environment: Amazing brand new HQ in Bermondsey, includes genderless bathrooms, collaborative and social spaces
Pension: Pension contribution of 5% of your annual salary per year
Sick Pay: Full sick pay for 15 days in any calendar year
Hybrid working: Flexibility to work at home and at the office, allowance of ¬£312 per year for you to spend on your home workstation
Growth: Individualised career plan. And, own your personal development with a ¬£1,500 training budget and 5 training days
Family friendly policies: Enhanced parental leave for birthing and partner parents
Financial support: interest free loans including cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan and discretionary employee loans up to ¬£5,000
Holiday: 25 days holiday each year (pro rata) plus bank holidays. And an extra day off to enjoy your birthday!
Health care: Medical insurance includes cover for dental, optical, private healthcare and mental health care for you, your partner and dependents
Recognition: Company bonus




SamKnows

Founded in 2008, SamKnows is recognised as a leader in internet performance measurement, providing a research and monitoring service for internet, in-home and application performance. Over the last 14 years we have built a global measurement platform, considered vital to governments, ISPs and consumers, especially now. You can find lots of useful information about us at www.samknows.com and we‚Äôd also encourage you to listen to our podcasts and view our Spotlight magazine.

SamKnows welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional needs that require accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Title: Client Data Analyst
Description:
Client Data Analyst | Hybrid working | London - ¬£27,000- ¬£30,000

Y TREE is a rapidly growing FinTech that is re-defining how individuals and families connect and engage with their money. We aim to make personal finance transparent, efficient and meaningful so that our understanding of wealth is re-defined to how we live, not what we own.

Team Overview

Maintaining accurate and up to date data is central to our business, and underpins everything we do for our clients. The Client Data Team is integral to our ability to maintain this data which is used to produce the analysis and in turn, the financial advice at the core of Y TREE.

The Role

To enable us to provide the analysis on their finances, clients entrust us with their confidential and sensitive financial statements accounting for their balance, income, cash flow, and equities. A core responsibility in this role will be to take those statements and ensure the correct data is transferred to our back office system.
You will carry out work for both prospect clients and those who are existing clients for the firm; your work will be central to the trust they build with Y TREE.
As part of the role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with both the Client Onboarding Team and Financial Life Strategy Team to obtain a holistic understanding of the journey of the data you have handled.
This role is a junior level role, but offers you the opportunity to build an understanding of how a financial services firm operates, an understanding of the data we handle and exposure to a variety of departments that are integral to a firm like ours. We really believe in supporting our team grow and develop and see this role as a pathway to progression in a regulated, or non- regulated role.


Requirements

The Technical Part

We don't need you to have any related work history for this role, but we are looking for graduates who have obtained a degree in anything that requires you to work with large sets of data. For example, previous candidates in this role have held degrees in Economics, Maths, Physics and Chemistry.
We will need you to not just tolerate the mathematical element of your degree, but enjoy it. This role requires you to work with large number sets and we would prefer it if this is something you like doing!


The Person

We are much more interested in who you are. This role gives you access to incredibly sensitive client data, so we would like you to be mature and trustworthy in your approach.
The deeper you embed yourself in this role, the more value you can add to our team. For that reason we would like you to be somebody with an inquisitive mind and a thirst for learning- this role can be what you make of it and previous candidates are now obtaining professional qualifications and moving into our Client Adviser career pathway.
As an agile business, we often deliver projects in cross functional teams so we would like you to be warm and engaging, with the ability to build strong, well-rounded relationships.
We are not a big financial institution (yet!) so you will need to be solutions-led and have the impetus and ability to proactively seek answers if you get stuck.
We would like you to have a methodical and detail orientated approach to work- you will be working with data after all!
We work at pace; outcomes are time sensitive so we would like you to be somebody who performs well under pressure.
Our community is where our power lies, so you must be an effective collaborator and confident speaking up and working as part of a small team that is building a business.
We are driving innovation in our area of personal finance and our product is a reflection of our team. We would like for you to be somebody who is intelligent, an independent thinker and somebody who is eager to share ideas.
We operate a very flat heirachy in the business, so we would like you to leave your ego at the door. Those with a people-centred approach are best suited to us and our team.


Benefits

What's in it for you?

The ability to hone your skills and cultivate your craft in a genuinely outcome led, flexible, happy work environment. We have a hybrid working policy and the ability to flex your hours as you need. We are all adults, and we understand work needs to balance your personal life too.
25 days of annual leave per year. This is 25 days each year we expect you to turn your phone off and switch off; we would never ask you to book leave for a doctor's appointment or to see your children's school plays.
Regular team socials to help you switch off from work and get to know your colleagues in an environment away from your desk. We ensure socials are well balanced and offer a variety of activities to suit different needs so you always feel welcome.
A welcoming, dog-friendly London office with appropriate spaces to cater for those with varying needs in the form of various breakout spaces and silent booths.
Support for your mental and physical health in the form of online fitness classes and access to a gym group in London.
A 3% pension contribution to help you save for the future
Family friendly policies


To learn more about Y TREE, our podcast and our events please follow our company LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/y-tree/

Our mission at Y TREE is to build diversity in our teams; diversity of thought, culture, backgrounds and perspectives. Please come as you are and let us know if there are any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you in your application process. Additionally, if you don't feel you meet 100% of the requirements please apply anyway if you feel you can demonstrate your suitability to the role. Please note, sponsorship is not available for this role

  • We are driving innovation in our area of personal finance and our product is a reflection of our team. We would like for you to be somebody who is intelligent, an independent thinker and somebody who is eager to share ideas.
  • We operate a very flat heirachy in the business, so we would like you to leave your ego at the door. Those with a people-centred approach are best suited to us and our team.

Benefits

What's in it for you?
  • The ability to hone your skills and cultivate your craft in a genuinely outcome led, flexible, happy work environment. We have a hybrid working policy and the ability to flex your hours as you need. We are all adults, and we understand work needs to balance your personal life too.
  • 25 days of annual leave per year. This is 25 days each year we expect you to turn your phone off and switch off; we would never ask you to book leave for a doctor's appointment or to see your children's school plays.
  • Regular team socials to help you switch off from work and get to know your colleagues in an environment away from your desk. We ensure socials are well balanced and offer a variety of activities to suit different needs so you always feel welcome.
  • A welcoming, dog-friendly London office with appropriate spaces to cater for those with varying needs in the form of various breakout spaces and silent booths.
  • Support for your mental and physical health in the form of online fitness classes and access to a gym group in London.
  • A 3% pension contribution to help you save for the future
  • Family friendly policies

To learn more about Y TREE, our podcast and our events please follow our company LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/y-tree/

Our mission at Y TREE is to build diversity in our teams; diversity of thought, culture, backgrounds and perspectives. Please come as you are and let us know if there are any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you in your application process. Additionally, if you don't feel you meet 100% of the requirements please apply anyway if you feel you can demonstrate your suitability to the role. Please note, sponsorship is not available for this role

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking exceptional, values-driven graduates to join our team as Data Analysts. If you are a compassionate, dedicated, and detail-oriented individual with excellent organizational skills, a curious and self-motivated nature, and a passion for producing high-quality solutions, we want to hear from you - regardless of your level of experience.




As a Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with data and help organizations make better decisions.




We are looking for candidates who possess the following qualifications:




A 2:1 degree in a field related to analytical focus and data handling, such as STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) (preferred, but not required)
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively
A love for problem-solving and the ability to make sense of complex information
Proficiency in tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Python (preferred, but not required)




Benefits




Health insurance
Pension Plan
Flexible work schedules
Professional development opportunities
Employee wellness programs (e.g. gym memberships, on-site fitness classes)
Generous holiday and time off policies
Employee discounts and perks (e.g. discounted products or services, tickets to local events)




Application Instructions




New London HR is a leading recruitment firm, and our clients will be viewing the applications for this role. Don't miss this chance to take the next step in your career. To apply, follow the steps outlined by New London HR. Upon completion of the virtual job specification, you will be able to negotiate salary, location, and company preferences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.




ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.




ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK's leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketplaces Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on marketplace performance; supporting the commercial and product teams to run experiments and improve UX and monetisation and supporting the marketplaces leadership team in developing the overall strategy.




Responsibilities




Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our commercial team to help them understand the performance of each of our partners
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve the marketplace and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals




Requirements




You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload and that of your team
Previous managerial experience is highly desirable, but not essential
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills




About ClearScore




ClearScore is a workplace like no other. We've spent the past seven years disrupting an entire industry and building a user base of millions. At the heart of this success is our culture, where we work hard, relish change and treat each other with respect‚Äîhelping everyone to reach their potential and deliver results that make a difference. We're on a mission to positively impact the lives of our users. Our product puts their needs at the centre of our thinking. Through cutting-edge tech, insightful analytics and beautiful design we want to help our users build their financial confidence and make better financial decisions. We want our people to perform at their best, so we trust everyone to work in a way that suits them‚Äîfocusing on output, not time spent at a screen. We have an inclusive culture where everyone is encouraged to look after their own wellbeing whilst growing and developing their career. For more information on our tech stack check out our Tech Radar 2022, how we work is summarised in our Engineering Principles and we have many other Tech Blogs on Medium.




Benefits




25 paid holidays and a "duvet day" on your birthday
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Access to Perkbox
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular wellbeing events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives




Inclusion Policy




We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Amnesty International UK (AIUK) has a simple aim: an end to human rights abuses. Independent, international and influential, we campaign for justice, fairness, freedom and truth wherever they are denied. Do you want to use your skills, knowledge and experience to help change the world? You could be our new Data Analyst.




About the role



The Data Analyst is responsible for providing the insight, reporting and learnings to evaluate the effectiveness and inform the direction of Amnesty International UK's marketing and campaigning activities. The role is also responsible for managing the extraction of mailing and other contact data for AIUK's supporter communications.



The Data Analyst is also required to produce reports and dashboards, ensuring that data analysis findings are communicated to key stakeholders across the organisation in an engaging and impactful manner.



We're looking for someone who is passionate about drawing insights from data and is keen to use their analytical skills to maximise the impact of our campaigns to end human rights abuses.



More details can be found by downloading the job description from our careers portal.




The role may be for you if:



You have undertaken analysis and reporting to inform decision making in a fundraising or marketing context
You can develop and maintain reporting and dashboard solutions.
You collaborate and positively contribute to an inclusive culture.
You have a good knowledge of relational databases and a range of data analysis tools and techniques such as SQL, R and Python.
You can inclusively communicate statistical and technical findings in an easy-to-understand manner.


Our Commitment to you



Inclusion, Diversity, Equity, and Anti-Racism (IDEA) are at the core of our values. We want to be an organisation that tackles structural inequality and prejudice as well as be an actively anti-racist organisation. This means taking a meaningful and equitable approach to supporting and developing you and others during your time with us.



New colleagues receive 27 days leave annually (29 after five years), as well as bank holidays (pro rated for part time). 2-5% employee pension contributions are matched at 6-9% and we offer 6 months full pay for family leave. We offer flexible working such as compressed work patterns and job shares. See more details of our benefits here.




Apply for this role



The vacancy may be closed earlier than advertised if a high standard of applications is received. If you wish to be considered for the role, avoid delay in submitting an application.



We welcome applications from everyone and particularly encourage applications from people from an ethnic minority background, and people with a disability to help us achieve a balanced representation in our workforce, especially at senior grades.



To reduce bias in our shortlisting process, AIUK operates an anonymised application process. If for any reason you prefer to apply in a different format, or require adjustments in the process, please get in touch. We are a disability confident organisation. More details of inclusion in the AIUK recruitment process can be found here.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Wise is a company that specializes in solving airport business problems and delivering projects from solution design to end user training. We have seen rapid growth in the last four years due to our team's energy, agility, and commitment to doing the right thing.

Our Analytics team helps clients make decisions from their data and our goal is to become experts in the business questions that we help to answer. Instead of relying on endless reporting, we work closely with customers to advise and educate them on targeted data solutions. We work with a variety of tooling and invest time in learning whatever technology is needed.

We are thrilled to be expanding our team and are on the lookout for a talented junior data analyst to join us! As a junior data analyst, you'll have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects and make a real difference. You'll be responsible for analysing data, uncovering insights, and helping drive business decisions.

Responsibilities

Wrangling data from various sources into usable and accessible formats.
Analysing and understanding processes using the data they generate
Reporting on findings in an engaging and understandable way.
Collaborating with the team to prototype tools for analysis of airport processes.


Requirements

Familiarity with SQL and experience querying databases.
Experience in visualising data.
Strong analytical skills and ability to gain insight from complex datasets.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Familiarity with at least one analytical programming language (R, Python, MATLAB etc.)
An interest in logistics and systems for physically moving people or things.
Bonus: experience with unstructured data storage, airport or material handling environment, or a degree in a numerical subject.


Benefits

Access to company pension scheme
Long term sick salary insurance
Free car parking
Laptop
Mobile phone allowance
Christmas Bonus
Access to our on-site spinning and fitness studio

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Job Type: Permanent

Location: London, United Kingdom

Are you proficient in SQL?

Ready to utilise your experience in the field of data or business analysis?

Join us as a Data Analyst.

Careers at TCS: It means more

TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We don‚Äôt just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide. For you, it means more to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation.

Be exposed to the future of technology.
Work with some of the brightest global minds in the industry.
Support many of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide.

The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with various teams, entail writing requirements for engineering teams, and perform data investigation on reported issues from the various stakeholders. The primary business hours would be during regular business hours, but it may require off hours due to the severity of the issue.

Your Profile

Experience writing functional and technical requirements.
Previous stakeholder engagement in functional/technical data warehouse/data

mark/data/lake teams.

Experience with front-end reporting tools and infrastructure.
Background in data analysis/research.

Good to have:

Knowledge of Snowflake.
Experience in fin tech.

Rewards & Benefits

TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.

Diversity, Inclusion & Wellbeing

At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‚ÄòInclusion without Exception‚Äô.

You‚Äôll find a welcoming culture and many internal volunteering and social networks to join. Our diversity, inclusion and social activities include LGBTQ+ and mental health networks, as well as health and wellness initiatives and sports events (we even sponsor the London Marathon).

TCS celebrates inclusion without exception. We are open to all and treat applications equally, regardless of ethnicity, disability, gender, age, sexual orientation or beliefs.

If you are an applicant who needs an accommodation due to a disability to complete an employment application, or during any phase of the hiring process, please contact us at k.renika3@tcs.com

with the subject line: ‚ÄúDisability Accommodation Request‚Äù.

Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually on the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days, then it should be deemed unsuccessful on this occasion.

Join us and do more of what matters. Apply online now.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst- Ecommerce ( Python/ SQL) Hybrid ( 2-3 days in London office)




A well recognized leading B2B/B2C company based in London. The BI team covers data analysis and insights holistically from advanced analytics to data modelling and state-of-the-art data visualization in order to generate strategic insights that support and drive the business. You will have the chance to work with a fantastic team working in a fun and engaging work environment!

As the Data Analyst you will be responsible for:




Developing actionable insight and communicating key learnings to global business stakeholders
Perform data maintenance, data processes reviews, and data quality checks across CRM systems (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud) and external data source platforms
Develop and maintain business projection models to inform senior stakeholders
Review existing data journeys and data integrity across platforms (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud)
Maintain and support the creation of new data sources and data visualizations (Tableau)
Support the team with regular data transfers and uploads when required
Promote data-informed decision making across key business stakeholders
