Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a recent numerical graduate looking to build on your foundation experience and take the next step to become a data analyst? Do you have a passion for using data to solve problems?




If so, we would like to hear from you; we are a fintech start-up offering a rare development environment working closely with an experienced senior management team.




Opportunity




Reporting directly to the co-founders, you will join an entrepreneurial team in a driven, fast-paced environment. This role is a newly created role responsible for supporting the development and further build-out of our platform integrations which are used to acquire, clean and analyse investment data from a range of UK wealth platforms.




We can offer a challenging and constantly evolving career where you will have an impact and develop new skills and knowledge in software development or data analysis.




About The Role




We offer first-hand experience in obtaining, cleaning, transforming and analysing complex investment data with exposure to various wealth managers and other major financial services clients.




The role will include the following:




Monitoring daily data feeds and handling related data processing tasks
Supporting other developers to add new data feeds and build out API connections
Supporting design, implementation and testing of complex analysis and tax calculations
Attendance at client meetings, pitches and dealing with follow-up
Researching relevant technical issues (e.g. data processing technical solutions, new third-party API specifications and tax or performance analysis-related research)
Assisting with special projects





Additional Information




The position is based in our Soho office.




Salary & Benefits




Basic salary: c.¬£30,000, increasing with progression
Holiday 20 days, increasing with longevity
Axa Private Health
Pension
Discretionary Bonuses
Training / Exam support





Essential Criteria




Recently graduated or demonstrate 1-2 years of relevant experience
Strong analytical skills.
Background with mathematical and/or computer science skills will be an advantage.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python (in particular Pandas)
Unrestricted rights to work in the UK





Desirable Criteria




Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven team player who is happy to adapt to a wide range of roles and deal with clients, third-party developers, platforms and service providers;
Self-starter and able to stay focused and make decisions within the role profile while working towards tight deadlines
Independent/flexible problem-solver with the ability to cope positively with change
Familiarity with AWS an advantage





About The Company




Confidante is a start-up fintech that aims to revolutionise data integration, analysis and tax reporting for high-net-worth clients of wealth managers and accountants by simplifying workflow and reporting.




We are a former Barclays senior leadership team offering a cloud-hosted application which obtains, cleans and conforms data from a wide range of third-party financial institutions and provides wealth managers with consolidated performance, analysis and tax reporting.




Please view our website for more information about our company and philosophy.




Keywords: Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Analytics Manager, Business Intelligence Analyst, Operations Analyst, Research Analyst and Data Manager,




NO AGENCIES PLEASE




We are using Recruitment Rebellion to run and organise the response for this advert. Please do not contact us if you are a recruiter.




Candidates, please do not apply directly to us, as there is a chance your application will be missed if it does not go through the right channel.

Title: Data Analyst - BBC World Service
Description:
Job Introduction




The BBC World Service has partnered with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation in an ambitious project to deliver compelling stories across digital and broadcast platforms on the theme of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) with a specific focus on ten African countries: Nigeria, Kenya, Zambia, Uganda, Ghana, Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Niger, Senegal and Tanzania. We are looking to recruit a data analyst, who will be responsible for producing impact and audience reports, and supporting the smooth and effective running of the partnership project. They will work alongside the production teams in London, Lagos, and Nairobi, and keep abreast of all content produced and published on BBC platforms. They will oversee the social and digital output as well, and help ensure optimum impact and reach for this project. This is a fantastic opportunity for a talented data analyst/impact producer to join the team and create great content.




This is an 18-month fixed term contract. The team is based in London but we would be happy to consider applications from other locations. The BBC is committed to redeploying employees seeking suitable alternative employment within the BBC for different reasons and they will be given priority consideration ahead of other applicants. Priority consideration means for those employees seeking redeployment their application will be considered alongside anyone else at risk of redundancy, prior to any individuals being considered who are not at risk.




Role Responsibility




Monitor and audit the performance of assets which have been published across BBC and social media platforms using such tools as Emplifi, Facebook insights and BBC measurement tools.




Develop and maintain documentation, presenting complex data in accessible formats. This may include the partner‚Äôs custom trackers, internal documentation or project specific detail.




Use social media listening tools such as Brandwatch and Crowdtangle and search data to find the most compelling stories, topics and relevant audience profiles.




Are you the right candidate?




Specific Skills & Experience




Experience of using digital and social media analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Emplifi.
Proficiency in a data wrangling/analysis language e.g. R, Python.
Data visualisation principles and the ability to construct a narrative from data insight.
Ability to work in cross-disciplinary teams, collaborating with a variety of analysts and researchers.
Strong technical aptitude, with an interest in learning/improving programming skills that you will use every day.




Ideal Candidates Will Also Demonstrate Any Of The Following




Familiarity with SQL and data warehouses (e.g. Redshift)
Experience of using digital analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, AT Internet)
Experience with data visualisation tools e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, other
Understanding of media analytics, data, measurement, methodologies and industry standards including online and offline channels
Knowledge and experience of digital media




Package Description




Band: C




Contract type: 18 Months FTC/ Attachment - June 2024




Location: London - NBH, but can be flexible (hybrid working available)




We‚Äôre happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application . There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.




Excellent career progression ‚Äì the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities ‚Äì our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.




About The BBC




We don‚Äôt focus simply on what we do ‚Äì we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you‚Äôve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.




Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.




We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC ‚Äì whether that‚Äôs to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.




We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.




To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here




Attached documents




BBC Values

Excellent communication skills along with experience in stakeholder management are required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Salary: Up to ¬£40,000pa




About the role

The Data Analyst is a critical role within RWS Group Technology as the organization moves towards being more data and analytics driven. This change in organisational construct is driving the need to review, rationalize & refine the currently diverse operating models within the organisation. You will be responsible for defining and governing the group data model, global data catalogue and data management strategy.




You will be seen as a trusted advisor on behalf of data across the organisation with development operations, business applications and IT.




This is a growing team with a high bar in terms of inviting new people to join us. We seek people who will help drive our business forward and challenge norms by striving for more. Aside from your skills and experience, we‚Äôre most interested in your growth mindset and development potential.




This is a full-time role that‚Äôs based in one of our European offices, but we expect to maintain a culture of flexibility and a mix of WFH and office time.







What you‚Äôll do

Work with a vast array of data sources including translation, operational & financial to develop data processes and models which support our insight goals
Develop and maintain our group data model in line with our long-term business objectives
Providing technical leadership and direction for the companies engineering team
Advise on duplications & conflicts within the data models of the RWS Group (originating from the different entities) and identify practical solutions for aligning the data models.
Support the alignment of data governance across the RWS group and enforce through solution reviews and audits
Provide guidance as to how data quality and meta data management should be embedded in business processes & systems
Building effective relationships with senior technical staff so there is a common understanding of goals and challenges







What we‚Äôre looking for

Recent, working experience in a Data Analyst role
Experience with assessing and implementing enterprise-wide meta data management tools, data models and data catalogues
Expertise in SQL & SSIS is essential
Strong English communication skills
An expert understanding of data integration
Knowledge of information principles and policies
Strategic mind-set with the ability to focus on the ‚Äúbigger picture‚Äù
Experience in integrating complex and cross-corporate processes
Analytical skills ‚Äî Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities
Experience with data visualization in a tool such as Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Sisense is a bonus
Experience working with Cloud Based solutions is a bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: West End, London (hybrid working)

Salary: ¬£40000 - ¬£50000 depending on experience

Bonus: 20-30% of salary




Company: Global FinTech SaaS company that works with private equity / credit and real estate investors. They provide data science that provides insights into client‚Äôs portfolios. Investors make important decisions and produce significant returns based on the data from the platform.




Job role: The Data Analyst will provide financial analytics to support clients, including significant focus on financial modelling / statistical analysis for alternative investors & financial services companies, as well as supporting on-going performance reporting and monitoring.




Responsibilities:




Performance Analysis

¬∑ Development of Asset Management analytics across many geographies and asset types

¬∑ Maintenance and on-going development of models used to analyse performance, refine key assumptions, re-forecast cash flows and update valuations

¬∑ Monitor and analyse credit and service performance of portfolio investments, including forecasts and key covenants tests

¬∑ Deliver analytics to support optimisation of performance, aimed at improving returns as well as managing risks

¬∑ Monitor and assist in the preparation of internal / investor reports

Investment Analysis and Transactional Support

¬∑ Build financial models to assess the value and review risk of potential investments, incorporating asset-based cash flow and credit risk analysis

¬∑ Prepare investment analysis, including asset level analysis and risk-based simulations for presentation to internal / external constituents

¬∑ Assist in broader market research and source external benchmark data

Experience:

¬∑ Experience working in the analytics function of a data driven company preferably within the financial services sector.

¬∑ Experience using R and Python to interrogate large datasets and undertake complex behavioural analysis.

¬∑ Hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing statistical models to predict consumer behaviour.

¬∑ Numerical degree, preferably at a Masters level (i.e. mathematics, science, engineering or economics). Batchelor‚Äôs degree will be considered.

¬∑ Development and improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive analysis

¬∑ Data modelling, profiling and cleansing techniques.

¬∑ Experience translating data from multiple sources (from different countries/language) and map them to UK standardised data

Desirable:

¬∑ Familiarity with Microsoft technology stack, including data integration, collaboration and business Intelligence tools and their underlying technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Visual Studio and TFS).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst | London | Hybrid | ¬£40,000 - ¬£45,000 + 15% bonus

Are you looking to take the next step in your career as a Data Analyst?

Do you want to join an established and expanding pharmaceutical distribution company, serving patients globally to ensure they‚Äôre receiving the medicines they require?

Do you want to be a part of an organisation that is working on greenfield projects?




What you‚Äôll be doing:

üí• You‚Äôll be joining a newly formed data governance team ‚Äì a chance to grow into this role and make it your own

üí• Supporting the business with their data quality ‚Äì identifying the gaps and providing solutions

üí• Working closely with the Data Quality Manager & stakeholders to promote best practices & recommendations




What you‚Äôll need:

‚úÖ 2-3 years‚Äô commercial experience as a data quality analyst / data analyst

‚úÖ Hands on experience working with SQL & data viz tools (e.g Power BI)

‚úÖ Understanding of data quality & best practices

‚úÖ Experience with Alteryx or equivalent is a plus!




What to expect in return:

‚ö°Ô∏è Flexible hybrid working model ‚Äì 2 days a week to the London office

‚ö°Ô∏è Learning & development ‚Äì you‚Äôll have time spent during the week for upskilling

‚ö°Ô∏è A base salary ranging from ¬£40,000 - ¬£45,000 + 15% bonus

‚ö°Ô∏è Juicy benefits like 27 days holidays + 4.5% pension match




Next steps:

Hit apply and we‚Äôll be in touch to go through your experience and discuss the opportunity & client in more detail with you.

As an employer and service provider, we are committed to Equity, Equality, Diversity and Inclusion. Please feel comfortable to let us know if you have a difference or disability that would require us or our clients to make any helpful adjustments for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




264662BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you an analytical thinker and data-driven problem-solver? Do you know how to gather and translate business requirements, working with large risk datasets and own these solutions through to implementation? Would you like to work in a truly collaborative environment to find effective and efficient solutions to the reporting needs of our risk business?




We are looking for a Data Analyst like you to:





capture and translate the risk reporting requirements we need to meet regulatory and business change initiatives
work with key stakeholders such as IT, data owners, risk reporting officers & associates plus our business sponsors to create high quality reports and dashboards
provide innovative, robust solutions which contain clear insight and highlights reflecting the status and/or changes in our risk
create the sub-tasks needed to deliver these reporting solutions, allocate the tasks to the appropriate teams and then track to completion
support our business to embed these solutions into live and ensure that we are achieving the full business value from these reports and dashboards
drive standardization, automation and continuous improvements of data collection, analysis, and reporting processes





Your team





you will be working as part of a global team responsible for providing reporting analysis to our business colleagues
you‚Äôll be part of the newly created Agile pods and have the opportunity to play a critical role in enabling the high-paced Agile transformation
our team is part of the wider Group Risk Control organization and is an agent of change for our Risk Control colleagues. We are a diverse team of specialists with different backgrounds and we enjoy finding and implementing first-rate solutions for our business





Your expertise





degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Technology or equivalent
ideally 5 years of experience working in a similar role within the banking industry, preferably in credit and/or market risk
proven experience using Business Intelligence and reporting software and data visualization (e.g. Power BI, MicroStrategy, Tableau)
technical skills are an advantage, including Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Experience with SQL, Python or similar languages
confident communicator able to convey information and ideas clearly, good at building relationships across geographically distributed teams
strong customer focus and passion to enable data-driven decision-making and improvements
effective time management and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously
attention to detail along with structured organization and planning skills





About Us




UBS is the world‚Äôs largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we‚Äôre more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: HR & Payroll Data Analyst

Location: UK - Remote

Salary: ¬£60,000

Contract: 6 month FTC to Perm

Job Summary

We are looking for an experienced HR & Payroll Data Analyst to join an established Accountancy firm, based in the UK. The primary purpose of the role is to provide accurate and effective analysis, reports, and data solutions to the companys HR and payroll teams.

Job Description

The HR & Payroll Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting data, and providing reports and data solutions to the HR and payroll teams. The HR & Payroll Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting data audits, monitoring and benchmarking data trends, and creating data dashboards and reports. The role requires a technical understanding of HR and payroll processes, as well as an in-depth knowledge of data analysis.

Responsibilities

Collect, analyse, and interpret data from the HR and payroll departments.

Conduct data audits and perform data validations.

Monitor and benchmark data trends and make recommendations for improvements.

Develop data solutions, dashboards, and reports for HR and payroll teams.

Identify and resolve data discrepancies.

Assist with the preparation of management reports.

Work with HR and payroll teams to develop data solutions.

Keep up to date with industry trends and best practices.

Requirements

Bachelors degree in a relevant field.

Minimum Of 5 Years Experience In a Similar Role.

In-depth knowledge of HR and payroll processes.

Proven experience in data analysis.

Excellent problem-solving skills.

Strong organisational and communication skills.

Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Knowledge of SQL and Tableau is desirable.

If you are interested in this role, please apply for immediate consideration and interview, and to receive further details about the role.

JGA Recruitment Group Ltd("We") are committed to equality of opportunity for all applications regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

We are also committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. We are a specialist Payroll and HR recruitment agency and recruitment business as defined in the Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses Regulations 2003 (our business).

These statements together with our privacy notices set out the basis on which any personal data we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst¬†| London


Role¬†




We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team to drive the Data Strategy of a major retail chain. In addition of hands-on developments, the successful candidate will be directly involved in shaping the data strategy of one of the biggest retailers in Europe and will be working in collaboration with other engineers to define and scope ambitious and long-term data analysis projects including Machine Learning projects.¬†




Responsibilities:

Compute synthetic statistics to support specific business decisions
Develop and maintain automated dashboards to deliver data insights
Perform targeted studies and analysis to support business decision-making
Deliver actionable insights based on the analysis performed
Translate customer requirements into well-defined data analysis projects
Clean and manipulate large and complex datasets
Perform statistical analysis and modelling to identify trends and patterns in data
Communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders and make recommendations for action
Collaborate with other teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and new technologies to support data analysis efforts




Requirements¬†




Strong experience with SQL
Good programming and scripting skills, preferably using Python¬†
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects at once
Ability to transform complex multidimensional data into synthetic metrics for the use of business decision makers
Nice-to-have: Experience with Data and AI applications in the retail industry
Experience with large datasets (TBs)




Company¬†




Founded by two machine learning experts (Cambridge-EBI PhD and Mila PhD) and a former industry executive, J2-Reliance is an R&D consultancy with an obsession for transforming data and technologies into business and societal value. We are experts in identifying what and how cutting-edge technologies from various research fields can be leveraged to solve complex problems. We develop and deploy the corresponding solutions end-to-end.¬†




In the retail space, we have successfully applied Transformers to the development of powerful recommender systems, and we have built deep learning models for demand forecasting in complex business contexts. Building up on this success, we have been selected to be a strategic partner for a leading retail franchise with a three-year mandate to lead the Data strategy and developments centred on core missions: product recommendation, supply chain optimisation and pricing optimisation.




Outside the retail sector we are supporting multiple tech start-ups and leading Machine Learning projects in the pharmaceutical and biotech sector.¬†




Why Join Us




Freedom to express tech and scientific creativity and work on an ambitious project¬†
Contributing to a young fast-growing product
Opportunity to see your work deployed in production¬†
Collaborative environment and mentorship from experienced scientists and engineers
Taking part in the long-term development of a young company¬†




Contact¬†

Damien Arnol¬†¬†- damien.arnol@j2reliance.co.uk¬†

https://www.linkedin.com/in/damien-arnol-27620368/

http://www.j2reliance.co.uk

Data Analyst | London

Role 


We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team to drive the Data Strategy of a major retail chain. In addition of hands-on developments, the successful candidate will be directly involved in shaping the data strategy of one of the biggest retailers in Europe and will be working in collaboration with other engineers to define and scope ambitious and long-term data analysis projects including Machine Learning projects. 


Responsibilities:

  • Compute synthetic statistics to support specific business decisions
  • Develop and maintain automated dashboards to deliver data insights
  • Perform targeted studies and analysis to support business decision-making
  • Deliver actionable insights based on the analysis performed

  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

  • Ability to transform complex multidimensional data into synthetic metrics for the use of business decision makers

Company 


Founded by two machine learning experts (Cambridge-EBI PhD and Mila PhD) and a former industry executive, J2-Reliance is an R&D consultancy with an obsession for transforming data and technologies into business and societal value. We are experts in identifying what and how cutting-edge technologies from various research fields can be leveraged to solve complex problems. We develop and deploy the corresponding solutions end-to-end. 


In the retail space, we have successfully applied Transformers to the development of powerful recommender systems, and we have built deep learning models for demand forecasting in complex business contexts. Outside the retail sector we are supporting multiple tech start-ups and leading Machine Learning projects in the pharmaceutical and biotech sector.

A bit about us...




At Chumley, we are working hard to scale an industry-leading Proptech platform. Recently celebrating 12 months since our launch, and having completed over 80,000 jobs. We are now moving onto phase 3 of our Road Map.




Our digital squad of 22, is made up of Product Owners, Designers and Developers, and aiming to double in size within the next 6 months.




We are very proud to have a well-balanced team, made up of characters from 14 different nations. Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst

Salary: From ¬£24,000 per annum negotiable depending on experience

Contract: Fixed Term Contract (9 months) .05 FTE (part time)

Location: Hybrid - flexibility to work from home or at any of our main hubs (London, Bristol, Manchester and Harwell)




Jisc is the UK higher, further education and skills sectors‚Äô not-for-profit organisation for digital services and solutions. We believe education and research improves lives, and technology improves education and research.







Our vision is for the UK to be a world leader in technology for education and research and our mission is to power and empower our members with the technology and data they need to succeed. We know that digital technology has the ability to transform the student experience. We have the experience, expertise and know-how to drive that transformation.







At Jisc, everyone plays a key role and gets the chance to feel part of it, that to us is the definition of a meaningful career. We want to create a culture of lifelong learning. You can look forward to a rewarding job with opportunities to develop and make a real difference to the education and research sectors.







We celebrate diversity, embrace our differences and know that this is critical for our success. We work hard to make sure we‚Äôre inclusive and we are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. So, if you are great at what you do and share our values, we want to hear from you.




About the role:

The purpose of this role is to support the Intelligence and Analytics team to gather, analyse and present data to effectively benchmark, analyse, and monitor the Licensing portfolio to enable presentation to Digital Resources Senior Leadership Team and with other areas of Jisc; drive and inform licensing negotiations; and inform, support, and provide value to our members.







Responsibilities will include:

Work as part of the Intelligence and Analytics team to prototype, develop, launch, maintain and enhance a portfolio of licensing data analytics products that are quality assured, user focused, automated, reliable and secure
Work closely with the Data Analysts, to understand project aim, product vision and timescales and to contribute to sprint backlogs that are understood by everyone, and deliver discrete increments of the project and product
Creating statistically valid, user friendly visualisations and dashboards
Explore opportunities for improved collection, analysis, use and presentation of data and information, both within and without Digital Resources, including identifying where data is missing, needed and how to or who to collect it from







Key Skills and Experience:

Excellent organisational, analytical, problem solving and time-management skills and is detail-focused
Strong IT skills, including MS Office suite or similar, particularly Excel
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal such as creating clear documentation and reports
Experience in gathering data and information using surveys or other routes
Experience of combining and analysing data using software such as MS Excel
Experience of presenting and summarising data and information in written and/or visual ways through tools such as MS PowerPoint or other graphical software







Please refer to the job description for full details.







Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement?

We know that sometimes people can be put off applying for a job if they think they can‚Äôt tick every box but we realise the ‚Äòperfect candidate‚Äô doesn‚Äôt exist. So, if you can do most of what we‚Äôre looking for, go ahead and apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!







Why work at Jisc:

At Jisc we believe a balance between your personal and professional life is essential to your happiness and fulfilment. We work flexibly at Jisc and focus on outputs rather than presenteeism and are open to a whole range of ways of working. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life.







We offer hybrid working and although the majority of our staff work from home, getting face to face is something we value and find time for when we can. If you prefer an office environment all our hubs are open and offer a great space to work.







Our benefits are great too. We offer:

Flexible work pattern, which can adapt to suit your schedules and personal commitments
28 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) and an additional three closure days over Christma
A generous pension scheme with above average employer contributions
A range of leave options, including parental leave, volunteer leave and even career breaks.
A generous budget to attend conferences and in-person training
Allocated allowance of up to ¬£250 to equip your home office
A company culture which supports and promotes personal learning and development, including access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning
Mental health first aid trained staff and supportive environment, plus your own Wellbeing allowance to spend on wellbeing for you
Financial well-being support
Discounts on big-name high-street stores
Cycle to work scheme
Employee recognition awards and travel loans







Equality, diversity and inclusion

At Jisc, we strive to be best in practice and are working hard to achieve progressive change. ‚ÄòAlways inclusive‚Äô is one of our six guiding principles - a principle which actively encourages acceptance of differences within individuals.







We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, neurodivergence, trans status, veteran status or gender identity.







Application process:

Please do let us know what reasonable adjustments you need made to the application or selection process so you can do your best. We will be happy to help you.







Just so you know, we review CVs as we receive them, and interview as soon as we have applications that look like a good match (usually within a week). We don‚Äôt use closing dates. So, please apply as soon as possible to avoid missing out on this role. We advertised this role on 24/01/2023

HTML:
Junior Data Analyst

Salary: From ¬£24,000 per annum negotiable depending on experience

Contract: Fixed Term Contract (9 months) .05 FTE (part time)

Location: Hybrid - flexibility to work from home or at any of our main hubs (London, Bristol, Manchester and Harwell)


Jisc is the UK higher, further education and skills sectors‚Äô not-for-profit organisation for digital services and solutions. We believe education and research improves lives, and technology improves education and research.



Our vision is for the UK to be a world leader in technology for education and research and our mission is to power and empower our members with the technology and data they need to succeed. We know that digital technology has the ability to transform the student experience. We have the experience, expertise and know-how to drive that transformation.



At Jisc, everyone plays a key role and gets the chance to feel part of it, that to us is the definition of a meaningful career. We want to create a culture of lifelong learning. You can look forward to a rewarding job with opportunities to develop and make a real difference to the education and research sectors.



We celebrate diversity, embrace our differences and know that this is critical for our success. We work hard to make sure we‚Äôre inclusive and we are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. So, if you are great at what you do and share our values, we want to hear from you.


About the role:

The purpose of this role is to support the Intelligence and Analytics team to gather, analyse and present data to effectively benchmark, analyse, and monitor the Licensing portfolio to enable presentation to Digital Resources Senior Leadership Team and with other areas of Jisc; drive and inform licensing negotiations; and inform, support, and provide value to our members.



Responsibilities will include:

  • Work as part of the Intelligence and Analytics team to prototype, develop, launch, maintain and enhance a portfolio of licensing data analytics products that are quality assured, user focused, automated, reliable and secure
  • Work closely with the Data Analysts, to understand project aim, product vision and timescales and to contribute to sprint backlogs that are understood by everyone, and deliver discrete increments of the project and product
  • Creating statistically valid, user friendly visualisations and dashboards
  • Explore opportunities for improved collection, analysis, use and presentation of data and information, both within and without Digital Resources, including identifying where data is missing, needed and how to or who to collect it from



Key Skills and Experience:

  • Excellent organisational, analytical, problem solving and time-management skills and is detail-focused
  • Strong IT skills, including MS Office suite or similar, particularly Excel
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal such as creating clear documentation and reports
  • Experience in gathering data and information using surveys or other routes
  • Experience of combining and analysing data using software such as MS Excel
  • Experience of presenting and summarising data and information in written and/or visual ways through tools such as MS PowerPoint or other graphical software



Please refer to the job description for full details.



Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement?

We know that sometimes people can be put off applying for a job if they think they can‚Äôt tick every box but we realise the ‚Äòperfect candidate‚Äô doesn‚Äôt exist. So, if you can do most of what we‚Äôre looking for, go ahead and apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!



Why work at Jisc:

At Jisc we believe a balance between your personal and professional life is essential to your happiness and fulfilment. We work flexibly at Jisc and focus on outputs rather than presenteeism and are open to a whole range of ways of working. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life.



We offer hybrid working and although the majority of our staff work from home, getting face to face is something we value and find time for when we can. If you prefer an office environment all our hubs are open and offer a great space to work.



Our benefits are great too. We offer:

  • Flexible work pattern, which can adapt to suit your schedules and personal commitments
  • 28 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) and an additional three closure days over Christma
  • A generous pension scheme with above average employer contributions
  • A range of leave options, including parental leave, volunteer leave and even career breaks.
  • A generous budget to attend conferences and in-person training
  • Allocated allowance of up to ¬£250 to equip your home office
  • A company culture which supports and promotes personal learning and development, including access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning
  • Mental health first aid trained staff and supportive environment, plus your own Wellbeing allowance to spend on wellbeing for you
  • Financial well-being support
  • Discounts on big-name high-street stores
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Employee recognition awards and travel loans



Equality, diversity and inclusion

At Jisc, we strive to be best in practice and are working hard to achieve progressive change. ‚ÄòAlways inclusive‚Äô is one of our six guiding principles - a principle which actively encourages acceptance of differences within individuals.



We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, neurodivergence, trans status, veteran status or gender identity.



Application process:

Please do let us know what reasonable adjustments you need made to the application or selection process so you can do your best. We will be happy to help you.



Just so you know, we review CVs as we receive them, and interview as soon as we have applications that look like a good match (usually within a week). We don‚Äôt use closing dates. So, please apply as soon as possible to avoid missing out on this role. We advertised this role on 24/01/2023

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Does working for Multi-National Lottery Operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy sound like the perfect place of employment for you?

Over the next two years we are going to embark on a large-scale transformation journey, unparalleled in the existing market, and a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for anyone both within and outside the betting and gaming industry. They can‚Äôt talk too much about their plans ‚Äì you‚Äôll have to speak to us to find out more ‚Äì but they can promise a fast-paced, exciting environment, innovative projects like none you have worked on before, and the opportunity to transform a core pillar of the UK economy, while contributing to good causes that benefit society.




Job Description:

Data Analyst - Full Time - Hybrid










Join our journey to create a new experience for the National Lottery and help us to power change for the greater good.

About us:

Allwyn UK is part of Allwyn Entertainment Group ‚Äì a multi-national lottery operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy. In 2022, Allwyn was selected in a Government tender as the Preferred Applicant to operate the UK‚Äôs National Lottery from February 2024.




Over the next two years we are embarking on a largescale transformation journey to build a bigger, better and safer National Lottery that delivers more money to Good Causes. Once-in-a-lifetime opportunities exist for people from within and outside the betting and gaming industry to join us play a part in giving the National Lottery a fresh start




Role Purpose:

Working in the Commercial team that are data and insight driven ‚Äì proactively supporting all team members across the product team and working closely with the Consumer Insights Manager. Also working as part of the wider team executing on the Transition plan for Consumer Insights.

This role will be focused on data analysis for product but may at times be asked to support analysis needs for other areas such as marketing, CRM and digital.

This role will have functional reporting into the Consumer Insights Manager and subject matter reporting into the Head of Product, working closely with the team of Product Managers.




Role Responsibilities:

Analyse a broad array of data points from internal and external sources related to Company IP, Product and Library Assets
Combine and analyse data sets to gain insights into the National Lottery product portfolio and sales performance
Respond to insight queries from the product team
Present analytical outputs to key stakeholders, taking complex information and communicating it as clear and actionable insights.
Execute aspects of quantitative and qualitative research where required, including questionnaire design and development
Proactively analyse research findings to develop Allwyn UK friendly internal reports for both quantitative and qualitative reporting, using a story-based reporting approach
Support product lifecycle research programs to ensure product and planned marketing campaigns will resonate with relevant target audiences
Ensure highest level of data quality and validation




Key Measures of Success:

Respond to queries within the agreed timeframe
Provide high quality outputs with digestible summaries and recommendations
High quality of data visualisation
Proactive approach to data analysis with insights and recommendations actively raised to the team
Support the business planning process with insights, modelling and forecasting inputs
Work closely with other Consumer Insights team members to develop internal qualitative and quantitative best practices




Key Skills and Experience:

Experience with application development is a plus
Experience in using either: SPSS, SAS, SQL
Experience in manipulating data in excel and using other platforms e.g. Tableau
Bachelor‚Äôs degree from a recognized university, Master‚Äôs degree/MBA strongly preferred
3 + years of relevant job experience working in areas of data analysis
Ability to understand and translate technical, numerical data
Experience in data analysis for product development and management
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry a plus, with a preference on gambling
Consumer research or research agency experience a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Largely Remote Working - 1/2 days travel to London per Quarter




My client, a leading Utilities company, have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join their team and provide data driven insights, driving quality, growth and reporting in the business. This is a great opportunity to join a highly motivated, supportive, and experienced team in a role that provides a high degree of project accountability and ownership.




This role will be integral to their continued growth and development as a brand. You will need to work with all business departments and levels of management, to create and develop our internal quality reporting, presenting and working with internal departments to identify and manage data quality across multiple systems while also developing and providing reporting focused on data driven insights.




Their infrastructure modernisation over the last couple of years meant moving to Microsoft Azure where we use Azure Services such as VM Hosting, Azure APIM, Logic Apps and Web Apps. Capacity improvements have facilitated growth of IT services and their upcoming milestone is to improve the quality of the data in our CRM and finance systems, reporting and insights.




Initial focus will be on 3 core areas:

Consolidation and improvement of internal reports and Ad Hoc reports
Data import quality
CRM data improvements




Key experience from previous roles would include:

Previous experience with ETL processes and data cleansing
Experience of data gathering, documenting, analysing, and reporting
Experience using large relational databases
Experience providing data insights and interpretations to senior managers to support the decisions and business strategies




Technical Skills Required:

Transact-SQL including Stored Procedures and Functions
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience enforcing data quality
ETL processes
Data cleansing




If you are a self-starter who is exciting by the prospect of taking ownership and responsibility for a range of business critical projects, coupled with a passion for Data Technology (specifically within Microsoft stack) then please get in touch ASAP with your CV

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analytical Innovator

Location: London / Hybrid

Engagement Type: Permanent / 12 Month FTC

Salary: ¬£45,000 plus excellent benefits

Job Summary

Are you someone who loves playing with data to find innovative solutions for insight outputs? Were looking for an innovative data analyst who can transform our offline analytical pathways and insight outputs for our standardised research objectives into an improved version on an analytical platform we use; Diplayr. This will be a 12 month permanent or fixed term contract role.

The role will be to own project delivery of templating the data analysis by research objective with two key objectives:

Enhance the synthesisations of data by identifying and implementing opportunities for increased innovative ways of combining data sets for meaningful synthesisations and visualisations of insight
Identify automation opportunities and enable within the development of templates

Responsibilities

Youll be running each research objective through Displayr with using our standardised framework and enhancing the outputs.
Well have data thats gone through our standardised process for you to use to enable an analytical pathway through Displayr that can be used on every standardised project by our strategists.
Youll digitalise our analytical pathways onto Displayr, enhance them in the process for improved end outputs and visualisations, and automate as much as possible.
Youll need to own and deliver this project for 11 research objectives, reporting into the Head of Product Development, and working with stakeholders in the business to ensure usability of the end product.

Minimum Requirements

Experience or an understanding of market research, consumer insight or similar
2+ years of working with data in innovative ways or proof of applying your skills with data analysis
Data synthesisation analytics and data visualisation skills. Youve turned data into meaningful insight by combining data sets and/or using data visualisation to create insightful meaning from data
Experience of creating standardised data analytical models, frameworks and charting templates for automation/repeated use
Project management of full cycle/end to end analytical projects (innovation projects a plus)
Experience with Displayr or a similar analytical platform is highly preferred
Experience applying an automated lens to build out digitalised data synthesisation pathways is preferred
R code skills are a plus (Displayr is created with R code, it is not needed to use Displayr, but helps when innovating in Displayr)

Benefits

Competitive base salary - we know youre worth it!
Flexible Hybrid Working- to maximise your productivity and happiness around your life commitments
25 days annual leave- we all need to re-charge our batteries
4 Non Sick Wellness days -1 per quarter-your wellbeing matters
Your birthday off -Go and celebrate! Its your birthday after all
Company Pension- your future is important to us
Company Bonus Scheme we appreciate your hard work
Private Healthcare your health comes first
Cycle to Work Scheme
Health and financial wellbeing discounts to help with every day life
Extensive L&D program- everyone should develop new skills and be given the tools and knowledge to succeed
Wellbeing Weekly - weekly tips and advice on self-care and wellbeing
WOW Awards- your peers want to shout out about how awesome you are!
Company Socials- we like to have fun!

Title: Data Insight Analyst ‚Äì Asset Management ‚Äì up to ¬£65,000 + Bonus
Description:
Do you know the basics about bonds, loans, credit default swaps and other fixed income products?




Add to that your knowledge of Tableau and SQL and you‚Äôve got the making for your next position. You‚Äôre not expected to be the finished article and your learning and development will be a large focus here. Over time, you‚Äôll become an expert with fixed income data and data analysis/insight in general.




You‚Äôll be working closely with the front office of the business, creating a range of dashboards using Tableau to provide all kinds of insight around the fixed income markets. Requirements will vary and you will gather them directly from various stakeholders within the business. Sometimes all you‚Äôll need to use is Tableau, whereas other may require slightly more data manipulation, giving you more exposure to Python, SQL and Snowflake.




You will of course get the training that you need across the asset class and technology.




With this role sitting within the business arm rather than technology, you‚Äôll have great exposure to the front office, often seen as the most exciting part of financial firms. Of course, when you need technical help or training, the technology side of the business will be there to lend a hand.




In terms of your experience, you‚Äôll need to have experience in another data analytics position, using Tableau. Python and SQL skills would be a huge plus, as would any prior exposure to Tableau.




The culture here is changing and with that you‚Äôll only need to come to the office to work twice a week as a minimum. Starting salary will be up to ¬£65,000 plus a performance related bonus and a range of benefits.




Want to learn all about fixed income investments? Get in touch.




No up-to-date CV required.

Title: Data Analyst (Renewables)
Description:
London, UK /




Octopus Energy UK üá¨üáß ‚Äì Data /




Full-time




/ Hybrid







Help us make a big green dent in the universe. We're on a mission to drive the global renewable energy revolution, and we need loads more people to help us make our vision a reality.




Octopus buys power directly from wind, solar and hydro sites all over the UK (and soon all over the world). This allows us to supply our customers with green electricity, straight from the source.




We‚Äôre looking for an Analyst to support us as we sign contracts to buy power from more and bigger renewable generators. This Analyst will lead on pricing, risk management and performance monitoring. This will all be done with a view to paying a fair price to renewable generators, and delivering green electricity to Octopus customers at the lowest possible cost.




The ideal candidate will have a passion for using data to enable the transition to renewable energy. And will be comfortable with all the moving parts and complexity that come with the energy industry.




This role will sit within the Octopus Energy Procurement team. However, this is not a typical Energy Procurement team. Instead of working in large, siloed teams, our trading, risk, forecasting and data science functions work closely together. We use technology to maintain a lean operation as the company grows. We focus on the big problems and give people the autonomy and resources to find innovative solutions.




What You'll Do




Create processes to track performance from contracting through to delivery, identifying areas for improvement.
Quantify and categorise risks in Octopus‚Äôs renewable energy origination processes.
Improve and maintain pricing tools, taking risks and historical performance into account.
Develop custom pricing proposals that are mutually beneficial to Octopus and renewable generators.
Work with the Forecasting Team to help Improve and maintain models for forecasting wind, solar and hydro generation at the level of the individual site.
Support the development of innovative commercial structures between Octopus's supply business and Octopus Energy GenerationDevelop alerting for generator outages or reduced performance.
Work with other teams at Octopus, including Strategy, Finance, Generation, Business, Hydrogen and many more.
Support Octopus businesses in other countries by sharing experience and best practices.




What You'll Need




Passion for renewables and the energy transition.
Desire to explore complex systems and an ability to learn fast.
Ability to communicate complicated concepts in a way that everyone can understand.
Commercial awareness and financial literacy to identify and understand the problems that need solving.
Comprehensive knowledge of data design, data modelling, data management and data visualisation.
Experience with a scripting language (ideally Python).Experience writing complex queries in SQL, analysing large datasets and building reports and dashboards.




If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.




Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Trust Payments have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the team.




Location: London

Salary: Competitive + Benefits




About Us:

¬†

Trust Payments is a global unified payment technology group that was formed in 2019 bringing together technology and financial services into an omnichannel solution. The new business model has enabled Trust Payments to establish itself as a leading Fintech Payments group.




Data Analyst - The Role:




Trust Payments is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst to support the efforts of the Data-Analytics Team.




This role will suit a candidate with exceptional Analytical skills and strong Communication & Interpersonal skills.




The chosen candidate will be tasked with creating KPI‚Äôs, dashboards and various analytical reports, while also analysing data and providing meaningful insights to both internal and external stakeholders.







Data Analyst ‚Äì Key Responsibilities:




- Interpret data and analyse results using statistical and analytical techniques

- Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources

- Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

- Build and publish effective Business Intelligence solutions and Analytical visualizations for end users in Tableau/QuickSight or equivalent

- Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize data efficiency and quality

- Perform detailed data analysis (i.e., determine the structure, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems and data samples)

- Querying databases and manipulating data using SQL, Excel, Tableau, QuickSight or equivalent




Data Analyst ‚Äì You:




- Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst

- Working knowledge of reporting/analytical platforms such as Tableau, QuickSight or equivalent

- Passionate about data visualization

- Advanced Excel knowledge (Pivots, Formulas etc)

- Analytical skills with good attention to detail

- Excellent knowledge of relational/non-relational Database and Data warehouse concepts and technologies

- Experience in SQL, PostgreSQL, or equivalent scripting languages

- Knowledge in data modelling and segmentation techniques will be considered an asset

- Programming knowledge (C#, Python, R, XML, JS etc.) will be considered an asset

- Knowledge of Salesforce CRM system and/or Omnipay processing platform will be considered an asset

- Experience in Statistical Analysis will be considered an asset




Data Analyst ‚Äì Benefits:

¬†

- Opportunity to be part of a rapidly scaling and market leading Fintech business

- Health and Wellbeing ethos including regular wellness sessions, fitness and nutrition and other events as well as supported by internally qualified mental health first aiders

- Family friendly enhanced benefits/policies

- Pension, Healthcare, Life Assurance

¬†

We understand the value that a diverse and inclusive working environment brings to Trust Payments. We celebrate the differences that people can bring through their cultures, backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other protected characteristic.

¬†

During the recruitment process we welcome you to inform us confidentially of any special adjustments required in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience.




To submit your CV for this exciting Data Analyst opportunity, please click ‚ÄòApply‚Äô now!

¬†

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Busuu is one of the top EdTech companies in the world and has won numerous awards for its innovation and impact in language learning.




Busuu‚Äôs vision is to empower everyone in the world through languages. We are the world‚Äôs largest online community for language learning, with more than 120+ million users from 190 countries, growing at up to 20,000 new users per day. We make learning a language easy by combining AI-powered courses with instant feedback from our global community of native speakers and live tutoring from qualified teachers across the world. We also work with over 500 organisations around the world (like Inditex, Puma, Alstom etc) to provide effective language learning for their employees.




In January 2022, Busuu was acquired by one of the largest EdTech companies in the world, Chegg (NYSE:CHGG). Being part of Chegg will help us to accelerate our growth and achieve our vision even faster.




If you are interested in EdTech and want to be a part of a mission-driven organisation then we would like to hear from you.




What does a Data Analyst do at Busuu?




We‚Äôre looking for someone to drive analysis within our marketing team, ensuring channel owners are armed with the information they need to improve performance. You will derive insights from large datasets and work collaboratively with different areas of the team (e.g. performance marketing or CRM campaigns) to inform our marketing strategy and daily decision making.




Example Projects And Initiatives Could Include




Determining which audience/customer segments to target based on LTV potential, and which paid media or brand marketing activity will help us acquire them in the most efficient way
Calculating the effect of paid marketing on our organic acquisition
‚ÄúWhat if‚Äù incrementality analysis to quantify the impact of our discounting strategies
Collaborating with acquisition managers to setup and measure effective creative testing across paid social channels, like Facebook or TikTok




What We‚Äôre Looking For In a Data Analyst




3+ years (or equivalent) of experience in an analytics / data science role
Knowledge of SQL and Excel, and BI platforms such as Tableau
Familiarity with digital marketing concepts such as attribution, and relevant marketing metrics and KPIs
Familiarity with marketing platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads and Adjust
Tag/event/conversion management across marketing platforms a plus
Ability to interpret complex data sets and come up with, and communicate, actionable recommendations
Comfortable working in a fast paced start-up environment
A strong degree in a STEM subject, marketing, business or other related discipline




At Busuu we want to ensure that you have access to some great benefits:




Our centrally located offices are well-equipped with free breakfast, plenty of snacks, fresh fruit, and free dinner of your choice if you need to stay late
Busuu offers a great Private Health Insurance scheme
There is a personal training budget just for you, so you can learn more in your field to ensure our employees can continuously grow and progress in their careers
We like to support our teams with their work-life balance so we offer flexible working hours and a hybrid model of working
We offer enhanced maternity and paternity leave
Staying connected as a team is very important to us, so we have lots of social activities for you to join such a team lunches, socials, quarterly team, and company events




What Happens Next




We aim to have a simple and speedy hiring process and we want to make sure that we are right for you as much as the other way around.




CV application review - We will review it as quickly as possible and update on the next steps
Let‚Äôs chat - Quick chat with our recruiter about your experience and the role
Exercise - 1 hour exercise with the hiring manager to evaluate your data skills and marketing know-how
Meet the team - meetings with the wider team in our Madrid office




Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. We pride ourselves on embracing our differences, whether they're cultural, racial, religious or otherwise. This means each one of us comes to work knowing that we have a voice ‚Äì and a safe, judgement-free zone to speak freely.




If you like the sound of that, join us. We'd love to hear what you have to say.

  • CV application review - We will review it as quickly as possible and update on the next steps
  • Let‚Äôs chat - Quick chat with our recruiter about your experience and the role
  • Exercise - 1 hour exercise with the hiring manager to evaluate your data skills and marketing know-how
  • Meet the team - meetings with the wider team in our Madrid office

If you like the sound of that, join us. We'd love to hear what you have to say.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

When you look at L‚ÄôOr√©al, what do you see? If all you see is lipstick, look again and experience the Freedom to go Beyond the ordinary. That‚Äôs the beauty of L‚ÄôOr√©al. We operate in 150 countries on 5 continents. With 36 international brands and 86,000 employees worldwide, we‚Äôre well on our way to fulfilling our common purpose: to create beauty that moves the world.

By 2030 we want to capture over another 1 billion consumers around the world. How? By creating cosmetic products which meet the infinite diversity of consumers beauty needs and desires, and always through digital innovation. Not only that, but taking our sustainability goals seriously; moving us to a more inclusive and sustainable society, for every generation.

Our brands, dynamic culture, and always being our own challenger mean that we offer freedom and opportunity you won‚Äôt get anywhere else.

If you want the Freedom to go Beyond, we‚Äôll see you at L‚ÄôOr√©al.

Our Corporate Division supports the 4000+ strong workforce in L‚ÄôOr√©al UK & Ireland. It‚Äôs a fast-paced and dynamic environment when you‚Äôll have visibility over our 4 Divisions and play an integral role in moving our business forward. The Ecommerce Acceleration Team exists to make L‚ÄôOreal UKI a digital first business by 2024 and drive market share across all our brands and divisions.

We embrace our entrepreneurial spirit in everything we do, always challenging ourselves to new ways of doing things. That means looking for innovative solutions, sustainable developments, and having the freedom to go beyond the ordinary.

Our founder Eug√®ne Schueller once said that ‚Äúa company is not walls and machines, it‚Äôs people, people, people‚Äù. Joining our corporate teams means joining the world leader in beauty, at the cutting edge of innovation. But above all, it means becoming part of a team of talented and inspiring people.

You will

Define and steer data quality improvement plan for all data regarding A&P and Promo

>define new templates

>Review the improvement roadmap implementation with key stakeholders: data owners within all divisions of the UKI and Global Data PO

Collect and transform Data

>Test, implement and upgrade a Semi-automation process for collection and transformation of our manual A&P data

>Lead the collection of all data regarding A&P management and required for MMMs across the UKI

>Manage and extract in autonomy media data from the Essence Data Platform and other sources:

Define the right extraction parameters
Give feedback to the EDDS via the Global PO

>Give feedback to local providers on corrections that should be applied at sourcing data

Automate Data sourcing

>Upgrade data sourcing and support central data automation

Define local data governance
Identify local data assets per domain (sell out, O+O)
Define owners depending on levers, domains, and tools
Increase data availability and literacy

You have

The ability to make appropriate decisions when supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products
Knowledge of data management and business knowledge ‚Äì particularly media to be able to translate and apply data driven solutions
The ability to build processes supporting data transformation, data structures and dependency
The ability to coordinate data collection across different teams and sources
Highly numerate, analytically strong and a great eye for detail
Power BI, DAX, Advanced Excel, VBA (essential)
GCP, SQL, Google Cloud Platform, Python (desirable)
Strong organisational skills
Experience of agile project management and strong organizational skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

You are

Demonstrates entrepreneurship
Manages Complexity
Achieves results with integrity
Acts/Leads with human sensitivity
Displays sensitivity to the m√©tier
Interacts effectively
Innovates

You get

We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; we‚Äôll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and you‚Äôll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, you‚Äôre actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Don‚Äôt forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.

Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.

As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. That‚Äôs why we have a great pension plan, profit share scheme and many more incentives to give you the security you deserve. We also put employee health and wellbeing at the front of everything we do; fully training employees as mental health ambassadors to support and educate ourselves further. There‚Äôs also the chance to enrol in medical and dental insurance, gym discounts, health check-ups and even yoga and Pilates classes to employees in all of our locations.

Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!

How we recruit

At L‚ÄôOr√©al, we take pride in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and their contributions are valued. When we recruit, hire, train, promote or engage in any other employment practice, we are committed to being an inclusive employer regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, socioeconomic status, medical condition or disability, or any other protected status. When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That‚Äôs the beauty of L‚ÄôOr√©al.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Julie Rose Recruitment is looking for a Data Analyst for a financial services company. You would be consulting with 10-20 corporate companies with a diverse range of complexity depending on market dynamics and level of service provided. The primary purpose of this consultant role is to manage the development, production and delivery of data sets providing specific services to financial organisations. This role boasts a great career structure and excellent training as well as a fantastic range of benefits. Main duties for the Data Analyst: To ensure high levels of personal professionalism and responsibility with a total regard for data security, gained from privileged access and insight into ‚Äòmarket sensitive‚Äô client data To establish strong and effective relationships with clients and to maintain excellent service delivery by gathering, collating and analysing data To design, specify, build, communicate, develop and propose excel data sets in collaboration with colleagues and clients To build an understanding of the market landscape including competitor information, customer/market data, technological developments, regulatory changes and political pressures To utilise market knowledge and identify opportunities for reporting enhancements To provide insightful analysis of current trends and unusual performance patterns that emerge from numerical reports, for the benefit of clients and to support the directors and principal consultants at meetings Skills and experience for the Data Analyst: Strong numeracy and analytical skills.




A proven ability to understand data and the complex patterns emerging from its manipulation Excellent communication skills. The ability to influence and resonate with clients as well as the proficiency to structure and write comprehensive technical reports Demonstrable change management skills.




The ability to identify and process improvements, show drive, determination, resilience and a positive attitude Advanced level of Microsoft Excel knowledge.




The capability and capacity to work with large data sets, statistical functions and macros (training given on macros) Clear customer focus Strong and enthusiastic team player This is a fantastic opportunity in a local company that offer excellent training and a good career path
