Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: UK ‚Äì London / Remote

Reporting to: Head of Data & Analytics




Who are we

At Monica Vinader, we‚Äôre on a mission to prove that buying better, wearing longer and doing better don‚Äôt have to be mutually exclusive. From our commitment to making the most sustainable jewellery we can using precious materials, to the timeless style and endless versatility of our pieces, we are driven to making everyday fine jewellery accessible and affordable.

And don‚Äôt just take our word for it, we are proud to be recognised in the industry through three recent awards, proving we are leading the way in sustainable jewellery:

‚óè Ethical Jewellery Business of the Year 2021, Retail Jeweller

‚óè Queen's Award for Enterprise: Sustainable Development 2022

‚óè Responsible Luxury Business of the Year 2022, Positive Luxury

‚óè Best Sustainable Luxury Jewellery Brand 2022, Marie Claire UK

We are digital first, customer obsessed, female led and inclusive, focused on creating meaningful relationships with our community, who we owe our success to. We are looking for someone special to join our team to help us make luxury something we can all enjoy everyday.







Where we need your help

The Monica Vinader Data & Analytics team plays an important role in supporting decision making, strategy development and process automation across the business. The team owns, maintains and improves all reporting data systems working in close collaboration with retail, inventory, operations, digital and technology teams.




A key contributing factor for ensuring the continued growth of the business is establishing a holistic view of our customer and how they flow through the experience. The team works to ensure optimal selection, configuration and governance of the analytics stack to achieve a true understanding of each and every touch point along the customer journey.




As a Data Analyst, you will deliver compelling, coherent and meticulously distilled insights to stakeholders across the business. We will look to you to source, maintain and interpret numerous streams of data to provoke conversations and provide direction appropriately for your stakeholders' needs. Your work will influence and drive decision-making anywhere from the user experience to the strategic direction of the business more generally.







What you‚Äôll be doing

‚óè Support decision making by providing detailed, action orientated insights, continuously highlighting potential opportunities and risks.

‚óè Owning the end-to-end delivery of meticulous insights right across the Monica Vinader business including ecommerce, retail, operations, supply chain, customer care, logistics, finance

‚óè Develop relationships with your stakeholders and an understanding of their business areas, enabling your insights and recommendations to be relevant

‚óè Partner with the Product Team and Developers to ensure we have the right data collection and tracking processes in place to feed our models

‚óè Configure and govern automated reporting in our cloud based data stack. Including the building and development of SQL data models in DBT

‚óè Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how use our analytics tools

‚óè Building out customer segments based on behaviours including value, recency, products purchased and other factors in order to enable targeted communications and promotions

‚óè Analysing customer churn and building models to identify key characteristics or behaviours that flag that customers have a higher propensity to churn and therefore are at risk

‚óè Prioritise & resolve issues and requests raised via the internal Data Support desk solution

‚óè Maintain strict QA processes and standards in order to deliver high data integrity and uptime. Proactively monitor the integrity of our data connections and metrics, taking the lead on troubleshooting

‚óè Maintain a strong focus on good governance and documentation for our data systems, ensuring our approach is compliant and continues to be best in class

‚óè Play a central role in ensuring the security of our customers‚Äô data while also ensuring our compliance with international data compliance regulation (such as GDPR, PECR,CCPA)







What you‚Äôll bring

‚óè Experience in the data and analytics domain with a demonstrable track record in influencing business decisions using data

‚óè Strong technical and data modelling skills including advanced SQL and preferably one other programming language

‚óè Familiarity of working with a spectrum of cloud-based technologies which sit within the modern data stack (e.g. BigQuery/GCP/Snowflake/DBT/Snowplow)

‚óè Experience of using Agile frameworks, methodologies, and best practices within analytics

‚óè Analytics experience in customer behaviour, lifetime value, segmentation, experimentation, cohort analysis, etc., ideally in a DTC omni-channel business

‚óè Strong attention to details to highlight and address data quality issues

‚óè Self-motivated, responsible and technology-driven individual who performs well both independently and as a team member

‚óè Team player, able to work with multiple business functions to achieve objectives

‚óè Exceptional communication skills, written and verbal, you‚Äôre known for your visual organisation plus clear and concise style

‚óè Experience with Google Analytics, GA4, and BI tools such as PowerBi, Tableau etc

‚óè Aptitude for test and learn mindset - and feeding that into day to day operations

‚óè Experience working at a high-growth start-up or scale-up environment where you‚Äôve had to be a scrappy self-starter with a focus on iteration and pragmatism

‚óè Self-motivated and enthusiastic approach to work who excels in challenging environments

‚óè A growth mindset, comfortable surfacing your own failures to drive learnings, knowing when to pivot, knowing when to persevere







To be successful at Monica Vinader...

‚óè You are a doer.

‚óè You‚Äôre a team player.

‚óè You‚Äôre humble.

‚óè You are honest, straightforward and transparent.

‚óè You are a good teacher/mentor (approachable and accessible).

‚óè You want to get your hands dirty.

‚óè You solve problems.

‚óè You are resilient.

‚óè You are flexible.

‚óè You are entrepreneurial, smart, and passionate.

‚óè If you don't know something, you say so. Then go figure it out quickly.

‚óè You love working in a creative environment.

‚óè You have a sense of humor.

‚óè You are an insatiable learner







Additional Requirements

Ability to document your authorization to work in the United Kingdom







Our Aims and Values

Our mission is to be the leading accessible luxury brand, by delivering outstanding quality, design and customer service. We are:




Customer Obsessed

Our customers are at the core of everything we do. We will always deliver an outstanding and personal experience to them every time they interact with us, to ensure their ongoing support and loyalty.




Caring

We treat people with respect, as we would want to be treated. We are apolitical and assume good intentions in others. We are open and honest with each other while ensuring we take an empathetic and supportive approach.




Fast Paced

We are passionate about what we do, and we want to reach as many customers as fast as we can. We combine focus with pragmatism and flexibility so that we can move at pace in whichever direction we need to take.




Exceptional

We have a relentless desire to continually learn and improve to ensure our products and approach are exceptional. Our tenacity, high standards and attention to detail give us a competitive advantage.




Commercial

We focus hard on facts and approach things in a logical, rational and analytical way. We challenge each other to make sure we make decisions and take actions that create value for our business and our customers.




Monica Vinader as a global business makes the following inclusive culture pledge:

Our jewellery is for everyone and so is our community. Together, we will continue to implement sustainable changes to ensure that career opportunities and progression are open to all. We commit to celebrating the diverse voices of our employees, partners, and the customers we serve.




This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties to be performed by the employee. This job description may be altered to reflect the business needs of the company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Heathrow - ¬£30,000 - ¬£37,000 (3 days in office 2 days from home)




My client based near Heathrow Airport has a need to bring on a Data Analyst to join the team and provide key Analytics and Data Visualisation to Internal stakeholders, specifically around Business Performance.




Key Skills needed




Excel Analysis, some experience in Data Modelling
Experience analysing large amounts of data
Data Interpretation and Manipulation
Developing KPI dashboards - Ideally Power BI, however other BI tools are fine.
Requirement gathering - engaging with stakeholders at various levels




This would be the perfect role for someone with a couple of years of experience in a similar role, who wants to continue to gain more experience and more hands on exposure to Power BI, whilst developing further skills in building relationships and Business Partnering with stakeholders at various levels.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Reuben Sinclair Ltd | Sales, Marketing, PR, Data and Digital Recruitment
Description:
About the B2B Marketing Agency:




This organisation is a specialist and Global scale Branding marketing agency. This multi award-winning agency is looking for an insight manager to using a range of analytic tools, including social listening and web analysis programmes. Some organisations this agency has partnered with include Volkswagen, Santander, BNY Mellon and Nvidia to name a few. This multi-national B2B marketing agency is offering Hybrid working with 2 days in an awe-inspiring office, featuring an impressive outdoor terrace with stunning views across the city of London.

About the Insight Manager(Social Media) role:




The Insight Manager will be working with top tier clients and researching their marketing performances using cutting edge analytical tools. They will be collaborating with other friendly team members as well as:




Interpreting social data and reporting back on the latest social media insights to global-scale clients.
Liaising with clients and presenting the best social media strategies and communication plans.
Successfully building relationships and influencing the roadmap for the insights team.
Using social listening tools to collect social media data, analysing data insights.

About the Insight Manager (Social Media) role:

Minimum, 2-3 years‚Äô experience in a research role that incorporates social media listening.
Strong communications skills
Good quantitative analysis experience
Excellent experience having worked with any social media listening tool.

Benefits:

An excellent salary offering ¬£35K - ¬£45K
Hybrid working with 2 days in the London office.
Global career development opportunities
Central London location in Finsbury Square with fabulous offices featuring an impressive outdoor terrace with stunning views across the city.




For any questions regarding the role please contact Andrzej (Andre) at Reuben-Sinclair andrzejg@reuben-sinclair.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are recruiting for a Data Analyst on a PERMANENT basis to join a global document management organisation working remotely from home with occasional team meetings at their headquarters in London. A particularly attractive role for anyone with previous Data Analysis skills with Excel/ Google Sheets knowledge!

This Data Analyst role is a permanent role working 9am 5pm Monday to Friday offering a salary of ¬£30,000-35,0000 per annum plus excellent benefits!

As Data Analyst You Will Be Working In The EMEA Procurement Team Reporting Into The Senior Category Manager Providing Support To The Whole Team Including The Following

Analysing considerable amounts of data from a variety of systems and sources.
Completing regular reports on Microsoft/ Google packages, mainly Excel/ Google Sheets/ Google Forms and using advanced functions such as Vlookup, importrange and pivot tables etc.
Supporting the procurement transition to Oracle Cloud.
Supporting category managers in modelling and data analysis for strategic procurement projects.
Creating and providing bespoke reporting as requested.
Personal ownership for delivery of a procurement savings target as agreed with the Manager.
Working within the procurement team, monitoring email inbox, responding to queries.
Assist with any other duties as deemed necessary within the procurement team

We are really keen to hear from applicants with the following skills and experience:

Previous experience working as a Data Analyst or Data Administrator analysing data as key to your role
Computer literacy, specifically being intermediate to advanced in MS Excel/ Google Sheets including being able to review large amounts of data and creating advanced reports and dashboards.
Basic to intermediate understanding of Procurement and Strategic Sourcing ideally, but not essential
Accuracy and attention to detail with highly analytical skills
Professional and proactive approach
Organised approach and excellent time management skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to be able to effectively communicate financial information with colleagues stakeholders at all levels
Ability to use your own initiative but also know when matters need to be referred to management
Be a committed and adaptable team player who can work effectively to tight deadlines and will go the extra mile when required

Benefits Include

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Free Onsite Parking
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Insurance
Pension
Employee Life Assurance + Partner Life Assurance
Employee Critical Illness Insurance + Partner Critical Illness Insurance
Personal Accident Insurance
Childcare Vouchers
Bike to Work
Spreeflex
Charity Account
Travel insurance
Please apply today or give us a call for a confidential chat to become the next Data Analyst for this award winning global company!
Show more Show less
HTML:
We are recruiting for a Data Analyst on a PERMANENT basis to join a global document management organisation working remotely from home with occasional team meetings at their headquarters in London. A particularly attractive role for anyone with previous Data Analysis skills with Excel/ Google Sheets knowledge!

This Data Analyst role is a permanent role working 9am 5pm Monday to Friday offering a salary of ¬£30,000-35,0000 per annum plus excellent benefits!

As Data Analyst You Will Be Working In The EMEA Procurement Team Reporting Into The Senior Category Manager Providing Support To The Whole Team Including The Following
  • Analysing considerable amounts of data from a variety of systems and sources.
  • Completing regular reports on Microsoft/ Google packages, mainly Excel/ Google Sheets/ Google Forms and using advanced functions such as Vlookup, importrange and pivot tables etc.
  • Supporting the procurement transition to Oracle Cloud.
  • Supporting category managers in modelling and data analysis for strategic procurement projects.
  • Creating and providing bespoke reporting as requested.
  • Personal ownership for delivery of a procurement savings target as agreed with the Manager.
  • Working within the procurement team, monitoring email inbox, responding to queries.
  • Assist with any other duties as deemed necessary within the procurement team
We are really keen to hear from applicants with the following skills and experience:
  • Previous experience working as a Data Analyst or Data Administrator analysing data as key to your role
  • Computer literacy, specifically being intermediate to advanced in MS Excel/ Google Sheets including being able to review large amounts of data and creating advanced reports and dashboards.
  • Basic to intermediate understanding of Procurement and Strategic Sourcing ideally, but not essential
  • Accuracy and attention to detail with highly analytical skills
  • Professional and proactive approach
  • Organised approach and excellent time management skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to be able to effectively communicate financial information with colleagues stakeholders at all levels
  • Ability to use your own initiative but also know when matters need to be referred to management
  • Be a committed and adaptable team player who can work effectively to tight deadlines and will go the extra mile when required
Benefits Include
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Free Onsite Parking
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Pension
  • Employee Life Assurance + Partner Life Assurance
  • Employee Critical Illness Insurance + Partner Critical Illness Insurance
  • Personal Accident Insurance
  • Childcare Vouchers
  • Bike to Work
  • Spreeflex
  • Charity Account
  • Travel insurance
Please apply today or give us a call for a confidential chat to become the next Data Analyst for this award winning global company!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PRINCIPAL DATA ANALYST ‚Äì SQL, ETL, PYTHON




CENTRAL LONDON - HYBRID




¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000







This is a fantastic opportunity to expand your SQL experience by joining a specialist data team. If you‚Äôd like to gain exposure to the most cutting-edge tools in analytics and engineering, this role could be for you.







THE COMPANY




Global marketing consultancy offering expert advice in data, analytics, and technology. Their unique services allow clients to understand their own data by building out centralised teams with specific analytical skill sets.







THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Within this Principal Data Analyst role, you will:




Use SQL to collect, process, and query client data
Build scalable solutions using ETL/ELT data pipelines
Pull and ingest data from a warehouse in Snowflake
Work with large data sets




YOUR EXPERIENCE




To qualify for this Principal Data Analyst role, you will need:




Proficient experience using SQL
Exposure to working with visualization tools
Python and R experience is preferable




THE BENEFITS




A successful Principal Data Analyst will receive:




A salary of up to ¬£50,00 within your first year
Hybrid working
Other benefits




HOW TO APPLY




To apply for this role, please do so via this site. For more info on this role or other BI roles, reach out to Carlota at Harnham.

Title: Research and Data Analyst - SMB (Remote)
Description:
Company Description

Forbes Advisor is a new initiative for consumers under the Forbes Marketplace umbrella that provides journalist- and expert-written insights, news and reviews on all things personal finance.

We‚Äôre dedicated to helping turn aspirations into reality. We do this by providing consumers with the knowledge and research they need to make informed financial decisions they can feel confident in, so they can get back to doing the things they care about most.

Job Description

Forbes Advisor is a new initiative under the Marketplace umbrella that provides consumers with journalist- and expert-written insights, news, and reviews on all things personal finance. Our goal is to help small and medium businesses (SMBs) make informed decisions by providing them with the knowledge and research they need.

We are seeking an SMB Data Analyst to join our team and assist our editorial team in creating top-quality content. In this role, you will provide competitive analysis on the market and ensure the quality and accuracy of data collection and analysis for products and services relevant to SMBs, with a focus on software. Your research and analysis will be a key component of making trustworthy, relevant assessments of products and services, and will help thousands of SMBs make informed decisions about the products and services they use.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting opportunity similar to those found at a start-up, with the benefits of a seasoned and successful company, then this may be the role for you.

Responsibilities:

Review editorial data requests for feasibility, usability, and scalability
Leverage a team of freelancers to collect product and service data, with a focus on products for SMBs
Perform analysis on collected data to identify top-quality products and services for SMBs
Develop and implement processes for quality control
Collaborate with peers to introduce and develop new techniques and processes for efficient data collection
Collaborate with the editorial team to ensure deadlines and goals are met
Review editorial content resulting from work product for accuracy and completeness


About You:

Highly organized, with strong attention to detail and critical thinking abilities
Comfortable working in G-Suite, with an emphasis on Google Sheets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize projects accordingly
Previous experience in a quality role is preferred
Comfortable managing your own projects and deliverables


Qualifications:

Associates Degree or Certificate in a relevant field, such as business or computer science, or equivalent training and experience
Proficiency in using Google Sheets for data analysis and manipulation
Proven experience in software testing, as well as proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation are desirable


Benefits:

We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, unlimited PTO, disability coverage, employee assistance program, and a paid parental leave program.


Additional Information

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst - Automotive Protection

London/Hybrid




We are looking for a highly motivated versatile Business Data Analyst to join our global Automotive Protection business unit. We specialise in developing affinity insurance solutions to the global automotive sector, offering products in over 20 countries. Your primary focus will be to work with one of our larger clients understanding their data and performing analytical and performance output. This will enable you to further understand and support the pricing of specific products. You will also be responsible for suggesting changes to their products making sure they are optimised for performance and growth.




The individual will need to demonstrate excellent data mining abilities, analytical skills and very good knowledge of Microsoft applications, particularly MS Access, Excel and SQL Server. You need to be adaptable, enthusiastic and have ability to learn and problem solve.




Your responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:




Design, develop and enhance analytics reporting that generates valuable business insights and drives key business decisions
Putting the customer at the centre of the role with intimate understanding and anticipation of needs, driving customer-centric approaches to analysis and design
Communicate and present data derived insights to business stakeholders
Analyse existing claims and projecting future claims using actuarial forecasting techniques, including basic pricing techniques
Forecasting performance and supporting Service Contract Managers in pricing
Monitor internationally received data checking for accuracy and reporting exceptions
Collaboratively work across the business functions. Liaising with clients, senior stakeholders, IT developers, underwriters, account managers, claims, finance and actuaries




Due to the uniqueness of the Automotive Protection business, a definitive role cannot be scheduled. You will therefore need to be versatile, having the ability to adapt to any eventuality that might come about. You should have the ability to think for yourself and act when confronted with unique situations.




You will need to be able to display you have the following qualifications and experience, or clear potential to develop these:




Demonstrable experience as a Business Analyst
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Very good knowledge of MS SQL Server and Access (strong understanding of relational databases and ability to write SQL queries and macros is a must)
Strong analytical skills - methodical, logical and rational approach to problem solving
Ability to capture and document business requirements in a structured and efficient manner to key stakeholders across the business.




Preferred Knowledge:




Experience with generalized linear modelling techniques and the Emblem software package will be an advantage
Experience in the insurance industry, particularly the automotive sector




QBE Cultural DNA




‚Ä¢ Everything we do at QBE is underpinned by our DNA (which interlinks seven cultural elements) ‚Äì because we know it's not just what we do that matters, it's how we do it that makes the difference. We expect all employees to role model and inspire the right behaviours that link to our cultural elements:-We are customer-focused-We are technical experts-We are inclusive-We are fast-paced-We are courageous-We are accountable-We are a team. All employees are expected to adhere to QBE‚Äôs Code of Ethics and Conduct and apply sound risk management practices

Why QBE? At My Best

At QBE, we want our people to feel rewarded and inspired to perform at their best, that‚Äôs why we have created ‚ÄúAt My Best‚Äù. It‚Äôs our connection, our way of showing we have your back. We understand that one size doesn‚Äôt fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. It‚Äôs in the culture of our business, our QBE DNA, to support our people. Everything we do is underpinned by our QBE DNA - because we know it‚Äôs not just what we do that matters, it‚Äôs how we do it that makes the difference. In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.

At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.

Some of the award‚Äôs QBE are proud to have won, been a finalist for, and shortlisted for include;

Employer of the Year 2022 Winner ‚Äì Insurance Insider

British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award

Insurance Times Claims Excellence Awards 2022 Winner - Claims Product Solution of the Year

Working Families Best Practice Awards 2021 Finalist for: Best COVID-19 Response

Insurance Post British Insurance Awards 2022 Shortlisted for: Best Customer Care, Diversity & Inclusion Initiative of the Year 2022, Specialist Insurer of the Year (for Construction), General Insurer of the Year

We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Women‚Äôs Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent

Inclusion of Diversity

We are striving to create a workplace culture where all our people feel included, and we are committed to building a diverse workforce that is reflective of the communities we operate in.

We know that diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision making, improves the quality of our delivery and helps us to meet the needs of our customers.

What next?

If you have a passion to contribute to QBE‚Äôs vision of enabling a more resilient future for our customers and the community, we encourage you to APPLY NOW! Simply click the ‚Äúapply‚Äù button to submit your CV and other relevant documents, and a member of our friendly Talent Acquisition team will be in contact to discuss your interest further if you meet the requirements of the role.

Please make the Talent Acquisition aware should there be any reasonable adjustments that may need to be made for the interview and the remainder of the recruitment process.

Place: London Heathrow Airport, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Data Analyst - Heathrow - ¬£30,000 - ¬£37,000 (3 days in office 2 days from home)




My client based near Heathrow Airport has a need to bring on a Data Analyst to join the team and provide key Analytics and Data Visualisation to Internal stakeholders, specifically around Business Performance.

Excel Analysis, some experience in Data Modelling
Experience analysing large amounts of data

Title: Data Analytics - 3 month Intern
Description:
Paysend is a UK-based FinTech company that has over 5 million customers and is on a mission to change the way that people and businesses globally manage their money.

Our growth has been fast and exciting. We were the first FinTech company to introduce global card-to-card transfers, connecting 12 billion cards issued by the international payment systems Mastercard, Visa, China Union Pay and local cards schemes, and we have strategic partnerships with many of the world's top payment companies. Born in April 2017, we now serve customers in over 150 countries and have over 200 employees, having more than doubled in size since March 2020.

In May 2021, we secured US$125 million in a Series B funding round which valued the company at US$700+ million. Since then we've expanded into Asia-Pacific with the opening of our Singapore headquarters, we've opened our Americas and LatAm headquarters in Miami, and recently launched our new European Technology Centre in Belgrade, Serbia. Additionally, we've been recognized by Deloitte as the third fastest growing technology company in the UK in 2022, as well as featuring in Sifted's UK start-ups and scale-ups to watch in 2022 ranking.

Paysend is one of the most popular and trusted digital money services in the world with 4.7/5 Trustpilot score

Our success is built on supreme technology, friendly customer service and, of course, the very best talent in the FinTech industry. We're looking for the future gamechangers of FinTech to join us as we positively disrupt the personal and business payments markets and make financial services more accessible and inclusive for individuals and small businesses around the world.

Every day is a new challenge at Paysend, and we approach each project with ambition, innovation and creativity.

About The Role

Working within the People and Culture team, the main objective will be to help us partner with the business to turn people data into insights that will enable business stakeholders to understand their teams, what matters most to them and act accordingly. This is a summer internship starting late June/early July.

What you'll be doing:

Developing dashboards with clear data visualisations in Tableau and superset (or a similar reporting tool)
Help us connect all of our people data into a single data warehouse and as such SQL knowledge is appreciated
Help us explore opportunities for automation using any script/language of your choice
Conduct descriptive, confirmatory and exploratory data analysis
Work in an agile manner to help us use the insights generated to lead to real change


What you'll need to be successful:

Currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree that provides dedicated modules for math or scientific study
Enjoy working with data and have knowledge or experience with SQL (or other query language) and general-purpose programming languages such as Python or R
Have proven analytical and problem-solving skills
A real curiosity to understand for how things work and how they can be improved
Ability to communicate complex information in a clear and simple manner
Mindset that focuses on reaching core of problems; not just the first issue encountered


Why Paysend?

We're looking for people who share our passion for innovation, buy into the Paysend ethos and add value to our team. When you join Paysend, you'll have the chance to grow and develop as the business does.

We believe in empowering people to be successful in their jobs, and we pay them fairly for their expertise. We give everyone the context and tools to operate as business owners and encourage our people to contribute with their hearts, minds and creativity.

In the fast-paced FinTech industry the Paysend journey may not always be easy, but we succeed by working together to create solutions that break the status quo. We employ the right people to help us steer the business towards success and global influence.

If Paysend sounds like the perfect company for you, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (CRM and Data Management/Dynamics CRM)




Remote/Bromley, United Kingdom - ¬£40k per annum




Permanent




Logix Resourcing has been retained to help PACEY hire a Data Lead who will help them deliver against their data strategy and enable the business to use data to make informed decisions and business improvements.




About PACEY




PACEY is the Professional Association for Childcare and Early Years. Formed in 1977, they are a charity dedicated to supporting everyone working in childcare and early years to provide high-quality care and early learning for children and families.




They provide training, practical help and expert advice to practitioners working throughout England and Wales. They also provide peer support and encouragement through our nationwide network of PACEY Champions.




Their mission is to support everyone working in childcare and early years to provide high-quality childcare and early learning; and champion the vital role practitioners play in helping prepare children for a bright future.




About The Role




The Data Lead with a minimum of 2 years experience of working with CRMs and Data Management (ideally, Dynamics CRM), is required support PACEY to develop and deliver its data strategy so the charity can use its data (CRM. Google Analytics, social media etc) to inform decision-making and business improvement. As part of this, take lead responsibility for data assurance and quality. In particular, you will ensure PACEY uses its wide range of data sources to build a single view of our varied customers so we can better engage with them through personalised content that increases member conversion, customer loyalty and therefore income. You will have a strong analytical background with the skills and ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. You will need to have experience with one of the following; Azure, SQL or Power BI.




Projects that you will embark on from day one will be; a review of the data landscape, identification of improvements and implementation of these, understand business needs and create and streamline reporting structure as well as many other projects.




Working on a hybrid model of being home based and out of their Bromley HQ you will be instrumental in working with the Head of Technology to develop and deliver a data strategy in support of business objectives and in line with the organisations vision. You will have a detailed understanding of reporting, advanced finds, dashboards and statistics tools, be experienced with user training and developing user documentation to support business processes as well as having a demonstrable background of data extraction/analysis to support service improvement and marketing/sales impact.




In addition to the above, you will be required to -




Develop record management processes and policies, identifying areas PACEY can increase efficiency and use automation of processes. Set up and maintain these automated data processes.
Implement and maintain processes that ensure data validation and cleansing so that PACEY can rely on accurate and up to date data reports.
Work with the compliance manager to ensure PACEY data complies with GDPR, FCA and other regulation
Liaise with Managed Services providers to ensure tasks get completed
Produce and track key performance indicators
Work with staff and external suppliers, to gather, understand and document PACEY's data sources eg CRM, web analytics so that content is understood and business requirements scoped.
Provide advice and support on how best to support agreed business reporting or analysis requirements, within the scope of the data PACEY has control of
Design and carry out surveys and analyse survey data as required
Manipulate, analyse and interpret complex data sets relating to PACEY business requirements, draw valid inferences and recommendations from this analysis and present these to management
Identify and mine large publicly accessible data sets that will inform PACEY business strategy eg ONS and Ofsted statistics
Prepare reports for internal and external audiences using business analytics reporting tools; create data dashboards, graphs and visualisations to support staff understanding of data
Create agreed data systems and reports for staff and where relevant, enable them to be self-sufficient in running these




Service Improvements




Maintain positive collaborative working with PACEY staff and key users of data and reporting, ensuring excellent customer service to internal staff, external suppliers and other customers
Work with ICT team and suppliers to support their further improvement of PACEY CRM reporting functionality
Ensure data from secondary sources eg are captured effectively and in line with regulatory requirements, to help improve PACEY's wider understanding of its members/customers.
Identify and highlight any issues or potential problems to the Business System Developer for further action




This is an excellent opportunity for a forward-thinking, data-centric individual to make their mark and transform the care and early years of thousands across the UK

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Trust Payments have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the team.

Location: London

Salary: Competitive + Benefits

About Us

Trust Payments is a global unified payment technology group that was formed in 2019 bringing together technology and financial services into an omnichannel solution. The new business model has enabled Trust Payments to establish itself as a leading Fintech Payments group.

Data Analyst - The Role

Trust Payments is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst to support the efforts of the Data-Analytics Team.

This role will suit a candidate with exceptional Analytical skills and strong Communication & Interpersonal skills.

The chosen candidate will be tasked with creating KPI's, dashboards and various analytical reports, while also analysing data and providing meaningful insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

Data Analyst - Key Responsibilities

Interpret data and analyse results using statistical and analytical techniques
Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Build and publish effective Business Intelligence solutions and Analytical visualizations for end users in Tableau/QuickSight or equivalent
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize data efficiency and quality
Perform detailed data analysis (i.e., determine the structure, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems and data samples)
Querying databases and manipulating data using SQL, Excel, Tableau, QuickSight or equivalent

Data Analyst - You

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst
Working knowledge of reporting/analytical platforms such as Tableau, QuickSight or equivalent
Passionate about data visualization
Advanced Excel knowledge (Pivots, Formulas etc)
Analytical skills with good attention to detail
Excellent knowledge of relational/non-relational Database and Data warehouse concepts and technologies
Experience in SQL, PostgreSQL, or equivalent scripting languages
Knowledge in data modelling and segmentation techniques will be considered an asset
Programming knowledge (C#, Python, R, XML, JS etc.) will be considered an asset
Knowledge of Salesforce CRM system and/or Omnipay processing platform will be considered an asset
Experience in Statistical Analysis will be considered an asset

Data Analyst - Benefits

Opportunity to be part of a rapidly scaling and market leading Fintech business
Health and Wellbeing ethos including regular wellness sessions, fitness and nutrition and other events as well as supported by internally qualified mental health first aiders
Family friendly enhanced benefits/policies
Pension, Healthcare, Life Assurance

We understand the value that a diverse and inclusive working environment brings to Trust Payments. We celebrate the differences that people can bring through their cultures, backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other protected characteristic.

During the recruitment process we welcome you to inform us confidentially of any special adjustments required in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience.

To submit your CV for this exciting Data Analyst opportunity, please click ‚ÄòApply' now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About MyTutor:

MyTutor is the UK‚Äôs leading online platform for one-to-one learning, and we're on a mission to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people. We‚Äôre building a future where access to high-quality learning is stress-free for those who can afford it, and funded for those who can't.

One-to-one tuition is one of the most powerful ways to improve pupils‚Äô grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. Our handpicked community of tutors work online with students from all walks of life, raising results on average by one whole grade. Since Covid-19 and all the disruption to education, we've worked with the government to provide safe and reliable tuition to more students than ever. We're proud to have worked with over 650 schools across the UK, and our tutors have given over a million lessons.

Since the pandemic, we've scaled up and kept a working environment that encourages collaboration and support. We always prioritise our team's development and well-being, remotely right now, and in an office again in the future. We have regular company socials, and there are chances every week to sit down with someone for a cuppa and a chat.

The role in a nutshell:

Here at MyTutor we are growing our data team, and we‚Äôre looking for an experienced, data-driven and passionate Analytics professional to support our wider business.

You‚Äôll be the 7th member of our collaborative data team, which is made up of data analysts, a data scientist and an analytics engineer. You‚Äôll be working in a fast-paced environment with stakeholders across product, marketing, customer success, sales and business operations to drive deeper understanding of the impact of customer and tutor behaviour, acquisition and retention, and overall business health.

With your data expertise and commercial awareness, you‚Äôll influence the strategy and decisions that fuel our rapid growth as we look to become one of the world‚Äôs leading learning platforms.

You‚Äôll be working with our analytics engineer to ensure that we build insights in a sustainable fashion, getting a chance to develop your data modelling and coding skills along the way.

We work in an agile way, so expect daily stand-ups, regular retrospectives and beautifully crafted tickets!

Our stack

We have a state-of-the-art data stack at MyTutor:

Snowflake for our data warehouse
Stitch/Airbyte for data ingestion
dbt for data transformation
Paradime for lineage/data catalogue
HighTouch for reverse ETL
Machine learning using Python + Snowpark
Tableau and Lightdash for Data Visualisation


What you can expect:

Be one of the go-to people for business insights and provide a vital link in the strategy - execution - analysis chain to ensure we move quickly and stay ahead.
Lead analysis of various business areas, focused on developing the capability to translate data into actionable insights that will improve campaign performance.
Spend time building beautiful, well-tested and well-documented data models that make self-serve analytics easy
Work with our data scientist to support product discovery and experimentation using cutting-edge advanced analytics techniques
Drive deeper understanding of customer and tutor behaviours, and efficiency of business operations - anything from acquisition, churn and lifetime value to the efficiency of our tools in serving customers.
Assist with ad hoc queries and provide analytical support to our fast-growing business as it evolves.
Seek out new techniques and opportunities for greater efficiency as well as owning best practices across the data function.
A progression framework that includes pathways to analytics engineer and data scientist


The type of person we would love to meet:

You have experience tackling complex analytical challenges, supporting various functions with funnel/spend optimisation and making decisions based high-quality information.
You have advanced skills in data analysis - SQL, statistical methods and modelling on large data sets.
You have excellent data visualisation skills and storytelling, capable of driving actions from stakeholders (e.g. self-service visualisation tools or slide decks).
You have a passion for solving ambiguous, complex and unstructured problems
You are a bar-raiser who sees improving those around you as important as your own delivery
You are comfortable working across multiple projects in a rapidly changing environment, able to balance the need for accuracy and efficiency to prioritise work.
You deliver accurate, meaningful and timely information, based on well-thought-through research and your interpersonal skills enable you to articulate complex concepts in simple terms to stakeholders.


Great if you have:

Experience with dbt (if you don‚Äôt have this, it‚Äôs basically just SQL with some config so if you‚Äôre a SQL whizz you‚Äôll pick it up in no time!)
Experience with git
Experience with AB testing
Experience with GA (not a huge part of the role but we are currently light on GA skills in the team!)
Experience with digital/performance marketing


Benefits:

Flexible working culture with access to our London HQ, global co-working spaces and home office setup
Investment in your learning with a personal L&D budget of up to ¬£350
Workplace pension
¬£40k - ¬£63k salary, depending on experience (we are hiring at multiple levels)
Private Healthcare option through BUPA
Enhanced parent policies
Cycle, tech and gym schemes
Mentor/mentee scheme
Regular team events & socials (we've just had a remote Sofar Sounds gig and wine tasting!)
25 days holiday (plus public holidays)
A culture that champions well-being with workshops and 1:1 coaching


MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace, and we have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who hosts regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

  • Enhanced parent policies

MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace, and we have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who hosts regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
London (Hybrid Working)

Permanent

Full Time

Grade 3

Our passion at Currys is helping everyone enjoy the latest tech. We‚Äôre proud of the service levels we provide for our customer ‚Äì online, in-store or in their homes. And it‚Äôs all down to our people, 30,000+ capable and committed colleagues, learning together, growing together, making us amazing and celebrating the wins.

Do you have a logical approach to problem solving? An inquisitive mind that doesn't take facts at face value? Are you able to clearly communicate sophisticated ideas to non-experts? We're looking for applicants who can answer yes to all of these questions.

The Digital Analyst will perform a robust, statistics-led approach to developing new frameworks for effectively evaluating the impact of A/B test experiences on customer journey and personalisation campaign. The role will develop machine learning models to segment user behaviours to support personalisation. Communicating performance on a macro scale and looking at contributing factors that are changing the customer experience and financial performance.

Key Role Responsibilities

Apply advanced statistical analysis, such as correlation, regression, for data validation or performance review
Provide data analysis and interpretation for model implementations, continue testing, and evaluation of the results
Build machine learning models to determine the behavioural triggers which premeditate certain user behaviours as intent to purchases, product category preference
Combine data sources into custom reports and dashboards, diagnosing problems to provide actionable insights
Liaise with the Optimisation team to ensure appropriate measurement, tracking and understanding of test results, and how they influence the wider business


Key Skills, Qualifications & Experience

Numerical and analytical skills, capable of using multiple data sources to analyse complex problems, identify cause and effect and deliver insightful and practical solutions
Strong problem-solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise good judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analysis
Working with large data sets and using quantitative analysis/modelling to drive business results
Experience with Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
Experience with coding languages or process automation tools such as SQL, Python, git
Experience with Cloud (preferably Google Cloud Platform)
Degree or equivalent in Science in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or related subject
Visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio.


We‚Äôre one team and we celebrate all of the great things you do. One way we show our gratitude is by giving you access to a range of lifestyle benefits including:

Competitive pension scheme
Access to discretionary company bonus scheme
Life Assurance
Staff discounts and offers
Employee assistance programme
Cycle to work scheme
Hybrid working; arrangements will depend on your role and business requirements. You could be working from our primary Currys Campus at Waterloo (WeWork), meeting & collaborating at Currys regional workspaces or working from home.


Beyond that, we'll be with you every step of the way, enabling you to get the most out of your role. We're building a team that brings technology to people, making their lives better, easier and fuller, and you can be part of it.

#wheretechlovesunite

#wehelpeveryoneenjoyamazingtechnology

And it‚Äôs all down to our people, 30,000+ capable and committed colleagues, learning together, growing together, making us amazing and celebrating the wins.

Do you have a logical approach to problem solving? An inquisitive mind that doesn't take facts at face value? Are you able to clearly communicate sophisticated ideas to non-experts? We're looking for applicants who can answer yes to all of these questions.

The Digital Analyst will perform a robust, statistics-led approach to developing new frameworks for effectively evaluating the impact of A/B test experiences on customer journey and personalisation campaign. The role will develop machine learning models to segment user behaviours to support personalisation. Communicating performance on a macro scale and looking at contributing factors that are changing the customer experience and financial performance.

Key Role Responsibilities
  • Apply advanced statistical analysis, such as correlation, regression, for data validation or performance review
  • Provide data analysis and interpretation for model implementations, continue testing, and evaluation of the results
  • Build machine learning models to determine the behavioural triggers which premeditate certain user behaviours as intent to purchases, product category preference
  • Combine data sources into custom reports and dashboards, diagnosing problems to provide actionable insights
  • Liaise with the Optimisation team to ensure appropriate measurement, tracking and understanding of test results, and how they influence the wider business

Key Skills, Qualifications & Experience
  • Numerical and analytical skills, capable of using multiple data sources to analyse complex problems, identify cause and effect and deliver insightful and practical solutions
  • Strong problem-solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise good judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analysis
  • Working with large data sets and using quantitative analysis/modelling to drive business results
  • Experience with Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
  • Experience with coding languages or process automation tools such as SQL, Python, git
  • Experience with Cloud (preferably Google Cloud Platform)
  • Degree or equivalent in Science in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or related subject
  • Visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio.

We‚Äôre one team and we celebrate all of the great things you do. One way we show our gratitude is by giving you access to a range of lifestyle benefits including:
  • Competitive pension scheme
  • Access to discretionary company bonus scheme
  • Life Assurance
  • Staff discounts and offers
  • Employee assistance programme
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Hybrid working; arrangements will depend on your role and business requirements. You could be working from our primary Currys Campus at Waterloo (WeWork), meeting & collaborating at Currys regional workspaces or working from home.

Beyond that, we'll be with you every step of the way, enabling you to get the most out of your role. We're building a team that brings technology to people, making their lives better, easier and fuller, and you can be part of it.

#wheretechlovesunite

#wehelpeveryoneenjoyamazingtechnology

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Alternative Networks (now part of Daisy Group)
Description:
All applications will be reviewed after the closing date

We Also Offer

Annual leave 25 days

Personal Pension Plan ‚Äì Personal contribution rates of 4% or 5% (UK Power Networks will make a corresponding contribution of 8% or 10%)

Tenancy Loan Deposit scheme

Tax efficient benefits: cycle to work scheme

Season ticket loan

Occupational Health support

Switched On ‚Äì scheme providing discount on hundreds of retailers products.

Supplier discounts, such as O2, EE, Vauxhall cars, Universal tyres

Discounted access to sports and social clubs

Employee Assistance Programme.

Job Purpose

A visible role with significant responsibility in providing data analytics support for the assurance engagements. This will cover a range of Risk, Audit, Compliance, and Investigation activities and give the role holder broad exposure across the full remit of the Risk & Assurance team
You will be accountable and responsible for supporting the development and implementation of a data strategy, including performing analytics tests/ projects in all phases including, planning, extracting data, understanding the process/ data, validating and analysing the data, stakeholder management, reporting and proposing solutions to overcome issues
You will have aim to provide continuous support and innovative ideas in order to improve the Risk & Assurance area by developing best practice related to data analytics and sharing knowledge with other team members

Dimensions

Staff: None
Stakeholders: Risk & Assurance team members, colleagues from areas being reviewed, Information Systems and Asset Management team members.
Ensuring high quality delivery of the different analytics tests/ projects from the assurance portfolio assigned to you.

Principal Accountabilities

Develop and implement a robust Data Analytics strategy for the Risk & Assurance team
Lead on scoping, planning and delivering data analytics on a variety of assurance engagements
Export, consolidate, validate and analyse data from different processes and systems
Work with Risk & Assurance Advisors and Managers to undertake the end to end assurance process, including planning, fieldwork and reporting, ensuring the deadlines are met and key stakeholders are kept updated, sometimes in time pressured situations
Compliance with the Risk & Assurance methodology ‚ÄúWays of Working‚Äù for all assurance engagements
Report and discuss data issues identified with key stakeholders and propose improvements and solutions
Follow up and test implementation of management actions to address issues and proactively engage to push them through to closure
Establish and maintain excellent relations with key stakeholders
Provide best practice data analytics advice and guidance as required (as per level of experience, bring something new to the team)
Contributing to the development of the existing Risk & Assurance team by sharing data analytics knowledge with Advisors and Managers

Knowledge, Skills, Qualifications And Experience

Deep technical experience of using data analytics tools (e.g. ACL, Idea, Alteryx)
A high level of expertise in SQL, Excel, Access Data visualisation software such as Power BI, Tableau, VBA, R, Python etc.), with proven experience working with data.
Strong knowledge of Enterprise Data Architecture and ERP Solutions (i.e. SAP)
Familiar with data services area (Integration, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Data Stewardship etc.), data validation and transformation, data capture and structure design
Ability to normalize, join and analyse large datasets, often in unstructured formats
A clear understanding of the methods underlying predictive modelling and the key metrics used to measure and evaluate these
Role models the UKPN values of Respect, Integrity, Diversity & Inclusion, Unity, Continuous Improvement, and Responsibility
Logical and proactive mind-set - constantly seeking out efficiencies, improvements, and solutions to overcome issues
Strong team player with ability to deliver regular reporting that provides insight and KPIs
Deep understanding of the UKPN business and wider developments in the industry

Nature And Scope

The job holder is responsible for ensuring that all work within their portfolio is completed on time, within budget, to high quality standards (in accordance with the departmental methodology) and fulfils the requirements of the scope. The job holder will have extensive involvement in all aspects of the planning, execution, and reporting data analytics on a variety of assurance engagements.

The job holder's principal challenge will be assessing the adequacy of UKPN‚Äôs risk management and control frameworks, as our industry goes through a period of rapid change in regulation, technology, evolving customer expectations, and transitioning to a low-carbon society. Evaluating the risks and opportunities these changes present, and ensuring UKPN is well placed to capitalise on the opportunities and mitigate the risks, will require the job holder to remain abreast of external developments, as well as peer group assurance plans.

Health & Safety Responsibilities

Managers and supervisors carry both legal and company responsibilities for ensuring the health and safety of their employees, those under their control and those who might be affected by the work undertaken, i.e. public, visitors and employees of other organisations. This includes briefing individuals working for them and ensuring there is the necessary understanding, competence and application of requirements to work safely and without harming the environment.

Employees will ensure they fully understand the health and safety risks involved in their work activities and their responsibility to apply the controls needed to manage those risks to acceptable levels. Similarly where work activities can have an adverse impact upon the environment, and particularly where there are legal requirements, employees will understand those impacts and the controls they must ensure are applied.

Employees need to be aware that for some craft and operational roles that work at height, or use fall arrest devices, there is an upper weight limit of 116Kg due to maximum safe working load of the safety equipment that is used.

If in doubt ask!

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
6 months FTC




¬£200 p/day PAYE




London/Leeds/Edinburgh




We are looking for an experienced data analyst who will support data analysis and work on projects supporting consumer decision-making when accessing pension savings.




About The Role




We are running a field trial with industry to test interventions to improve consumer engagement with pension decumulation decisions. You will join this project as a dedicated resource to support data analysis for this work.




Key Responsibilities And Tasks




Working with the project team to deliver analysis that will underpin the field trial.
Processing, cleaning, and analysing administrative data.
Delivering own ideas to the table of how best the data could be analyzed
We use R for data processing and cleaning, so you will need a good understanding of R.
We use GitLab for our version control, so experience of this is desirable.




Required Technical Skills




Coding skills in R to analyze datasets
Experience in Git
Experience in delivering analytical projects including identifying and analysing diverse sources of information to inform analysis
Ability to communicate and explain complex issues with clarity, simplicity, and precision




Desirable Skills




Experience in experimental methods and/or other causal inference methods
Understanding of policy making and the evidence required to support it.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst (Poland)
Description:
Vantage Point is a leading Consultancy dealing with Top Investment Banks and Buy-Side Financial Services Businesses. Our areas of specialism include Process Engineering, Data Operations, Front-Back Office Operations, Regulatory Compliance and Risk.




We are focused on recruiting the brightest graduate talent. We hire people with passion that demonstrate that they have what it takes to succeed in the Financial Services industry. Through our experience we have created the Vantage Point Advantage Accelerator Programme, this unique Model delivers formal training, personal development and mentoring to create high calibre, highly skilled Change Professionals.




With a rapidly expanding client base, Vantage Point is looking to hire Data Scientists with a strong academic background in data science, statistics and/or mathematics to join our ambitious and fast growing team. This will be a client-facing role (following a fast tracked training process) and you will be working on client site in London. Employed under our innovative AdVantage Accelerator Programme, this is a 18 month scheme.




Requirements:

University degree in a data science, statistical, mathematical, accountancy or finance degree or other relevant subject.
Experience of working within analytics and/or data science is beneficial but not essential
A real passion for data and analytics
Excellent communication skills (Must be Fluent in English) ability to generate ideas and execute them effectively
The ability to organise time, learn quickly and work well under pressure
Deliver focused and strong attention to detail
An Analytical Mind
Confident, Ambitious, Client focused attitude
Strong entrepreneurial, analytical, quantitative and client relations‚Äô skills.
Eligibility to work in Poland at the time of starting employment. Please note, we are not able to sponsor work visas.




What we are offering:

Training in Investment Banking business knowledge
All relevant technical and analytical training
A fantastic starting point for a career in Banking
Dynamic and exciting environment
Excellent experience




If you feel that you meet the criteria of the Graduate Business Consultant then please apply! Deadlines




This program has a start date for the beginning of March 2023. We are recruiting on a rolling basis so please apply earlier for consideration. We look forward to receiving you application.




If you feel that you meet the criteria for this exciting opportunity then please apply!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Remote Working We are looking for an enthusiastic and driven Data Analyst. The successful candidate will drive business improvements through use of data to provide key insights which inform business decisions. Working with the team, the post-holder will assist in the development of systems to provide effective data capture and analysis against existing datasets. The post holder will be comfortable working with large amounts of data toorganise, categorise and classify it to make it more effective and usable.




The role will consist of: Developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality; Using data and analysing results using statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports; Interpreting trends in complex data sets to identify and assess key risks for our lifecycle fund; Filtering and "cleaning" data in order to align datasets and provide meaningful comparators; Working with the team to prioritise information needs and present salient trend analysis that assists business decisions; Identifying and defining new process improvement opportunities.Qualifications or Required Experience:




Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques; Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, Operational Decision Manager, Power BI etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks would be desirable but not essential); Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc); Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy; Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings; BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics desireableSalary and Benefits: You will be working for a modern, forward-thinking business; that believes the strengths, skills and personalities of their people are the key to the groups success. This is a full time, permanent role for which you will receive a competitive salary and bonus scheme as well as role dependant additional benefits. To be considered for this Data Analyst role, please apply and we will contact you as soon as possible.




Applications If you feel that you have the relevant experience to be successful in this position and would like to find out more please apply online today attaching a copy of your current CV. Alternatively contact us on (phone number removed).




Howells Solutions are an Equal Opportunities employer. All applications will be dealt with in the strictest confidence. Howells Solutions acts as an Employment Business for the supply of temporary workers and an Employment Agency in relation to permanent vacancies

Title: Data analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a data analyst to join us here at GWI. Not just any data analyst though. Someone ambitious and genuine, who works best in the midst of a collaborative and forward-thinking team. That‚Äôs because as a GWIer you‚Äôll be immersed in the fast-moving world of data tech. We think big to make an impact, we‚Äôre not afraid to ask why, and we always show respect. Those values are what got us where we are today, and they‚Äôre a big part of what we‚Äôre looking for in you.
About The Job
Our newly formed Business Data & Analytics department is on a journey to empower every area of the business with quality data, insights, automated efficiencies and analytics. Our goal is to enhance business performance and to give every GWIer the opportunity to make the best, timely decisions to move at the pace that makes GWI special. GWI is a data company where we power insights for some of the biggest global businesses, but the BD&A team is all about looking inwards and unlocking huge opportunities to work cross-functionally across departments to power up our internal teams with internal data.
We are hiring an experienced data analyst to support the build of our new data and analytics platform as well as varied projects and initiatives across the business. You should be able to extract, integrate and blend data and look for trends and patterns for both system needs and business analysis needs. You will have experience in setting up data management processes, establishing standards and building data models, through to profiling and analysing data in any system, internal or 3rd party, including data lakes and data warehouses. You will be comfortable working with metadata, data lineage and master data and confidently be able to advise the business on these areas.
What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Learn and understand how the data works and be ready to answer questions of the data
Take ownership of data management, data dictionaries and setting standards on data
Document data, data flows, processes and data models
Analyse and document system data for integration into Data Lake and Data Warehouse
Collaborate with Enterprise Data Architect, business experts, and analysts to integrate systems and automate data collection processes
Work with data ingestion pipelines built by Data Engineers and be hands on to support data issues or questions raised on data
Problem solve issues through deep-dive data investigation and present back your findings
Be an advocate for data quality
Setup proactive monitoring of data to support either data quality or timely insights for departmental action
Produce MI and dashboards which help users understand key pressure points in data or processes
Support data testing activities across business and technical areas
Ensure data is available in a fit-for-purpose and timely manner for business and analytics consumption

About You
First things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we haven‚Äôt come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. You are joining a small team at the early stages of our greenfield journey. We are looking for someone who is ready and willing to roll sleeves up and get stuck into setting up our data management capabilities. You will have experience with the journey to build up a modern data framework and with your drive and innovation you are ready to deliver data management and data quality for the business. So if you think we‚Äôll see that in you, then you‚Äôre already halfway there. Here‚Äôs the rest of what we‚Äôd like you to bring to the table.
Technical

Highly proficient in SQL and able to write complex queries utilising CTEs and Window functions
Data manipulation and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience in data reconciliation against any systems, data platform or BI reporting sources
Experience in designing and implementing workflows for management of data to support business areas as well as the BD&A team
Highly proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets
Experience with Tableau highly desirable
Experience with Python highly desirable
Preferable experience with GCP and the GCP data components
Experience with DBT, Stitch or similar highly desirable
Experience supporting QA and User Acceptance Testing processes
Knowledgeable on modern data architecture such as Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Lakehouse, Data Mesh etc.
Delivering incremental value through Scrum and Kanban methodologies

Competencies

Ability to find solutions when faced with challenges and be articulate when offering viable recommendations
Ability to interpret impact of changes to business rules on the data and data integration pipelines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to write up and present findings
Self-driven and constantly striving to improve data
Analytical and agile mindset and ability to see the big picture alongside the value of incremental delivery
Natural problem solver who can make recommendations at pace
Ability to scope, estimate and deliver committed work on time, on own and as part of Agile team
Understand, if not live and breathe the mantra, that good quality data is the backbone of every business

Our Benefits
Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. That‚Äôs why when you work for us, you‚Äôll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.

Competitive salary and performance-based bonus
Generous training budget
25 days holiday and Christmas office closure days on top
Allocated shares according to GWI‚Äôs share scheme
A range of discounts and freebies
Accredited learning and development programs
Enhanced primary caregiver and co-caregiver‚Äôs benefits
Flexitime and a great work-life balance
Health Cash plan
Referral bonus scheme
Mobile phone contract
Early finishes on Fridays
A well-stocked fridge and plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
Commit a working day to charity each year
Social activities and team outings

Who We Are
GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who you‚Äôre speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.
Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.
It‚Äôs been going well, too. Since launching in 2009, we‚Äôve become one of the UK‚Äôs fastest growing target audience companies. We‚Äôre not about to stop growing any time soon. As a business, we‚Äôre on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and we‚Äôre on the lookout for talented people to join us.
Diversity & Inclusion
Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. We‚Äôd get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldn‚Äôt have got off the ground as a business.
Although things certainly aren‚Äôt perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated ‚Äì so we‚Äôd expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, it‚Äôs really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.
Show more Show less
