Our newly formed Business Data & Analytics department is on a journey to empower every area of the business with quality data, insights, automated efficiencies and analytics. Our goal is to enhance business performance and to give every GWIer the opportunity to make the best, timely decisions to move at the pace that makes GWI special. GWI is a data company where we power insights for some of the biggest global businesses, but the BD&A team is all about looking inwards and unlocking huge opportunities to work cross-functionally across departments to power up our internal teams with internal data.
We are hiring an experienced data analyst to support the build of our new data and analytics platform as well as varied projects and initiatives across the business. You should be able to extract, integrate and blend data and look for trends and patterns for both system needs and business analysis needs. You will have experience in setting up data management processes, establishing standards and building data models, through to profiling and analysing data in any system, internal or 3rd party, including data lakes and data warehouses. You will be comfortable working with metadata, data lineage and master data and confidently be able to advise the business on these areas.
What You‚Äôll Be Doing
  • Learn and understand how the data works and be ready to answer questions of the data
  • Take ownership of data management, data dictionaries and setting standards on data
  • Document data, data flows, processes and data models
  • Analyse and document system data for integration into Data Lake and Data Warehouse
  • Collaborate with Enterprise Data Architect, business experts, and analysts to integrate systems and automate data collection processes
  • Work with data ingestion pipelines built by Data Engineers and be hands on to support data issues or questions raised on data
  • Problem solve issues through deep-dive data investigation and present back your findings
  • Be an advocate for data quality
  • Setup proactive monitoring of data to support either data quality or timely insights for departmental action
  • Produce MI and dashboards which help users understand key pressure points in data or processes
  • Support data testing activities across business and technical areas
  • Ensure data is available in a fit-for-purpose and timely manner for business and analytics consumption
About You
First things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we haven‚Äôt come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. You are joining a small team at the early stages of our greenfield journey. We are looking for someone who is ready and willing to roll sleeves up and get stuck into setting up our data management capabilities. You will have experience with the journey to build up a modern data framework and with your drive and innovation you are ready to deliver data management and data quality for the business. So if you think we‚Äôll see that in you, then you‚Äôre already halfway there. Here‚Äôs the rest of what we‚Äôd like you to bring to the table.
Technical
  • Highly proficient in SQL and able to write complex queries utilising CTEs and Window functions
  • Data manipulation and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Experience in data reconciliation against any systems, data platform or BI reporting sources
  • Experience in designing and implementing workflows for management of data to support business areas as well as the BD&A team
  • Highly proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets
  • Experience with Tableau highly desirable
  • Experience with Python highly desirable
  • Preferable experience with GCP and the GCP data components
  • Experience with DBT, Stitch or similar highly desirable
  • Experience supporting QA and User Acceptance Testing processes
  • Knowledgeable on modern data architecture such as Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Lakehouse, Data Mesh etc.
  • Delivering incremental value through Scrum and Kanban methodologies
Competencies
  • Ability to find solutions when faced with challenges and be articulate when offering viable recommendations
  • Ability to interpret impact of changes to business rules on the data and data integration pipelines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to write up and present findings
  • Self-driven and constantly striving to improve data
  • Analytical and agile mindset and ability to see the big picture alongside the value of incremental delivery
  • Natural problem solver who can make recommendations at pace
  • Ability to scope, estimate and deliver committed work on time, on own and as part of Agile team
  • Understand, if not live and breathe the mantra, that good quality data is the backbone of every business
Our Benefits
Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. That‚Äôs why when you work for us, you‚Äôll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.
  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonus
  • Generous training budget
  • 25 days holiday and Christmas office closure days on top
  • Allocated shares according to GWI‚Äôs share scheme
  • A range of discounts and freebies
  • Accredited learning and development programs
  • Enhanced primary caregiver and co-caregiver‚Äôs benefits
  • Flexitime and a great work-life balance
  • Health Cash plan
  • Referral bonus scheme
  • Mobile phone contract
  • Early finishes on Fridays
  • A well-stocked fridge and plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
  • Commit a working day to charity each year
  • Social activities and team outings
Who We Are
GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who you‚Äôre speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.
Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.
It‚Äôs been going well, too. Since launching in 2009, we‚Äôve become one of the UK‚Äôs fastest growing target audience companies. We‚Äôre not about to stop growing any time soon. As a business, we‚Äôre on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and we‚Äôre on the lookout for talented people to join us.
Diversity & Inclusion
Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. We‚Äôd get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldn‚Äôt have got off the ground as a business.
Although things certainly aren‚Äôt perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated ‚Äì so we‚Äôd expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, it‚Äôs really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - London Based Studio. Remote in Europe.

Join our data analytics team and take a key role in the continued growth of our live games and the successful launches of new games. With your analysis, our teams (product, marketing, art, engineering etc.) will make better informed decisions. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on a highly respected and fast-growing mobile games studio.

We continually re-evaluate our analytics stack, aiming to have an industry-leading approach. You will be working especially closely with senior management, other analysts, product managers, and the marketing team.

You will help lead deeper explorative analyses to directly shape the future direction of our games. The ability to clearly articulate hypotheses, run complex SQL queries to mine the wealth of data we collect, and present findings and suggestions is also critical to the role. You will be expected to be proactive in contributing data-backed recommendations for our gaming titles.

Responsibilities

Writing and maintaining SQL queries and SQL-driven dashboards
Delivering accurate, insightful and actionable analysis to the rest of the company, including Product Managers and Performance Marketers
Creating self-conducted deep-dive reports, mining available behavioural data to spot barriers to and opportunities for improved performance
Assisting in designing and assessing the results of split testing experiments conducted in our games Requirements
Strong experience in creating SQL queries
Experience with designing and setting up dashboards in BI tools is a plus
Advanced MS Excel skills
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Ideally with R or Python) is highly desired
Experience within, or a passion for game, bonus points for mobile
Life at with us

Our HQ is in the heart of central London - although currently we work completely from home due to COVID policy. We‚Äôre a fast-moving, creative studio. Our people are what makes our studio fun, exciting and productive.

We Reward Our Employees With

Flexible working hours - core hours 10am-5pm
We strive to maintain a healthy work/life balance
Competitive salaries
There is a discretionary bonus based on company and individual performance and we keep salaries up to date during the annual pay review
Support with relocation
Support to learn, develop and progress with us
Free snacks and drinks
Amazing socials, company outings, game jams, Friday night drinks and more!
Company pension contribution
28 days holiday and additional days off between Christmas and New Year. There is a tenure reward scheme where you will gain extra holidays
We value diversity and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all suitable applicants. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:
We are partnered with a global Hedge Fund, with offices across the US, Asia and here in London. They are focused on commodities and equities, and deal with huge amounts of trading/financial data on a daily basis. Coming out of a few very strong years they are now looking to invest back into their technology/data sides of the business and are subsequently looking at bringing on a talented, data-orientated analyst to work closely with their investment teams.




Role Overview




You would be working within a global team of data analysts, data scientists, and content experts, across each of their key geographic locations, the Investment Data Analyst will serve as a steward for all of the internal and external data content to provide actionable data to their investors.




Key responsibilities:




‚Ä¢ Work with the Data Sourcing & Strategy team, Portfolio Managers, Analysts and Data Vendors to assist in the delivery and evaluation of new datasets

‚Ä¢ Understand use cases of investors and serve as an in-house data expert across a wide range of datasets to translate requirements and design data models for appropriate storage, distribution and consumption

‚Ä¢ Take ownership and manage data onboarding requirements by authoring content documentation and working closely with Data Engineers to assist them with automating their data ingestion pipeline

‚Ä¢ Create and enhance python-based Data Quality Checks as part of the onboarding process to ensure data is suitable for consumption




Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs/master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or a related field.

‚Ä¢ A passion for data with experience in applying that to high quality data products in an investment setting

‚Ä¢ Ability to wrangle data and perform exploratory and systematic data analysis

‚Ä¢ Experience in coding in Python

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of SQL and relational databases

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with AWS Product Suite including S3, Redshift, Spectrum and SNS a plus




Tech Stack: Python, SQL, AWS, Airflow, S3, Redshift




This client can offer a good work life balance with 3 days a week in their London office and a competitive salary package, alongside providing the exciting opportunity to work on a cutting edge tech stack, driving significant value across a key area of one of the world's leading Hedge Funds.




If this looks interesting please apply to find out more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CoinTracker makes cryptocurrency portfolio tracking and tax compliance simple. Our mission is to increase the financial freedom and prosperity of the world.




Some things we‚Äôre proud of:

üìà 3% of all global cryptocurrency assets are tracked on CoinTracker ($50B daily)

üí≤ Profitable

ü§ù Partnered with Coinbase, TurboTax, OpenSea, and other industry leaders

üíº Venture-backed by Accel, Y Combinator, and other top investors

üó∫Ô∏è Founders: Jon previously built TextNow (200M downloads), Chandan was previously a product manager at Google




Learn more about our mission, culture, and hiring process: https://cointracker.notion.site/CoinTracker-is-hiring-7308c712493940a3b6e62257d283dad8




Your opportunity:

CoinTracker‚Äôs mission is to enable everyone in the world to use crypto with peace of mind. As a data analyst, your goal is to take our wide variety of data (blockchains, transactions, usage, mobile/web, etc.) and make it accessible and impact-driven. You‚Äôll be building visualizations, running queries, and helping product, growth, marketing, partnerships, business, and support teams make important decisions and build the best products for the future of crypto.




1-year outcomes:

Comprehensive dashboards of the user lifecycle (signup, engagement, churn) across our web and mobile platforms.
Team-specific dashboards launched with KPIs and metrics relevant to the team i.e. Growth, Consumer, Finance, Support, etc.
Intake process created with a prioritized backlog of data requests for future tools/dashboards.
Completed pricing analysis to develop new pricing model/experiments for CoinTracker




You will:

Analyze our ads and marketing data to develop user models and compute LTV and effectiveness of different channels.
Work with our engagement/churn/retention data alongside product teams to improve product features, measure usage, and manage user cohorts.
Help develop finance/long-term models and understand tax/portfolio plan purchase and retention behaviors.
Partner with support to super-charge analytics for support tickets, queues, wait times, and help support be a highly-efficient organization.




Some of the skills we're excited about:

SQL Programming knowledge/ability to write queries comfortably
Experience with Tableau/Mixpanel/etc. for visualization and dashboards
Curious mindset to dig into datasets and find issues/concerns
Statistical knowledge to understand p-values, confidence intervals, and impact of experiments
XFN Collaboration skills to work with PM, Eng, Design, Finance, Support, etc. to gather requirements and provide solutions




What's it like working at CoinTracker?

We are a fully internationally distributed, tight-knit team. We have minimal process, and the majority of our time is spent working and collaborating asynchronously through tools like Figma, Github, Google Meet, Linear, Notion, Slack, Zendesk. We also stay aligned and bonded through weekly sprints, standups, all hands, and socials. We aim to empower every individual on the team with full transparency, ownership, autonomy, and clear objectives.




If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you! Not sure you‚Äôre a perfect fit? Reach out anyway. We‚Äôre looking for awesome individuals, not folks who perfectly match a job posting.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: West London, Hybrid Working

Duration: 6 Months initial contract

Company: Mass Media Company




Job Description

Working within the Content Management group and reporting to the Senior Manager, Data & Workflow, this role will be responsible for creating or supporting the creation of analytical solutions, allowing teams both within the Content Management group as well as other internal groups to self-serve metrics and other relevant data supporting processes and workflows. The Business Analyst will manage the Data Entry Administrator who will assist with capturing, cleaning and manipulating data so that it can be used in projects and reporting. Other responsibilities include gathering data, system and reporting requirements from key stakeholders, identifying improvements to processes and translating them into solutions.




Responsibilities

‚óè Supporting the Senior Manager on critical project requirements.

‚óè Managing and supporting the Data Entry Administrator

‚óè Extraction of data from multiple databases using SQL

‚óè Creation and maintenance of reports in visualisation tools such as PowerBI and Tableau, ensuring stakeholder understanding and satisfaction

‚óè Provide strategic input into improvements and opportunities related to the metric findings

‚óè Creating and delivering impactful analytics to Senior Management

‚óè Requirements gathering, translating into basic wireframes and flowcharts using LucidChart

‚óè Working alongside Project Managers and Engineering groups to ensure requirements are successfully executed and providing UAT where required




Skills and Qualifications

‚óè Proactive strategic thinker with problem-solving skills

‚óè Critical thinking and analytical skills

‚óè Exceptional attention to detail and ability to track issues to resolution

‚óè Strong presentation and communication skills, with ability to present in a clear and professional way

‚óè Intermediate level SQL coding

‚óè Experience with visualisation tools such as PowerBi & Tableau is preferred

‚óè Advanced experience using Microsoft & Google Suites, particularly Excel, Sheets and Slides

‚óè Team Oriented, self-starter: ability to work in a team as well as to work and lead efforts independently

‚óè Ability to explain complex data sets to non-technical staff in a simplified manner

‚óè Direct experience working with and across various cultures

‚óè Understanding of operational workflows and media compliance an advantage

‚óè Qualification in business analysis or equivalent an advantage




Please apply to find out more information and to be considered for the position.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an expert on reporting performance utilizing data and data analytics?

Are you creatively minded yet data and insight-driven?




About our Team

The Data & Analytics Center of Excellence is critical to the objectives of Elsevier. It comprises over 20 data professionals with a common goal ‚Äì to deliver high quality insights and analytics. To drive data-based decisions in the business, from hypothesis testing to modelling/prediction and marketing analytics to corporate reporting. The D&A team is global, spanning Asia, Europe and North America.




About the Role

Focussed on marketing analytics the purpose is to develop dashboards and actionable insights that support colleagues to drive marketing effectiveness. Achieved by combining a wide variety of quantitative and qualitative data sources and by utilizing a comprehensive analytics stack. The Data Analyst role is mapped to a dedicated Data & Analytics career framework with clear development opportunities/career path options.

Responsibilities




Working with stakeholders to understand business challenges and then translate those into the appropriate analytics solution
Using advanced data blending and modelling techniques to produce analysis-ready datasets
Creating reporting dashboards and data visualizations which provide clear and actionable insights for colleagues
Analysing customer behaviour using advanced techniques/tools and proactively use these analyses to steer business decisions
Working with internal analytics and technology partners to drive improvements to data analytics processes and create operational efficiencies
Requirements
Possess Demonstrable experience in a similar analytics role
Enjoy working in programming languages such as SQL or Python
Experience Works with cloud-based data warehouse and analytics tools such as AWS suite, Snowflake, Databricks, DBT
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI to tell powerful stories with data
Experience communicating effectively and interacts well with technical/non-technical colleagues at all levels
Demonstrate noticeable attention to data governance principles and takes time to document processes




Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.




Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working with us

We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.

Working for you

At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:




Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days
Health screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefits
Wellbeing programs
Life assurance
Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme
Long service awards
Save As You Earn share option scheme
Travel Season ticket loan
Maternity, paternity and shared parental leave
Access to emergency care for both the elderly and children
RECARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to you
Access to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteer
Access to extensive learning and development resources
Access to employee discounts via Perks at Work




About Us

A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world‚Äôs grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.




Join Us

Purposeful Work

When you work with us, your work matters. You are part of an organization that nurtures your curiosity to stimulate innovation for the communities that we serve.




Growing Every Day

Like the communities we serve, you are on a constant path of discovery to shape your career and personal development.




Colleagues Who Care

You will be part of the Elsevier family. We will support your well-being and provide the flexibility you need to thrive at work and home.




Together, we create possibilities.

Join us

Show more Show less

  • Working with internal analytics and technology partners to drive improvements to data analytics processes and create operational efficiencies
  • Requirements
  • Possess Demonstrable experience in a similar analytics role
  • Enjoy working in programming languages such as SQL or Python
  • Experience Works with cloud-based data warehouse and analytics tools such as AWS suite, Snowflake, Databricks, DBT
  • Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI to tell powerful stories with data
  • Experience communicating effectively and interacts well with technical/non-technical colleagues at all levels
  • Demonstrate noticeable attention to data governance principles and takes time to document processes


Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.


  • Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive


Working with us

We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.

Working for you

At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:


  • Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days
  • Health screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefits
  • Wellbeing programs
  • Life assurance
  • Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme
  • Long service awards
  • Save As You Earn share option scheme
  • Travel Season ticket loan
  • Maternity, paternity and shared parental leave
  • Access to emergency care for both the elderly and children
  • RECARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to you
  • Access to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteer
  • Access to extensive learning and development resources
  • Access to employee discounts via Perks at Work


About Us

A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world‚Äôs grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.


Join Us

Purposeful Work

When you work with us, your work matters. You are part of an organization that nurtures your curiosity to stimulate innovation for the communities that we serve.


Growing Every Day

Like the communities we serve, you are on a constant path of discovery to shape your career and personal development.


Colleagues Who Care

You will be part of the Elsevier family. We will support your well-being and provide the flexibility you need to thrive at work and home.


Together, we create possibilities.

Join us

Title: Senior Analyst, Analytics & Insights
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we‚Äôre building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you‚Äôre ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There‚Äôs no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop‚Äîwhile staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart‚Äôs Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart‚Äôs unparalleled grocery industry data and our most important grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of our business, and this role is focused on leveraging data and analytics to influence business decision making, understand customer behavior, and drive growth of key company goals.

This Senior Analyst will strive to understand the dynamics of the marketplace through descriptive analysis, supporting the team in tackling ambiguous problems using data, and providing the both internal and external teams with the tools to answer ‚Äúhow did the business perform?‚Äù and ‚Äúwhy did it perform that way?‚Äù You will be a subject matter expert on Instacart‚Äôs data and tools in order to efficiently answer key business questions and build sustainable solutions to enable stakeholders to progressively answer more and more of these questions on their own.

About The Job

Support Instacart‚Äôs largest retail partners in helping them make data-driven decisions
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business and develop analysis, dashboards, and reporting to address their needs
Support internal teams with data that will help them best serve their accounts and strengthen the partnership across several key areas:
Identify opportunities for optimization and growth through the analysis of performance relative to peer benchmarks
Develop data-driven business cases to help expand Instacart‚Äôs retail partnerships
Monitor operational performance to ensure consistently excellent service for Instacart‚Äôs end customers
Help prepare for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews
Become a subject matter expert in Instacart‚Äôs data and tools:
Immerse yourself in Instacart‚Äôs vast database and extract relevant datasets using SQL
Develop low-touch, self-serve reporting for both internal and external teams
Understand the data needs of both internal and external teams and, where appropriate, get those requirements on the roadmap for the scalable solutions being developed by other people on our team

About You

3+ years work experience in a quantitative role. This is a great opportunity for those with experience in Consulting, Banking, Analytics, or similar roles. Experience with retail and e-commerce is a plus
Advanced SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools experience required
Flexible and adaptable; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand their goals and tailor your approach accordingly
Resourceful; ability to find answers to tough questions (especially data-related) by tracking down the right data and stakeholders
Thinking sustainably and building for scale; develop long-term solutions to recurring problems
Strong analytical skills; ability to logically break down complex problems and identify potential pitfalls
Ability to effectively manage multiple key stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, and provide guidance on more efficient approaches as needed

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we‚Äôre building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you‚Äôre ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There‚Äôs no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop‚Äîwhile staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart‚Äôs Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart‚Äôs rich grocery industry data and our grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of Instacart‚Äôs business model, and our retail partners' success is of paramount importance to us. This role is focused on building industry leading market intelligence reporting and analytics to help Instacart and its retail partners make better strategic and tactical business decisions. This is a highly impactful role that will engage in building solutions with visibility to the Instacart Executive team as well as to leading largest North American retailers.

As this Senior Analyst you will be responsible for a wide range of tasks such as defining data requirements, running descriptive analysis, designing and building dashboards, and preparing in-depth ‚Äúso-what‚Äù analysis and business recommendations. You will be able to build high-level and scalable solutions as well as have the ability to dive deeper into the data to uncover actionable insights.

About The Job

Serve as a Subject Matter Expert on the grocery e-commerce industry, developing market intelligence reports by leveraging internal and 3rd party data
Be responsible for the development, maintenance, and documentation of market intelligence metrics, including the understanding and structuring of 3rd party data, creation of new data models and analytics layers, and construction of complex yet concise dashboards
Work closely with cross-functional teams to contribute to the development of periodic market intelligence reports by providing relevant and compelling insights on market and competitive trends
Work closely with the Business Development team to understand their requirements and create compelling visual dashboards, reports, and presentations
Lead data investigations to better understand retailer performance in relation to market trends
Adhere to best practices in reporting and analysis, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation

About You

3+ years of experience in an analytics and business intelligence role
Strong analytical skills and ability to leverage data to identify trends and influence business decisions
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools, particularly Tableau
Ability to quickly respond to problems independently, consider all stakeholder needs, and provide clear, concise answers to complex data
Excellent communication skills and ability to manage multiple stakeholder groups
Experience with dbt or other data transformation tools is a plus
Bachelor's degree or equivalent is required

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Senior Technology GRC Analyst
Description:
The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That‚Äôs where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world‚Äôs most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains.




Our security team defends the products, data and systems that power Chainalysis. We are committed to building a diverse team of builders, breakers and shapers to address complex security problems in a novel, exciting space.




A Senior GRC Analyst is proficient at taking in the inner workings of Chainalysis and harmonizing them with complex risk, governance, and compliance policies. They do this to both create a more secure and compliant environment for our teams and to build trusting relationships with our customers. As a security advocate, you are never satisfied with the status quo and are constantly hunting for threats to an organization. Please note, this is a Hybrid role with one day a week in office.




In one year you‚Äôll know you were successful if‚Ä¶




You have led the efforts to help operationalize various GRC capability areas such as enterprise security risk management, compliance management, and policy management
Partner with a growing sales team by contributing to the development of customer-facing materials covering topics related to security, privacy, and compliance features of our products and services
You have helped complete CMMC attestation Lvl 1 Implemented a Technological Based Risk Register.
Assisted with internal and external audit and risk assessments (eg. SOC2, GDPR, ISO27001)
Lead or assisted with the remediation of risk assessment findings




A Background Like This Helps




Previously held relevant security or related role(s)
Experience with Software-as-a-Service or cloud service providers industry challenges
Foundational knowledge of IT Audit/compliance process and activities
Foundational knowledge of technical risk analysis and methodologies
Experience working in a regulated environment enforcing policies and procedures
Possesses the ability to drive projects to conclusion, while collaborating with a diverse
group of professionals from both technical and non-technical background
Able to collect, synthesize, and analyze data from multiple outputs, including computer log sources to draw valid conclusions.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with diverse and distributed teams
SOC2, ISO27001, PCI, HITRUST, FEDRAMP and GDPR experience are all big pluses
Verbal communication and presentation skills
Self-motivated with good time management skills




The base salary range for this role is $133,700 to $167,100 on a national basis and may be higher or lower depending on the location of the role. Base salary is just one part of our total rewards package which additionally includes equity, performance bonus or commissions for eligible roles, and competitive benefits. Individual pay decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, relevant work experience, skillset, internal equity, and other factors, consistent with applicable law.




At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.




You belong here.




At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we‚Äôre ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women‚Äôs Day, Harvey Milk Day, World Humanitarian Day, and UN International Migrants Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.




We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can‚Äôt wait to meet you.




Applying from the EU? Please review our Chainalysis Applicant Privacy Policy.




By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.




Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - USA




All employees are required to have or obtain a COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment at Chainalysis, unless an exemption has been approved. All employees shall be required to report their vaccine status. All new employees shall be required to provide proof of their vaccination status prior to the start of their employment.




Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - EMEA




As an employer, Chainalysis is obliged to ensure a healthy and safe working environment. This means that we must try to prevent the coronavirus from spreading inside the workplace and all employees are obliged to follow the local regulations issued by the relevant health authorities.
To help support a safe work environment, we encourage all employees in EMEA to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
Employees will not be required to attend an event or in-person customer meeting.
Employees in the EU and the UK are allowed to travel internationally for internal meetings to any country deemed ‚Äúgreen or amber‚Äù by the EU and the UK authorities. All attendees for Chainalysis in-person events or meetings will be required to adhere to the following guidelines:
International travel will only be permitted if you receive approval from both your manager and Executive Leader
You must familiarize yourself and comply with any screening/safety protocols imposed by the entity/individual hosting the in-person meeting or event
You must comply with any and all safety guidelines and travel restrictions established by applicable law
If you are in close or proximate contact with others at the event/customer site and test positive for COVID-19, you must immediately notify the People Team and avoid contact with others for 10 days




Chainalysis COVID-19 Policy - APAC




With circumstances changing on a regular basis and parts of our APAC team going in and out of mandatory lockdown, APAC will continue to follow country legislation and guidelines.

Title: Principal Performance Engineer
Description:
Mimecast is looking for an experienced Principal Performance Engineer who will be responsible for working with the Architecture and Engineering teams to deliver performance improvement across our whole platform.




The ideal candidate will be someone who possesses excellent problem-solving skills, and excellent understanding of how complex systems interact, an excellent communicator with a strong continuous improvement mindset.




Objective




Work with fellow architects, engineering leads and product managers to improve the performance, scalability and resilience of Mimecast Cloud-based systems. You will be hands on helping to improve the design, testing and monitoring of our applications and infrastructure.




Requirements




10+ years of Performance Engineering/Testing/Software development; BS/MS or related/comparable
Expertise with Java or similar languages
Experience with Performance Engineering tools ‚Äì JMeter, LoadRunner, JProfiler, APM etc
Experience of high volume, scalable, distributed systems
Provide vision and leadership enabling teams to own performance engineering in their areas
Ensure that non-functional requirements are well defined and understood by the responsible teams
Design and implement performance & resilience tests across Mimecast services to increase understanding of how our services perform under positive and negative conditions
Excellent verbal and written communication
Document and communicate test results and identify performance & resilience issues
Keep abreast of the latest open-source and commercial tools to provide improved monitoring and testing




Desirable




Experience of rolling out an automated performance test suite across an organization
Experience commercial or open-source chaos testing tools (e.g. Gremlin, ChaosMonkey etc)
Experience with APM/distributed tracing tools, either open-source (e.g. Jaeger) or commercial (e.g. Dynatrace/Datadog)
Working with PostgreSQL, Redis, or similar
Detailed knowledge of TLS, TCP/IP, SMTP
Experience with container/orchestration technology




Character




Hands-on problem solving with a willingness to do whatever it takes to complete an objective
The ability to identify when to escalate or look for help on an issue
The drive and confidence to own a task from start to finish
The discipline to manage their own time and priorities, without the need for micro-management
The flexibility to adapt to a constantly changing landscape
A passion for technology beyond what is required to perform their daily tasks




Why Mimecast?




We‚Äôre fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly ‚Äì and outstandingly. We‚Äôre big on honesty because it makes us better. We‚Äôre empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That‚Äôs The Mimecast Way.




And the Mimecast way is also a hybrid-working way. We empower our people to balance their time between home and the office in a way that works best for them, their team, and our stakeholders.




Become a Mimecaster and put corporate data under your protection. Fill our teams with respect. And bring cybercrime-obstructing energy to your work. Be passionate. Be powerful. Be alive with purpose.




DEI Statement




Cybersecurity is a community effort. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone ‚Äì unless they‚Äôre a cybercriminal, of course.




We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we‚Äôd encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.




We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality, or any other protected characteristic won‚Äôt affect your application.




Due to certain obligations to our customers, an offer of employment will be subject to your successful completion of applicable background checks, conducted in accordance with local law.




In an effort to protect the health and resilience of our global community, Mimecast requires all individuals to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and/or receive a negative test before entry into our offices.

HTML:
Mimecast is looking for an experienced Principal Performance Engineer who will be responsible for working with the Architecture and Engineering teams to deliver performance improvement across our whole platform.


The ideal candidate will be someone who possesses excellent problem-solving skills, and excellent understanding of how complex systems interact, an excellent communicator with a strong continuous improvement mindset.


Objective


Work with fellow architects, engineering leads and product managers to improve the performance, scalability and resilience of Mimecast Cloud-based systems. You will be hands on helping to improve the design, testing and monitoring of our applications and infrastructure.


Requirements


  • 10+ years of Performance Engineering/Testing/Software development; BS/MS or related/comparable
  • Expertise with Java or similar languages
  • Experience with Performance Engineering tools ‚Äì JMeter, LoadRunner, JProfiler, APM etc
  • Experience of high volume, scalable, distributed systems
  • Provide vision and leadership enabling teams to own performance engineering in their areas
  • Ensure that non-functional requirements are well defined and understood by the responsible teams
  • Design and implement performance & resilience tests across Mimecast services to increase understanding of how our services perform under positive and negative conditions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Document and communicate test results and identify performance & resilience issues
  • Keep abreast of the latest open-source and commercial tools to provide improved monitoring and testing


Desirable


  • Experience of rolling out an automated performance test suite across an organization
  • Experience commercial or open-source chaos testing tools (e.g. Gremlin, ChaosMonkey etc)
  • Experience with APM/distributed tracing tools, either open-source (e.g. Jaeger) or commercial (e.g. Dynatrace/Datadog)
  • Working with PostgreSQL, Redis, or similar
  • Detailed knowledge of TLS, TCP/IP, SMTP
  • Experience with container/orchestration technology


Character


  • Hands-on problem solving with a willingness to do whatever it takes to complete an objective
  • The ability to identify when to escalate or look for help on an issue
  • The drive and confidence to own a task from start to finish
  • The discipline to manage their own time and priorities, without the need for micro-management
  • The flexibility to adapt to a constantly changing landscape
  • A passion for technology beyond what is required to perform their daily tasks


Why Mimecast?


We‚Äôre fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly ‚Äì and outstandingly. We‚Äôre big on honesty because it makes us better. We‚Äôre empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That‚Äôs The Mimecast Way.


And the Mimecast way is also a hybrid-working way. We empower our people to balance their time between home and the office in a way that works best for them, their team, and our stakeholders.


Become a Mimecaster and put corporate data under your protection. Fill our teams with respect. And bring cybercrime-obstructing energy to your work. Be passionate. Be powerful. Be alive with purpose.


DEI Statement


Cybersecurity is a community effort. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone ‚Äì unless they‚Äôre a cybercriminal, of course.


We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we‚Äôd encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.


We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality, or any other protected characteristic won‚Äôt affect your application.


Due to certain obligations to our customers, an offer of employment will be subject to your successful completion of applicable background checks, conducted in accordance with local law.


In an effort to protect the health and resilience of our global community, Mimecast requires all individuals to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and/or receive a negative test before entry into our offices.

Title: Firmware Engineers and Archtiects
Description:
Imagine being part of a team that is constantly disrupting the industry and changing the way people communicate, collaborate as well as explore our world through all forms of entertainment. At Infinera we have created an Intelligent Transport Network with more speed, capacity and scalability than ever before, utilizing our industry disrupting technology. Imagine a world with unlimited bandwidth to provide endless possibilities. Our network of tomorrow will allow for content and creativity limited only by the limits of your imagination.

We are looking for Firmware Engineers and Architects off all levels from Senior to Principal, that are ready to take on new challenges and be a part of our industry disrupting teams.

Here at Infinera we value our team collaboration and autonomy. As one of our Firmware Engineers and Architects you will be responsible Code design, implementation and testing for Infinera‚Äôs next generation of Optical Engine used for Long Haul, Metro and Data Center Interconnects. You will also be Implementing embedded control firmware for high-reliability fiber optics and optoelectronic modules/sub-system controllers. You will collaborate and contribute on our new product development, as well as work closely across multiple divisions and teams at Infinera.

We would like to welcome you to our industry leading, disrupting and standard setting teams if you have‚Ä¶.

Knowledge/Skills

A BS in Elec/computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent work experience (for our Staff Engineers to our Architects we‚Äôd like you to have a MS, Higher Degree or Equivalent work experience)
3 to 12+ years‚Äô experience in software/firmware architecture and/or development for embedded systems
3 to 12+ years of experience in modern embedded software/firmware engineer and/or architectures with focus on modularity and reusability- like micro-services and container technologies
Highly motivated industry disrupting team player
Experienced in C/C++/Python programming experience & debugging skills for embedded systems.
Familiarity with assertions and functional coverage
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work across multi-functional and geographically diverse team environments
Good understanding of Real-Time Operating
Good understanding of fundamentals of digital and analog circuit design
Work with the development team to trouble shoot optical component (ROSA/TOSA) controls
The ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

Nice To Have Skills

Must have good communication skills
Must have ability and desire to work as a team
Excellent testing, troubleshooting, and debugging skills
Proficient at firmware design and significant coding practice, 10 years+ programming experience in MCUs and real-time OS environment.
Knowledge of numeric algorithms using C++, Matlab or Python.
Experience with Embedded Firmware for control theory or Digital Signal Processing applications

Infinera is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Infinera complies with all applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.
Show more Show less

Title: Staff Software Developer
Description:
Position Overview

Our Developers bring passion, craftsmanship and innovation to the development and delivery of Intelex‚Äôs software products, with the objective of delighting our customers and empowering them with industry-leading capabilities and UX. They collaborate with their peers within an agile (Scrum / Kanban) practice. Our team is moving toward a continuous integration / continuous deployment (CI/CD) model and DevOps as a culture. We work with a range of web applications technologies, including JavaScript frameworks (ReactJS / Webpack) as well as Microsoft technologies (C#, Azure, .NET, SQL)

Responsibilities And Deliverables

Work closely with the Dev Manager and Product Manager to break down business requirements into work items within a development team's scope.
Proactively identify gaps in technology, process, product, and team workflow and act independently to coordinate work to solve these problems within their team.
Coach and mentor members of their team and takes active interest in their professional development.
Design and develop new features supporting customer use cases in existing and new software products.
Work in an agile team environment that practices continuous improvement when planning, estimating, and building software.
Deliver sprint commitments by working proactively with stakeholders to identify and navigate obstacles.
Build high-performing software with an evolving set of tools across several technology stacks and participate in the stewardship of our development process.
Collaborate with cross-functional project teams including Architects, QA, Product Management, and others to delight our clients.
Organizational Alignment

Reports to Manager.
Qualifications

Skills & Work Traits

Passionate about understanding our clients.
Proactive, creative, and self-directed with a commitment to excellence.
Committed to continuous learning and evaluating modern technologies and tools.
Exceptional analysis and troubleshooting skills, and persistence in solving problems.
Excellent research skills combined with the ability to generate options to make technology and architectural decisions.
Ability to drive development process improvements.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent mentorship and coaching skills.
Committed to building high quality, secure, and performant products.
Technical Competencies

Full stack development across different technical stacks including React, Node JS (TS), C# and cloud (Azure) or equivalent.
Experience with relational or NoSQL databases, data computing like snowflake.
Extensive experience with the concepts and building blocks of large-scale applications including messaging systems, load balancing and microservice architecture.
Extensive experience designing and documenting architectural specifications.
Experience with automated pipelines and cloud orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
Ability to identify risks & limitations, prepare a mitigation plan, and encourage ownership & accountability.
Familiarity with performance optimization techniques and their implementation within existing software products and infrastructure.
Experience

8 or more years of professional web application development experience.
Professional experience within agile development practice strongly preferred.
Professional experience within an enterprise software product or SaaS organization strongly preferred.
Education

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or College Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.
Master‚Äôs Degree and/or vendor certifications (such as Microsoft Certified Professional) valued.
Other Requirements

Please note that this role requires a satisfactory Criminal Background Check and Public Safety Verification

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Company Overview

With more than 1,300 clients and 1.6 million users, Intelex Technologies, ULC is a global leader in environmental, health, safety, and quality (EHSQ) management software. Since 1992 its scalable, web-based platform and applications have helped clients across all industries improve business performance, mitigate organization-wide risk, and ensure sustained compliance with internationally accepted standards (e.g., ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001 and OHSAS 18001) and regulatory requirements. Intelex is one of North America‚Äôs fastest-growing tech companies who has recently been recognized as a Great Place to Work for over 7 years, Best Workplace in Technology, Best Workplace for Millennials and Canadian HR Team for fewer than 500 employees and has been recipient of Waterstone‚Äôs Most Admired Corporate Cultures award, and Deloitte‚Äôs Best Managed Companies award. For more information, visit https://www.intelex.com/careers or see what our employees are saying by following our #ProudIntelexian hashtag.

Title: Software Engineer, Java Database Experience
Description:
The database market is massive (IDC estimates it to be $121B+ by 2025!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

The Database Experience team builds the libraries and tools that developers use day-to-day working with MongoDB. Our mission is to increase developer adoption, satisfaction and retention by providing a reliable, enjoyable interface for developers and other end-users.

For this role, we're looking for someone who enjoys designing, writing, and supporting Open Source libraries and standalone tools for developers and administrators using MongoDB. You will have the opportunity to learn from veteran Java programmers, who can help you deepen your knowledge of the Java ecosystem, or advance your career as a writer and speaker.

You might be right for this role if you

Have demonstrable experience writing high-quality software
Experience implementing libraries or applications in Java or other languages that run on the JVM
Are fascinated with concurrency, parallelism and distributed systems
Want to participate in Open Source software development and communities
Communicate well, internally and externally, both in writing and face-to-face
Are excited by our mission and values


You'll be on the team responsible for

Java driver, Java Reactive Streams Driver, Scala Driver, Spark Connector, Kafka Connector, and other JVM-based projects
Testing, delivering and supporting the above across multiple operating systems, JDKs, and MongoDB releases


You'll Have Responsibilities Beyond Writing Code, Including

Working with our Product, Server and Cloud teams on designs and specifications for new customer-facing MongoDB features
Investigating bugs and support requests from commercial and Open Source customers for the libraries and tools our team maintains


Success in this role means

Within three months, you'll know most of the codebase you are responsible for and will be contributing effectively day-to-day fixing bugs, implementing already-planned features and doing peer code-review
Within six months, you'll have implemented small to medium new features; you'll be able to respond effectively to technical support escalations for the parts of the product that you know best; you'll have the trust of the team and our internal customers
Within a year, you'll have helped to deliver several new releases of our software, will have significantly improved the quality, performance and maintainability of our codebase, and will be able to independently scope and design new features of moderate complexity


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we‚Äôre committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees‚Äô wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it‚Äôs like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Java Database Experience
Description:
The database market is massive (IDC estimates it to be $121B+ by 2025!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

The Database Experience team builds the libraries and tools that developers use day-to-day working with MongoDB. Our mission is to increase developer adoption, satisfaction and retention by providing a reliable, enjoyable interface for developers and other end-users.

Our senior engineers are typically specialists in a particular programming language, but are capable of contributing to projects in other languages as well.

For this role, we're looking for someone who enjoys designing, writing, and supporting Open Source libraries and standalone tools for developers and administrators using MongoDB. You will have the opportunity to be surrounded by veteran Java programmers, as you deepen your knowledge of the Java ecosystem, or advance your career as a writer and speaker.

You might be right for this role if you

Have 4+ years of experience writing high-quality software
Experience implementing libraries or applications in Java or other languages that run on the JVM
Are fascinated by, and have experience working with concurrency, parallelism and distributed systems
Want to participate in Open Source software development and communities
Communicate well, internally and externally, both in writing and face-to-face
Advocate for testing and agile development best practices
Can make pragmatic design tradeoffs while balancing features, maintainability, and delivery time
Elevate the skills and expertise of those around you
Are excited by our mission and values


You'll be on the team responsible for

Java driver, Java Reactive Streams Driver, Scala Driver, Spark Connector, Kafka Connector, and other JVM-based projects
Testing, delivering and supporting the above across multiple operating systems, JDKs, and MongoDB releases


You'll Have Responsibilities Beyond Writing Code, Including

Working with our Product, Server and Cloud teams on designs and specifications for new customer-facing MongoDB features
Investigating bugs and support requests from commercial and Open Source customers for the libraries and tools our team maintains
Seeking out speaking or writing opportunities to engage with our developer community
Mentoring junior engineers in both technical and non-technical professional skills


Success in this role means

Within three months, you'll know most of the codebase you are responsible for, and will be contributing effectively day-to-day, fixing bugs, and implementing already-planned features.
Within six months, you will contribute to the roadmap for our products and lead the design and specification of new features. You will have the trust of the team and our internal customers.
Within a year, you will have significantly improved the quality, performance and maintainability of our codebase, and will be taking the lead in designing new features to solve novel customer challenges


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we‚Äôre committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees‚Äô wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it‚Äôs like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

  • Java driver, Java Reactive Streams Driver, Scala Driver, Spark Connector, Kafka Connector, and other JVM-based projects
  • Testing, delivering and supporting the above across multiple operating systems, JDKs, and MongoDB releases

You'll Have Responsibilities Beyond Writing Code, Including
  • Working with our Product, Server and Cloud teams on designs and specifications for new customer-facing MongoDB features
  • Investigating bugs and support requests from commercial and Open Source customers for the libraries and tools our team maintains
  • Seeking out speaking or writing opportunities to engage with our developer community
  • Mentoring junior engineers in both technical and non-technical professional skills

Success in this role means
  • Within three months, you'll know most of the codebase you are responsible for, and will be contributing effectively day-to-day, fixing bugs, and implementing already-planned features.
  • Within six months, you will contribute to the roadmap for our products and lead the design and specification of new features. You will have the trust of the team and our internal customers.
  • Within a year, you will have significantly improved the quality, performance and maintainability of our codebase, and will be taking the lead in designing new features to solve novel customer challenges

To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we‚Äôre committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees‚Äô wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it‚Äôs like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA¬†ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Steve, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data

¬†

HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?¬†

A broad diversity of career options, you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day

¬†

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst - Data Management & Analytics
Description:
We are actively looking for data analysts across multiple levels, willing to grow, to join our consultants' team and quickly growing global data practice. CAPCO is a 6000 people strong consulting firm fully dedicated to the financial services industry. We lead key data transformation projects and help our customers unlock the value of their data. We pride ourselves in delivering success for our clients and in growing our people.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis




What we offer you:




The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture




What we look for:




Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English




About Capco:




We are a management and global technology consultancy firm focused on financial services, with all major Belgium financial institutions as clients. Our professionals combine innovative thinking with unrivaled industry knowledge to offer clients consulting expertise and data transformation to move their organizations forward.




Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you‚Äôre encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It‚Äôs important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can and we believe that everyone brings something different to the table ‚Äì so we‚Äôd love to know what makes you different.




To learn more about Capco, visit us at https://www.capco.com/careers

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
For one of our client in the finance sector we are looking for a Medior to Senior Data Analyst/Business Analyst with SAS, SQL and Python experience.







The responsabilities :



Translating the business needs into an analytical request:



Hereby you will be discussing and challenging the needs and requirements with your stakeholders.
While thinking along you already think a step further in terms of a feasibility analysis, setting realistic timelines, and cross-checking the data needs and availabilities.
Based on this, you define a suitable approach and solution that fits the needs. These you communicate in a clear and transparent way to your stakeholders.

Go over to the execution phase, this by applying some advanced analytical skills, capabilities and techniques, some examples are:



Getting to know all the data available, the different tools to query, visualize and analyze this data
Create some advanced ad-hoc reporting for specific needs using dashboarding tools like Cognos
Executing an in-depth analysis on our customer data base to come up with answers to some specific questions or needs from the business





You will have :



- A good package !



- 50% of remote
