Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to work for us remotely

Job Requirements
3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 3 areas in the context of Artificial Intelligence (or Machine Learning or Data Science or Data Analytics) projects:
Data Analysis
Business Requirements Gathering
Project Management.
3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 2 areas:
Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (R-RStudio, Python-Anaconda or Knime);
Dashboarding and Data Analytics (Power BI or SAP Analytics Cloud)
Minimum 3-5 years of professional cumulative experience in the following 4 areas (with a minimum of 1 year professional experience per area):
Database development, Data Modelling and SQL (Oracle RDMBS or SQL Server);
ETL tools (BODI or BODS would be an asset);
Business Objects
Data Warehouse

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team;
Ability to participate in multilingual meetings;
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects;
Excellent Team Player
High degree of discretion and integrity is required


EU-Nationality is mandatory for ALL our job openings

WHO ARE WE?

CRI Group belongs to VASS GROUP as of November 2021 (https://vasscompany.com/en/).

VASS is a leading digital solutions group of companies headquartered in Madrid, Spain, present in 25 countries in Europe, the Americas and Asia with more than 4,300 professionals.

VASS helps large companies in their digital transformation process, developing and executing the most innovative and scalable projects, from strategy to operations.

All our growth comes from our talented people, passion for innovation, and a constant search for improvement, always the VASS way: "Complex made simple".

Title: Data Engineer/Data Analyst
Description:
Data Engineer / Data Analyst




For one of our customers, a multinational active in global materials technology and recycling, we are looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst for one of their business units.




Challenges

You will be responsible for the design, implementation and improvements of data models with the ultimate goal of enabling the end users to do self-service analytics in Power BI.

You have the right technical skills to assess the data needs of the business unit and give your expert advice on data extraction, transformation and loading.
You help identify data dependencies, perform data modeling, data mapping and validate reports/dashboard results.
You work closely with the internal teams to create the necessary dashboards in Power BI.
You keep an eye on data governance rules.

Required skills

Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, IT, Computer Sciences, Applied Economics or any related area
Knowledge of dimensional data models, data management and cloud computing
Experience with Power BI is required, experience with TimeXtender is an asset
Fluent in English and Dutch

Practical

Full-time, based in Brussels and with potential travel to another site
As of January / February 2023

Title: Data Analyst (Remote in EU)
Description:
‚ö° Who we are

Lodgify is a fast-growing startup focused on building vacation rental software that enables property owners and managers to independently manage and market their business online. We are an international team of more than 190 people and 43 different nationalities in the heart of Barcelona, and we've been featured twice in Wired's 100 Hottest European startups list.




‚≠ê About the role

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Data Team.

The Team's goal is to support the Business and enable the organisation to make informed decisions using a data-driven approach.




‚≠ê What will you do:

Get a deep knowledge of the business and look for opportunities to leverage data across the organisation.
Design and maintain insightful dashboards.
Create data models in line with business requirements.




‚≠ê What you must have:

4 years + experience as a data analyst, business intelligence engineer or analytics engineer.
Business acumen: ability to be proactive and challenge assumptions.
Hands-On experience on Tableau.
Good knowledge of SQL and Python.
Hands-On experience on a cloud data warehouse (Bigquery, Redshift or Snowflake).




Benefits

- Travel and Expenses budget to visit Barcelona.

- Referral program with paid compensation.

- Great culture & working environment with an international team of 50 different nationalities.

- Mental well-being.

- Regular team-building events and activities.

- Training and mentorship program.

- Yearly performance reviews.







‚≠ê Why you‚Äôll love us:

You‚Äôll be part of a growing, dynamic company with a truly international team. At Lodgify, we are full of contagious energy, hard work, and passion for what we do. Lodgify is committed to creating a workplace where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.




We are proud to have an international team that acknowledges a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. At Lodgify, we celebrate diversity and difference, and we are strongly committed to building an inclusive environment for all our employees.




All applications must be submitted in English. Applications in any other language will not be considered.

‚≠ê About the role

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Data Team.

The Team's goal is to support the Business and enable the organisation to make informed decisions using a data-driven approach.


‚≠ê What will you do:

  • Get a deep knowledge of the business and look for opportunities to leverage data across the organisation.
  • Design and maintain insightful dashboards.
  • Create data models in line with business requirements.


‚≠ê What you must have:

  • 4 years + experience as a data analyst, business intelligence engineer or analytics engineer.
  • Business acumen: ability to be proactive and challenge assumptions.
  • Hands-On experience on Tableau.
  • Good knowledge of SQL and Python.
  • Hands-On experience on a cloud data warehouse (Bigquery, Redshift or Snowflake).


Benefits

- Travel and Expenses budget to visit Barcelona.

- Referral program with paid compensation.

- Great culture & working environment with an international team of 50 different nationalities.

- Mental well-being.

- Regular team-building events and activities.

- Training and mentorship program.

- Yearly performance reviews.



‚≠ê Why you‚Äôll love us:

You‚Äôll be part of a growing, dynamic company with a truly international team. At Lodgify, we are full of contagious energy, hard work, and passion for what we do. Lodgify is committed to creating a workplace where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.


We are proud to have an international team that acknowledges a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. At Lodgify, we celebrate diversity and difference, and we are strongly committed to building an inclusive environment for all our employees.


All applications must be submitted in English. Applications in any other language will not be considered.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Functieomschrijving




Profiel:




Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of Data Visualisatie Consultant

‚Ä¢ Data-analyse, visualisatie en storytelling is waar je passie ligt.

‚Ä¢ SQL en datamodellering hebben geen geheimen voor jou.

‚Ä¢ Je hebt een goede kennis van Power BI. Kennis van andere BI-tools is een pluspunt (Tableau, Qlik‚Ä¶). Kennis van visualisatieontwerpprincipes is een pluspunt.

‚Ä¢ Je bent nauwkeurig, analytisch sterk en denkt altijd in oplossingen.

‚Ä¢ Je bent een vlotte communicator zowel intern als extern op IT- en businessniveau.




Wat heeft het bedrijf te bieden?




Deel uitmaken van een scale-up : je werkt binnen de volwassen context van een grote bedrijf, het grootste IT-netwerk van Belgi√´.

‚Ä¢ Een inspirerende omgeving: elke dag ondersteunen we je om nieuwe dingen te leren en je grenzen te verleggen.

‚Ä¢ Leuke collega's: je komt te werken in een team dat altijd bereid is om hun kennis te delen en plezier te maken tijdens teamevents, lunches en onze jaarlijkse skireis.

‚Ä¢ Een platte structuur: je werkt in een werkomgeving met een platte structuur en een open cultuur waarin iedereen benaderbaar is en elke stem telt.

‚Ä¢ Een aantrekkelijk salaris: aangevuld met extralegale voordelen zoals een firmawagen, laptop, gsm, maaltijdvergoeding en verzekering.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to work for us remotely

Job Requirements

3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 3 areas in the context of Artificial Intelligence (or Machine Learning or Data Science or Data Analytics) projects:
Data Analysis
Business Requirements Gathering
Project Management.
3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 2 areas:
Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (R-RStudio, Python-Anaconda or Knime);
Dashboarding and Data Analytics (Power BI or SAP Analytics Cloud)
Minimum 3-5 years of professional cumulative experience in the following 4 areas (with a minimum of 1 year professional experience per area):
Database development, Data Modelling and SQL (Oracle RDMBS or SQL Server);
ETL tools (BODI or BODS would be an asset);
Business Objects
Data Warehouse

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team;
Ability to participate in multilingual meetings;
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects;
Excellent Team Player
High degree of discretion and integrity is required

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Robert Half is currently looking for a data analyst.

As Data Analyst in the Life Transformation Program, you interpret data and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve the business, thus affecting business decisions. You will gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends - as such your job does highlight the analytical nature of your role. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, you will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business, IT and architecture colleagues.

Your Job Will Include, But Is Not Limited To

You will often make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our company obtains and analyses data to improve quality and the efficiency of data systems.

Collecting and interpreting data, as well in mainframe as in linux systems
Analyzing results of possible transformation
Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business, IT and architecture and explain it from different perspectives
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Working alongside teams within the business or the architecture team to establish business needs
Defining new data collection and analysis processes

Must have

Level Master informatica or equal by experience;
Knowledge and experience as data analyst or functional analyst;
Knowledge and experience in insurance, domain Life;
Knowledge of the MS Office suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, ‚Ä¶);
Experience in data models and reporting packages;
Ability to analyse large datasets
Ability to write comprehensive reports
Strong verbal and written communication skills
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Stress resistant, flexible and multitasking and able to adapt in a continue changing environment
Organizational skills
Team player & able to work independent

Nice to have

Experience with Scrum
Knowledge of PRINCE2
Experience with Enterprise Architect
Experience with Jira

Interested?

Please contact us.

Robert Half BV processes the data from applicants that is required to carry out the application process. You can find more information on data protection, in particular on your rights, at

Title: DATA ANALYST ‚Äì Tribe Payments ‚Äì Brussels
Description:
[ DATA ANALYST ‚Äì Tribe Payments ‚Äì Brussels ‚Äì GJA scale 15 ]

Your role & work environment

As a Data Analyst at ING you will play a crucial role in the data-driven culture by supporting our products and services in Tribe Payments. You will be responsible to support the decision making process by delivering valuable insights to both your colleagues and our clients.

For this position you will join as a Data Analyst the Tribe Payments Here you will be part of an Agile environment by being a member of a multidisciplinary team of 8 to 9 professionals.

The Payments Tribe is composed of 4 domain areas: Payments, Cards, Merchant Solutions and a digital domain.

Your Key Responsibilities

Translating the business needs into an analytical request:

Hereby you will be discussing and challenging the needs and requirements with your stakeholders.
While thinking along you already think a step further in terms of a feasibility analysis, setting realistic timelines, and cross-checking the data needs and availabilities.
Based on this, you define a suitable approach and solution that fits the needs. These you communicate in a clear and transparent way to your stakeholders.

Go over to the execution phase, this by applying some advanced analytical skills, capabilities and techniques, some examples are:

Getting to know all the data available, the different tools to query, visualize and analyse this data
Executing an in-depth analysis on our customer data base to come up with answers to some specific questions or needs from the business
Performing a customer behavior analysis or model
Building models; e.g. propensity to buy, cluster, risk
Defining the most relevant offers for our customers based on insights from our datamart
Define the needs to improves data availability and quality
Create some advances ad-hoc reporting for specific needs, using tools like Cognos and Adobe
Perform some recurrent analysis and reporting
Creating target groups for outbound customer communication; thinking about the right selection criteria, channels, offers, and A/B tests
Be part of a project or project team and help them delivering based upon the data

After the analytical quest you communicate your insights and recommendations in an appropriate way to the stakeholders:

This by applying the right visualization techniques.
Adapting your storyline and message to the needs and context of your stakeholders.
Communicating clear and on a convincing way your recommendations and next steps; while keeping aspects of GDPR, data sensitivity and confidentiality into account.
We look for

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.

As a Data Analyst you will also need to have following qualifications and competences:

Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or alike, and/or equivalent experience of 3 years
2 years relevant experience in data analytics
Experience in SQL is a must
Experience with tools such as SAS, Cognos or Adobe are a plus; an interest in these tools is a must
Be a team player
Be analytical: extremely curious, constantly looking for an explanation; analyzing sharply, concise & to the point
Take ownership on tasks assigned: you will be cultivating analytics within the bank
Be able to influence and convince not only peers but also the stakeholders based on analytical results
Good knowledge of English and FR/NL
We offer you

A clear purpose, a unique offer and a range of flexible compensation and other benefits:

Personal growth & challenging work with endless opportunities to realise your ambitions
An informal, dynamic environment with innovative colleagues supporting your endeavours
A progressive and agile way of working, where new ideas are valued ahead of convention

Furthermore, Within The Digital And Customer Interactions Tribe As a Data Analyst, You Can Count On a Range Of Opportunities To Invest In Your Personal And Professional Growth With

Ample opportunities to participate in courses and trainings within the analytical domain
Challenging, strategic and highly visible projects to support or take the lead in
Personal coaching through our agile structure by the help of Agile coaches and Chapter leads
An environment that stimulates continuous learning and improvement, and the possibility to experience over time multiple different aspects within data analytics

We redefine banking. What about you?

We‚Äôre on a journey that‚Äôs centred around our customers, powered by technology and driven by smart, determined people. Our customers feel our people are empowering them to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We‚Äôre proud of that!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij een data-analytisch genie met een passie voor het ontdekken van verborgen patronen en trends in grote hoeveelheden data? Dan is dit bedrijf op zoek naar jou! Als Data analist bij ons zal je verantwoordelijk zijn voor het analyseren en interpreteren van de data om ons te helpen bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.

Dit bedrijf is een toonaangevend mediabedrijf met een portfolio van gedrukte en digitale media, evenementen en diensten. Onze bedrijf heeft een rijke geschiedenis en een stevige reputatie in de media-industrie. Ze geloven in de kracht van data-analyse om onze business te versterken en zijn op zoek naar een enthousiaste Data analist om huns team te versterken.

Takenbeschrijving:

Het analyseren en interpreteren van grote hoeveelheden data
Het ontwikkelen van rapporten en dashboards
Het geven van advies aan het management over data-gedreven beslissingen
Het implementeren van data-analyse methoden en tools

profiel:

Een afgeronde opleiding in een relevante richting, zoals informatica, wiskunde of statistiek
Ervaring met data analyse en het werken met grote datasets
Sterke vaardigheden in Excel en SQL
Ervaring met data visualisatie tools zoals Tableau of Power BI
Proactieve en nauwkeurige werkhouding
Goede communicatievaardigheden

Aanbod:

Wij bieden een competitief salaris dat kan oplopen tot 70K, afhankelijk van ervaring en kwalificaties.
een uitdagende en afwisselende baan in een dynamische werkomgeving.
Daarnaast bieden ze een aantrekkelijk pakket aan extra voordelen, zoals flexibele werktijden, een goede work-life balance, en de mogelijkheid om deel te nemen aan opleidings- en ontwikkelingsprogramma's.

Waarom voor dit bedrijf kiezen?

Werk bij een toonaangevend en innovatief mediabedrijf
Maak deel uit van een team van gepassioneerde en enthousiaste professionals
Werk aan data-analyse projecten die direct impact hebben op de groei van het bedrijf
Mogelijkheid om invloed uit te oefenen op belangrijke beslissingen van het bedrijf
Mogelijkheid om jouw vaardigheden te ontwikkelen.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The role of the data analyst is to help identify data dependencies, perform data modeling, data mapping and validate reports/dashboard results. The Data Analyst will also be expected to define ETL workflow, define data quality rules, and be able to define measures and dimensions in a star schema.?




Your challenges




You'll discuss closely with key Business users to understand their Data/Information needs and transform this to a state-of-the-art BI Solution. You are the ultimate link between business and IT.




Write SQL queries to extract data from different sources
Define ETL workflow logic
Analyze and interpret data requirements and perform current/target/gap/impact analyses.
Collecting, querying and interpreting data to find patterns and trends.
Prepare documents such as technical requirements, data mapping, gap analysis, use case models and propose workflows, data flows, implementation plans and end user guides in accordance with standards and methodologies.
Define data quality rules
Identify data anomalies and communicate back to the data stewards
Validate ETL logic, reports, dashboard before end users' final checks




Your talents




You have strong project management and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail.




Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information system or related field
3 to 5 years of related experience
Strong SQL skills
Skills to look at existing databases, run SQL queries, and perform data mapping
Ability to deploy data models into a performant modern Data Warehouse (eg TimeXtender)
Confident to use different data tools (Excel, Access, SQL query tools, ...) to manipulate data and validate with business (Power BI, Qlik....)
Experience with data aggregation, data visualization, Business Intelligence and data analytics is a plus
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment with proven problem-solving skills
High energy and drive. Laser-focused on delivery with strategic-thinking, collaboration, facilitation, negotiation and motivational skills.
Fluent in English and French and/or Dutch

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST ‚Äì Tribe Know Your Customer ‚Äì Brussels




Technical data function




[Sint Michielswarande 60 1040 Etterbeek, Belgi√´]




[Possibility of 80 % work from home on the basis of a team agreement]




[16]




[Function Code]




[Full time]




[Sensitive Function: No.]




[PCP Function: No]




[Representation costs: No]




[Dep ID: 118456, Data Analytics and Reporting]




Your role & work environment




Money laundering, Tax evasion, Financial & Economic Crime (FEC) as a whole is affecting directly our economy & social welfare, by distorting prices, stimulating (cyber)crime, diverting resources to sterile sectors, weakening economic & social policies... Huge amounts of dirty money are still circling around us, and criminals are looking for any opportunity to recycle the profits of their crimes through the financial sector.




ING plays a key role in the fight against FEC. Because we are a top European bank, and we are expected to play a leading role. Because we want to fight efficiently the financial crime to support our purpose to empower honest people to stay a step ahead in life & business.




As a senior data analyst at KYC, you can make the difference for the bank ensure that ING remains a safe bank by providing analytical insights and building capabilities to enable access to relevant data & reporting required for decision making process.




Your Key Responsibilities




As a KYC data analyst, you will:




Provide in-depth analytical insights into customer profile & behavior
Help build and improve features to detect suspicious transactional patterns
Develop reporting & dashboards to support the decisioning process of KYC Experts & Senior Management
Help increase effectiveness and improve customer experience by supporting the digitalization of KYC process
Help ensure the bank remains compliant by providing a view on completeness and quality of our customer data
Build key KYC performance metrics to support the tribe operations and its regulatory reporting obligations




You Will Achieve These By




Translating the business needs into an analytical request:
Hereby you will be discussing and challenging the needs and requirements of your stakeholders.
In parallel, you take a step further in thinking in terms of the feasibility of the analysis, setting realistic timelines, and cross-checking the data needs and availabilities.
Based on this, you define a suitable approach and solution that fits the needs. These you communicate in a clear and transparent way to your stakeholders.
Go over to the execution phase, this by applying some advanced analytical skills, capabilities and techniques, some examples are:
Getting to know all the data available, the different tools to query, visualize and analyze this data
Executing an in-depth analysis on our customer data base to come up with answers to some specific questions or needs from the business
Create some advances ad-hoc reporting for specific needs, using tools like Cognos
After the analytical quest you communicate your insights and recommendations in an appropriate way to the stakeholders:
This by applying the right visualization techniques.
Adapting your storyline and message to the needs and context of your stakeholders.
Communicating clear and on a convincing way your recommendations and next steps; while keeping aspects of GDPR, data sensitivity and confidentiality into account.




We look for




A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.




As a Senior Data Analyst, you will also need to have following qualifications and competences:




Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or alike, and/or equivalent experience of 3 years
3 years relevant experience in data analytics
Experience in SQL is a must
Experience with Python and tools such as SAS, Cognos are a plus; an interest in these tools is a must
Experience in regulatory, KYC or fraud domains is a plus
Be a team player
Be analytical: extremely curious, constantly looking for an explanation; analyzing sharply, concise & to the point
Take ownership on tasks assigned: you will be cultivating analytics within the bank
Be able to influence and convince not only peers but also the stakeholders based on analytical results
Fluent in English




We offer you




A clear purpose, a unique offer and a range of flexible compensation and other benefits:




Personal growth & challenging work with endless opportunities to realize your ambitions
An informal, dynamic environment with innovative colleagues supporting your endeavors
A progressive and agile way of working, where new ideas are valued ahead of convention




Furthermore, Within The Digital And Customer Interactions Tribe As a Senior Data Analyst, You Can Count On a Range Of Opportunities To Invest In Your Personal And Professional Growth With




Ample opportunities to participate in courses and trainings within the analytical domain
Challenging, strategic and highly visible projects to support or take the lead in
Personal coaching through our agile structure by the help of Agile coaches and Chapter leads
An environment that stimulates continuous learning and improvement, and the possibility to experience over time multiple different aspects within data analytics




We redefine banking. What about you?




We‚Äôre on a journey that‚Äôs centered around our customers, powered by technology, and driven by smart, determined people. Our customers feel our people are empowering them to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We‚Äôre proud of that!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a passionate and driven Data Analyst to power our tech product development by sharing amazing data insights.

About Mindvalley

Mindvalley is the leading and most promising ed-tech company to date. We dominate the US market for Personal Growth Education. We are empowering athletes within every major US sports team and promoting successful learning strategies in major companies.

We're currently building the most advanced learning system - a version inspired by Ironman's ‚ÄúJ.A.R.V.I.S.‚Äù which utilizes AI and augmented reality to provide customized learning. Turning anyone into a superhero.

We innovate tools that induce enlightenment within every aspect of human life. We are seeking the best engineers to build the best and most advanced education platform our species has seen. The goal to mark our success is: powering up to 100 countries, powering every Fortune 500 company, and progressing humanity towards a better future.

About The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst at Mindvalley, you are responsible for the reporting standards as well as insights that MindValley uses. You, with the report directly to the Data Analytics team and will be based on ensuring reporting capabilities for the organisation as well as proactively assessing the business health and needs.

You must have hands-on experience with BI tools such as DataStudio, Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, or similar and have strong understanding with SQL and Google Cloud offerings. A proper understanding of reporting standards and a keen eye and stickler for data validation would go a long way.

Responsibilities

Possesses strong technical skills in analysing different forms of data set, recognise trends and patterns by using a variety of variables to model different scenarios and clearly present findings and impacts to drive decision making.
Excellent data storyteller who can influence and support other departments and stakeholders with the goal of building and validating a comprehensive data set and assumptions that will support decision making.
Supports other departments and stakeholders by challenging ideas, promoting constructive discussions and harmonising conflicting views to drive positive outcomes.
Design, create, monitor performance/ projects and report ongoing and ad hoc metrics in reports, presentations, and dashboards that are of value and interpret them to the stakeholders.
Deliver accurate and value-adding actionable insights.
Provide BI reporting on all the identified KPI areas specified in the Mindvalley KPI requirements document by creating, developing, updating and maintaining BI reports.
Provide ongoing support and implementation of change for the ETL solution.
Maintain analytics software in the back end, ensuring data is coming through correctly.
Apply data management practices and principles in ways of working.
Identify patterns, trends and insight through use of the appropriate tools.
Identify data quality issues through data profiling, analysis and stakeholder engagement.
Analyse the data to provide insights for internal and external stakeholders on improving the organisation‚Äôs performance.
Apply dimensional data modelling concepts and practices to develop conceptual, logical and physical data models to support insight delivery.
Works collaboratively with other teams to resolve data discrepancies and/or to clarify reporting procedures.


Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative or statistics field of Statistics, Computing or Computer Science.
At least 5 years of relevant working experience in a similar role in Data teams.
Deep understanding of how analytics data are instrumented, extracted, and used in reporting.
Track record of successful delivery of measurement solutions/ products/ models.
Must have experience in deploying and maintaining reporting data layers and ETL pipelines.
Able to suggest Robotic Process Automation/ enhancements to current workings.
Strong hands on experience with SQL and at least one scripting language (e.g. Python).
Strong data query skills for data manipulation through nested and join queries.
Logical thinking and ability to implement data normalisation.
Advance skills in data visualisation software - Data Studio, Tableau, Power BI or similar visualisation tools.
Demonstrated knowledge in ETL design, data manipulation, data warehousing and database solutions.
Experience of Business Intelligence reporting design, implementation and storytelling.
Understanding of data from Google, Facebook, Google Analytics, Firebase, Mixpanel.
Strong knowledge of Cloud product offerings from GCP, Azure, AWS, AlibabaCloud or similar.
Strategically-minded yet strong detail-orientation with a penchant for data accuracy.
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication and presentation skills at all levels of the organisation with varying technical backgrounds.
Strong analytical ability, critical thinker and a good sense of business acumen.
Exemplary relationship builder who is consultative in nature and from partnerships with coworkers and customers.


Your application must include:

Your resume in PDF format. Include links to work samples such as software, designs, or writing you have created so we can see proof of your talents.

Title: Clinical Insights Analyst
Description:
Clinical Insights Analyst




For my leading Biopharmaceutical client in Beerse (BE) I am looking for a Clinical Insights Analyst with experience as a Business/Data analyst. You will contribute to the development of visualization and support the clinical trial activities.




RESPONSIBILITES

Participate in the optimization of user management, content management, performance management and lifecycle management related to reporting and metrics
Support clinical activities such as medical safety review, analytical risk-based monitoring, data review and cleaning.
Work with business owners to develop and deliver reports and metrics such as, but not limited to Medical monitoring visualizations and ad hoc reporting as assigned.
Participate in executing strategy around reporting and metrics aligned with ICOA & EBIS strategy and business needs, optimizing the related systems infrastructure and by working with other EBIS teams, as well as GD IT, and external vendors.
Takes a leadership role with development and delivery of reports, templates and metrics and related activities

PROFILE

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Science or Computer Science
Minimum 4+ years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst or working within Data Warehouse platforms and BI tools within a clinical trial environment
Direct working experience with matrixed teams
Knowledge of Tibco Spotfire, Python, R, SAS, SDTM data structure and SQL
Experience in pharma & life sciences industry is preferred




PRACTICALITIES

Duration: till 31-12-2023 (high chance of extension)
Start: ASAP (flexible)
Hours p/w: Fulltime
Hybrid: 2/3 days on site
Location: Beerse




INTERESTED?

Get in touch ASAP by sending your CV to s.krakers@panda-int.com or call me on +31202044502!

You can also refer a friend and both earn a bonus on placement.

Title: Job | Data Analyst for Direct Channels | Bruxelles
Description:
Soci√©t√©: Belfius Banque

Postuler

√ätre membre actif de la communaut√© data dans son ensemble.

Ainsi, notre culture d‚Äôentreprise est avant tout bas√©e sur la confiance et l‚Äôautonomie, et nous avons mis en place un mode de travail hybride, appel√© ¬´ Home Based ¬ª, qui repose sur un sain √©quilibre entre t√©l√©travail et pr√©sentiel. Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Hays is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our client‚Äôs BI team.




Your responsibilities as a Business Intelligence Analyst

Play a vital role in driving data-driven decision making as a BI Analyst reporting to the BI Head. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of exciting projects including:

‚Ä¢ Integrating and preparing data for our DWH and CDCI's DataMart's

‚Ä¢ Developing, maintaining, and improving daily/weekly and monthly reports

‚Ä¢ Managing ad-hoc analyses to uncover key insights and trends

‚Ä¢ Continuously improving our MIS solutions to drive efficiency and effectiveness

‚Ä¢ Utilizing standard BI tools such as SAS, SQL, Microsoft Office, Python, R to develop operational solutions and processes.




What we are looking for

You have a Master's degree in a data-oriented field such as business, statistics, or informatics, and at least 2 years of professional experience. While experience in a similar position and in the banking sector is a plus, curiosity and intellectual flexibility is the most important.

In this role, you will utilize your expertise in standard BI tools such as SAS and knowledge of Python and R to lead data management and BI efforts.

You must have a strong communication skills, fluency in Dutch or French and English is a must.




What you will get in return

Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level and make a real impact on the efficiency of a leading bank's BI activity? Look no further! This unique position within the bank offers the chance to develop your skills and expertise from multiple angles. As part of an international group, your future team is regularly involved in global development projects at the data level, providing ample opportunity for national and international interactions without the need for extensive travel.




Join a young, dynamic, and innovative team in a working environment that values customer focus, integrity, and partnership. Enjoy a competitive salary package with added benefits such as meal and eco vouchers, pension scheme, hospitalization and life insurance, and a flexible homeworking policy. You'll be encouraged to share your opinions, suggestions, and concerns in a speak-up culture with a flat organizational structure and open communication with both management and other departments.




Take advantage of an extensive range of training opportunities through their learning platform, to develop your technical, soft and leadership skills. Don't miss this chance to be a part of a corporate culture that values its employees and their growth.




Your new company

Our client is one of the largest and most stable banks in Europe. The company has three main activities - Corporate Bank, Investment Bank, and Private Bank ‚Äì and offers endless opportunities for growth and advancement. In Belgium, they are a major player in the Wealth Management and Private Banking market.

Title: BI Engineer/Data analyst
Description:
Als BI Engineer/Data analyst ben je mee verantwoordelijk voor Business Excellence support wat inhoudt dat je instaat voor alle Business Intelligence rapportering, data management en visual management.




In deze rol maak je deel uit van een BI team in het departement Opex.




Verantwoordelijkheden




Je supporteert Business Excellence.
Je analyseert nieuwe business vragen en uitdagingen met werkt deze uit in data- en visual management oplossingen.
Je stelt nieuw databronnen samen die nodig zijn als antwoord op de business behoeften.
Je werkt constructief samen met diverse teams binnen de site Puurs: BI team, process automation en global Digital teams.




Functie profiel




Master Ind. Ingenieur, Computerwetenschappen, Biomedische Wetenschappen, handelsingenieur, ..
Ervaring met tools als Tableau, Business Objects, Python, SQL, Airflow
Ervaring met voorstelling van matig tot complexe queries in eenvoudig en duidelijk interpreteerbare visuele voorstelling
Sterke interesse in applicaties en processen
Je bent klantgericht, communicatief sterk, resultaatgericht
Ervaring in pharma industrie is aangewezen
Je kan je goed uitdrukken in Nederlands en Engels




Aanbod




Contract van onbepaalde duur met tal van extralegale voordelen.
Een cultuur van ondernemerschap en innovatie.
Grootste productie-en verpakkingssite van Europa binnen het Pfizer netwerk.
Hoog investeringsritme.
Hoogtechnologische omgeving.
Breed werkdomein en sterke gelegenheid tot netwerking en netwerk uitbreiding.
Flexibel werk (mogelijkheid tot telewerk afgewisseld met on site werk)




De Pfizer site in Puurs is √©√©n van de grootste productie- en verpakkingssites van Pfizer wereldwijd, gespecialiseerd in aseptische productie en verpakking. Jaarlijks worden in Puurs meer dan 400 miljoen doses injecteerbare vaccins en medicijnen geproduceerd. Deze zijn ter plaatse verpakt in ampullen, flacons, plastic flessen, spuiten en patronen voor pennen.




De medicijnen die in Puurs worden gemaakt, zijn bestemd voor pati√´nten in meer dan 170 landen wereldwijd. 30% van de productie uit Puurs is bestemd voor ontwikkelingslanden, in samenwerking met UNICEF, WHO, GAVI en ngo's.




Met het gebruik van twee windturbines, zonnepanelen en een warmtekrachtcentrale richten we ons op hernieuwbare energie.

Title: Data Integration Analyst
Description:
ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations. With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life. Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.




The Main Responsibilities Of The Role Include




Developing and implementing data flows
Delivering the acquisition, cleansing, and transformation of data
Identifying opportunities through the production of analysis, comparisons and benchmarks
Engaging with subject matter experts within the organisation to understand data quality and lineage
Understanding and working with colleagues to ensure continued compliance with information governance framework and statute
Undertaking complex analysis of information to ensure consistent and accurate reporting to meet the needs of stakeholders.
Providing regular data and information updates
Routinely undertaking data-quality checks to a high-level of data accuracy
Leveraging business intelligence tools i.e. Spotfire for analysis and review.
Ensuring systems code and documentation are inspection ready




This position can be based in either our Livingston office or can be fully remote/home-based in the UK.




About You




A solutions orientated, analytical and customer focused individual with a global business mind set and a strong background in operational excellence!




To Enable Success In This Position You Will Have




Here at ICON we want our employees to succeed and ensure that they are set up for this success through constant training, development and support.




We‚Äôre looking for someone with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Maths, Science or Computer Science
Experience using computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Previous SQL experience is essential
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Experience of clinical data and domains (Experience working within Clinical Trials or the wider Pharmaceutical industry) preferable but not necessary
Data Warehouse experience with exposure to Big Data
Experience of Data Analysis, Data Quality and Data Lineage
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.




Benefits Of Working In ICON




Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That‚Äôs why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture - one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development.




At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future.




ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.




If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues¬†üòÄ




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As¬†Laura, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team

¬†

HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have¬†a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting‚Ä¶ could be a real asset

¬†

WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING¬†A DIVERSITY PLAN¬†AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.


CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

  • 1/3 of Personal development
  • 1/3 of Collective Intelligence
  • 1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ


WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Laura, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).


YOUR TASKS :

  • Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
  • Define the business specifications for BI needs
  • Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
  • Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
  • Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
  • Collaborate with the development team

 

HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

  • You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
  • You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
  • You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
  • You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
  • You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
  • You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
  • You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
  • You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

Bonus

  • An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting‚Ä¶ could be a real asset

 

WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

  • A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
  • You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
  • You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
  • You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
  • We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
  • We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!


"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data-analist kredieten
Description:
Wat houdt deze vacature in?




Elektriciteit heeft de wereld grondig veranderd. Ook data is dit nu aan het doen. Data wordt door alle grote spelers gebruikt om te begrijpen wat er gebeurt en te voorspellen wat er gaat gebeuren (kijk maar naar Amazon, Google, Facebook, etc). KBC is geen uitzondering.




Het team dat jij als data-analist ondernemingskredieten versterkt, verwerkt data over kredieten aan zelfstandigen, KMO‚Äôs en large corporates.




We ondersteunen andere diensten binnen ons domein in hun zoektocht naar de juiste data en leveren die op een gestructureerde manier op via diverse toepassingen. Zo kunnen onze opdrachtgevers hun backend processen verder automatiseren, maar ook belangrijke inzichten verwerven om hun beleid of dagelijkse werking bij te sturen.




Het eindresultaat? Vlotte, gezonde kredietverlening aan ondernemers en ondernemingen, die de motor zijn van onze economie.




Zin om deze uitdagingen te tacklen?




Hoe kunnen we de massa aan data die we hebben, gebruiken om onze kredietverlening verder te sturen?
De wereldproblematiek rond natuur, milieu en klimaatverandering daagt iedereen uit. KBC is vastbesloten om een zeer belangrijke rol te spelen in de evolutie naar een duurzame wereld. Data over duurzaamheid zal een belangrijke schakel worden in de wereld van ondernemingskredieten
Complexiteit van kredieten aan zelfstandigen, KMO‚Äôs en large corporates zorgen voor een complexe data-wereld.




Wat verwachten we van jou?




Je analyseert complexe opdrachten of processen van verschillende business partijen.
Je vertaalt je analyse naar de juiste interne & externe data en programmeert dit ook in de daarvoor bestemde tools.
Je bouwt mee aan toepassingen die zullen worden gebruikt voor het capteren van nieuwe datapunten (o.a. over duurzaamheid) of voor het automatiseren van backend processen.




Jouw troeven?




Je hebt een masterdiploma in economie, wetenschappen, engineering of IT.
Data-analyse of werken met data is niet nieuw voor jou. Ervaring met SAS, Python, SQL of Qlik sense is een pluspunt.
Kennis van kredietverlening is geen must, maar het is wel belangrijk dat je interesse hebt in hoe bedrijfsfinanciering werkt.
Samen met je collega‚Äôs voor een doel gaan, dat motiveert je.
Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en het Engels. In beide talen breng je complexe materie helder over.




Wat hebben we je te bieden?




Boven op on-the-job learning investeren we in jou met een uitzonderlijk aanbod opleidings- en ontwikkelingskansen. Je wordt aangemoedig om te blijven groeien als persoon en professioneel.
Je krijgt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief loon. Je kan ook kiezen uit een waaier aan extralegale voordelen.
Onze hoofdkantoren zijn vlot bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer. Ook los van de coronamaatregelen kan je (deels) thuiswerken, als je dat wil.
Dankzij flexibele werkuren kan je je werk en je priv√©leven op elkaar afstemmen.

Title: Junior Insights Researcher
Description:
Job Title - Junior Insights Researcher
Reports Into - Insights Manager
Location - Remote / Anywhere




A Little Bit about Kwalee‚Ä¶.

Kwalee is one of the world‚Äôs leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let‚Äôs Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe.




What‚Äôs In It For You?

We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that‚Äôs why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment
Creative Wednesdays! (Pitch and make your own games every Wednesday)
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Monthly employee awards




Are You Up To The Challenge?

As a Junior Insights Researcher you‚Äôll be planning and carrying out player research to help guide our games.




Your Team Mates

Our team of publishers, producers and researchers source and onboard external mobile game developers who wish to make chart-topping success. We support these developers in their journey with our publishing knowledge and metrics to ensure we get the kind of games millions love.




What Does The Job Actually Involve?

Plan and conduct market and user research activities for stakeholders across the company.
Manage relationships with key products stakeholders, creating a research roadmap to run along-side product development
Plan and suggest research to support product development, all the way through the product lifecycle, from idea to hard-launch and beyond
Identify research opportunities that will impact player understanding, product design and quality
Use a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies to answer the questions proposed by stakeholders
Collaborate with cross functional teams such as Digital Marketing to support broader analytics and insights work that drive business impact.




Your Hard Skills

Academic background in psychology, social studies or other human behavioural sciences
Experience of, or a demonstrably strong interest in the interactive entertainment industry (e.g., video/mobile gaming, video/entertainment platforms)
Excellent knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods
Excellent survey writing skills
Experience in data manipulation and statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R/Python or any other)
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Degree in psychology, HCI, social sciences, or related field
Effective written, storytelling, verbal and presentation skills;
Fluent in English
A passion for gaming




Your Soft Skills

Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but we‚Äôre very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues.




We don‚Äôt like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together. If that sounds like you, then please apply.




A Little More About Kwalee

Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts.




Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee‚Äôs success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we‚Äôre proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle.




We have an amazing team of experts collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Lisbon, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, Cyprus, the Philippines and many more places around the world. We‚Äôve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales, which is based in France.




We have a truly global team making games for a global audience, and it‚Äôs paying off: - Kwalee has been voted the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership Team at the TIGA Awards (Independent Game Developers‚Äô Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth - including Antarctica!

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Who are we ?




The Positive Thinking Company is a global tech partner that delivers end-to-end tech solutions. We are positive thinkers who believe that collaboration betters our world! ¬∑ https://positivethinking.tech/




Who are you ?




As a Positive Thinker you...

¬∑ Speak Dutch or French and have a good knowledge of English.

¬∑ Have at least 3 years of experience as a BI developer/analyst.

¬∑ Will be an outstanding candidate if you share our values: Positive thinking, Collaboration, Evolution, Commitment.

¬∑ Hold a degree in Computer science or Economics, but above all we are looking for a passionate person who can present a project that he/she is proud of üòâ




What will you do ?




As a BI specialist, you oversee different phases on the whole BI chain.

You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of clients and sectors and on a daily basis you will:

¬∑ Collect requirements from the business

¬∑ Identify and collect the data from different data sources

¬∑ Develop, design and implement ETL solutions and data storage systems, through your knowledge of ETL tools (Informatica, Data integrator, Talend, SSIS ‚Ä¶)

¬∑ Model Data (datawarehouse, data vault, data marts), CDC, Data Lake

¬∑ Integrate data in the data warehouse and create data marts

¬∑ Ensure the data quality and analyse data

¬∑ Present reports and create insightful information and help managers make better data-driven decisions, through your knowledge of reporting tools (Tableau, SAP BI, Power BI, Qlik‚Ä¶)

¬∑ Provide expertise advice for the continuous improvement of the data capabilities




The technical environments available with our customers are: SQL, Oracle (Data integrator, OBIEE...), Informatica, Microsoft (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), Azure SQL, Amazon Redshift, PosgreSQL, Talend, Alteryx, IBM (Datastage, Cognos), Kimball, DataVault, SAP (SAP BI, Data integrator) ‚Ä¶




On top of that, you could be involved in our solution centres where we develop tailored solutions for our clients. For some concrete examples of projects, check our uses cases: https://positivethinking.tech/use-cases/?exp%5B%5D=expertise-data-analytics)




What are we offering you ?




- EVOLUTION

o Personal follow-up during your career at PTC

o Catalogue with a wide variety of trainings for hard- and soft skills, private language classes, unlimited access to an E-learning platform (Udemy, Pluralsight,‚Ä¶) and possibility to get certified every year

- COLLABORATION

o Opportunity to join the BI community and participate in knowledge sharing sessions, events, workshops, etc.

o Join one of the passion communities and practice your hobby or share your interests with other positive thinkers

o International collaboration, possibility to work worldwide

- ON TOP OF THAT:

o Competitive salary with a flexible mobility package (variety of choice, including: Electrical cars, electrical bikes, payment of rent/mortgage...)

o Copyrights

o You will become part of a growing team of people keen on applying the latest technologies and knowledge. You will be able to work in a dynamic, innovating environment with the proper touch of geekiness and yearning for board games.

Title: Job | Data Analyst ‚Äì Risk & ICM Data Delivery | Bruxelles
Description:
Soci√©t√©: Belfius Banque

Postuler

Que faites-vous pr√©cis√©ment ?

Chez Belfius, nous croyons que les data sont √† la base de notre transformation digitale. Qu‚Äôil s‚Äôagisse du marketing digital, de la fourniture de produits et services sur mesure, de la prise de d√©cisions tactiques et strat√©giques, de l'am√©lioration des processus ou du suivi de notre performance, les data jouent √† cet √©gard un r√¥le crucial.

Chaque jours, des millions d‚Äô√©v√©nements se passent dans les syst√®mes Belfius, chacun de ces √©v√©nements g√©n√©rant des data. Dans l‚Äô√©quipe Risk/ICM Data Delivery, nous sommes responsable de comprendre ces donn√©es, les traduire dans des insights et d√©velopper des outils qui soutiennent les d√©cisions et la strat√©gie des m√©tiers.

Donc, le data management, les innovations et la r√©solution de probl√®mes complexes vous passionnent ? Vous √™tes int√©ress√©(e) de comprendre comment on traduit ces datas en diff√©rents indicateurs de profitabilit√© et de suivi des risques ? Si c‚Äôest le cas, vous √™tes le candidat id√©al pour rejoindre notre √©quipe Risk/ICM Data Delivery !

Que contient le job?

Nous sommes √† la recherche de quelqu‚Äôun qui peut nous soutenir dans nos activit√©s de reporting et contr√¥les de qualit√©. Dans cette fonction, vous aurez deux domaines d‚Äôexpertise :

Les produits qui g√©n√®rent des commissions (comptes, fonds, placements,‚Ä¶) ;
Les couts, et cela pour toutes les activit√©s de la banque.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
As a Business Intelligence expert, you will be responsible for working with our clients to understand their data and analytics needs, and then designing and delivering solutions that help them make better business decisions. You will be working with a team of experienced data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to deliver projects on time and within budget.

Key Responsibilities:

Understanding the clients' data and analytics needs and design solutions to meet those needs.
Design and develop data models, data warehousing, and data governance solutions.
Design and develop data visualization solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and SAP Business Objects.
Work with a team of data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to deliver projects.
Communicate project status, risks, and issues to senior management and key stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, or engineering.
Min 3+ years of experience in a business intelligence and data analytics-related field.
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, data governance, and data visualization.
Experience with SQL and programming languages such as Python and R
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into business terms.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and SAP Business Objects is a plus.
Strong understanding of data security and compliance requirements is a plus.




If you are passionate about Business Intelligence and data analytics and are looking for an exciting opportunity to work on some innovative projects, then we would love to hear from you. Please apply with your resume and a cover letter that highlights your relevant experience and qualifications.

Thank you for your interest in our consultancy. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Research Analyst (data quality control/management)
Description:
Deadline for applications:¬†Friday 3rd March 2023, 00:00 CET

Expected starting date:¬†September 2023




Type of contract:¬†full-time one-year contract (renewable based on performance)

Bruegel¬†welcomes¬†applications¬†for a¬†Research¬†Analyst (data quality control/management)¬†position.




In addition to the usual tasks performed by a Bruegel RA, the successful candidate would play a specific ‚Äì coordinating ‚Äì role within the RA team helping Bruegel manage efficiently its databases and ensure data quality before publications.




Applicants not interested in applying for this specific role should apply to the¬†general call¬†for Research Assistants and Interns published simultaneously to this one.




Bruegel is a European think tank working in the field of international economics. Established in 2005, Bruegel is independent and non-doctrinal. Its mission is to improve the quality of economic policy with open and fact-based research, analysis and debate. We are committed to impartiality, openness and excellence. Bruegel‚Äôs membership includes EU Member State governments, international corporations and institutions. For more information about Bruegel, please consult:¬†www.bruegel.org




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES¬†

The Research Analyst will be assisting¬†Bruegel¬†fellows¬†in their research and in drafting Bruegel publications ‚Äì like other Bruegel RAs¬†‚Äì but will, in addition, devote a significant share of their time (around 50%, depending on needs) performing specific duties¬†to optimise and ensure the quality of the other RAs‚Äô work:

Build guidelines for RAs to homogenise how data is used in Bruegel‚Äôs projects: how to structure excel files, Stata, R and Python codes to make them comprehensible and replicable by third parties
Perform quality control to ensure rigorous standards of data replicability (i.e. flawless and well sourced data) before each Bruegel publication i.e. policy papers and blog posts
Manage data: centralisation of data repeatedly used in Bruegel‚Äôs projects after publication of papers to avoid duplication of work by RAs in future similar projects
Support other RAs in some specific tasks: coding in R/Python, data visualisation (also coordinating with Bruegel‚Äôs communication team), etc.




GENERAL REQUIREMENTS




Skills




All¬†applicants¬†must¬†hold¬†a¬†Master‚Äôs¬†degree¬†or¬†equivalent¬†in¬†Economics¬†or¬†related¬†fields,¬†should possess a¬†solid understanding of economics¬†and¬†demonstrate technical strength¬†in¬†quantitative¬†economic¬†methods/econometrics.




Strong¬†proficiency in¬†all¬†the main data software used by Bruegel (Python, R, Stata and Excel) is required. Data scraping and data visualisation skills (using e.g. plotly and dash packages in Python, or java script) will be highly valued for this specific position.




Applicants¬†must also¬†be¬†fluent in English, both written and spoken.




Applicants are expected to be able to confidently, autonomously and professionally communicate with Bruegel colleagues and possibly with relevant stakeholders. Versatility,¬†attention to detail,¬†and the¬†ability¬†to work¬†as a¬†team-player¬†with short deadlines¬†are¬†desired.




Interests




Applicants must have¬†an¬†interest in¬†applied,¬†policy-oriented¬†research¬†in¬†Bruegel‚Äôs¬†areas¬†of¬†specialisation, including the functioning of EU policies.¬†Bruegel research areas include: innovation and competition policy, digital economy, climate and energy policy,¬†macroeconomic policy, trade policy, banking, capital markets and financial regulation.




In addition, for this specific RA position, applicants must also have a very strong interest in coding, data management, and data visualisation.




Experience




Besides¬†a¬†Master‚Äôs¬†degree ‚Äì¬†or¬†equivalent ‚Äì¬†in¬†Economics,¬†candidates¬†for this specific Research Assistant position¬†should¬†possess at least one year of professional¬†experience in¬†economic empirical¬†work as well as in managing or coordinating data projects.




APPLICATION PROCEDURE




To apply, please submit¬†your¬†application to¬†recruitment@bruegel.org¬†with the subject line:¬†‚ÄúResearch




Assistant¬†Data Application 2023‚Äù,¬†by 3 March 2023, 00:00 CET.




The¬†email must contain:¬†CV,¬†Cover Letter,¬†Writing¬†Sample¬†(such¬†as¬†Master‚Äôs¬†thesis),¬†University Transcripts.




Applications with missing documents and/or that do not meet the above-mentioned requirements will NOT be considered.




Because of¬†the high number of applications we usually receive we are¬†unfortunately unable to reply to all applicants. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted within a few weeks.




Bruegel is committed to ensuring equal opportunities and treatment for all by providing that no job applicant receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of race, colour, nationality, religion, ethnic or national origins, gender, marital status, caring responsibilities, sexual orientation, disability or chronic illness.




For¬†further¬†guidance,¬†see¬†Bruegel‚Äôs Careers¬†page:¬†http://www.bruegel.org/careers/

Show more Show less
HTML:
Deadline for applications: Friday 3rd March 2023, 00:00 CET

Expected starting date: September 2023


Type of contract: full-time one-year contract (renewable based on performance)

Bruegel welcomes applications for a Research Analyst (data quality control/management) position.


In addition to the usual tasks performed by a Bruegel RA, the successful candidate would play a specific ‚Äì coordinating ‚Äì role within the RA team helping Bruegel manage efficiently its databases and ensure data quality before publications.


Applicants not interested in applying for this specific role should apply to the general call for Research Assistants and Interns published simultaneously to this one.


Bruegel is a European think tank working in the field of international economics. Established in 2005, Bruegel is independent and non-doctrinal. Its mission is to improve the quality of economic policy with open and fact-based research, analysis and debate. We are committed to impartiality, openness and excellence. Bruegel‚Äôs membership includes EU Member State governments, international corporations and institutions. For more information about Bruegel, please consult: www.bruegel.org


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

The Research Analyst will be assisting Bruegel fellows in their research and in drafting Bruegel publications ‚Äì like other Bruegel RAs ‚Äì but will, in addition, devote a significant share of their time (around 50%, depending on needs) performing specific duties to optimise and ensure the quality of the other RAs‚Äô work:

  • Build guidelines for RAs to homogenise how data is used in Bruegel‚Äôs projects: how to structure excel files, Stata, R and Python codes to make them comprehensible and replicable by third parties
  • Perform quality control to ensure rigorous standards of data replicability (i.e. flawless and well sourced data) before each Bruegel publication i.e. policy papers and blog posts
  • Manage data: centralisation of data repeatedly used in Bruegel‚Äôs projects after publication of papers to avoid duplication of work by RAs in future similar projects
  • Support other RAs in some specific tasks: coding in R/Python, data visualisation (also coordinating with Bruegel‚Äôs communication team), etc.


GENERAL REQUIREMENTS


Skills


All applicants must hold a Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Economics or related fields, should possess a solid understanding of economics and demonstrate technical strength in quantitative economic methods/econometrics.


Strong proficiency in all the main data software used by Bruegel (Python, R, Stata and Excel) is required. Data scraping and data visualisation skills (using e.g. plotly and dash packages in Python, or java script) will be highly valued for this specific position.


Applicants must also be fluent in English, both written and spoken.


Applicants are expected to be able to confidently, autonomously and professionally communicate with Bruegel colleagues and possibly with relevant stakeholders. Versatility, attention to detail, and the ability to work as a team-player with short deadlines are desired.


Interests


Applicants must have an interest in applied, policy-oriented research in Bruegel‚Äôs areas of specialisation, including the functioning of EU policies. Bruegel research areas include: innovation and competition policy, digital economy, climate and energy policy, macroeconomic policy, trade policy, banking, capital markets and financial regulation.


In addition, for this specific RA position, applicants must also have a very strong interest in coding, data management, and data visualisation.


Experience


Besides a Master‚Äôs degree ‚Äì or equivalent ‚Äì in Economics, candidates for this specific Research Assistant position should possess at least one year of professional experience in economic empirical work as well as in managing or coordinating data projects.


APPLICATION PROCEDURE


To apply, please submit your application to recruitment@bruegel.org with the subject line: ‚ÄúResearch


Assistant Data Application 2023‚Äù, by 3 March 2023, 00:00 CET.


The email must contain: CV, Cover Letter, Writing Sample (such as Master‚Äôs thesis), University Transcripts.


Applications with missing documents and/or that do not meet the above-mentioned requirements will NOT be considered.


Because of the high number of applications we usually receive we are unfortunately unable to reply to all applicants. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted within a few weeks.


Bruegel is committed to ensuring equal opportunities and treatment for all by providing that no job applicant receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of race, colour, nationality, religion, ethnic or national origins, gender, marital status, caring responsibilities, sexual orientation, disability or chronic illness.


For further guidance, see Bruegel‚Äôs Careers page: http://www.bruegel.org/careers/

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
As an SQL Developer, you will develop MS-SQL queries and procedures, create custom reports, and modify ERP user forms to enhance organizational productivity. You will also be responsible for designing databases and ensuring their stability, reliability, and performance.




Responsibilities

¬∑ Develop high-quality database solutions.

¬∑ Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions.

¬∑ Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements.

¬∑ Research required data.

¬∑ Build appropriate and useful reporting deliverables.

¬∑ Analyze existing SQL queries for performance improvements.

¬∑ Suggest new queries.

¬∑ Develop procedures and scripts for data migration.

¬∑ Provide timely scheduled management reporting.

¬∑ Investigate exceptions with regard to asset movements.




We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: BI Expert
Description:
De VRT is op zoek naar een Business Intelligence expert om het Finance team bij VRT te versterken.




Je bent vertrouwd met een data-omgeving en met het werken met en ondervragen van data. Je bent gedreven door data analyse en data visualisatie. Je kan als geen ander data verzamelen, ondervragen en op een duidelijke en eenvoudige manier in een dashboard weergeven.




Als openbare omroep reageren we op de constante veranderingen en groei binnen het medialandschap. Duidelijke data inzichten maken het mogelijk het beleid en de beslissingen vanuit de afdeling Finance te ondersteunen.




Als BI expert maak je deel uit van het data team binnen Finance. Je werkt nauw samen met de data analisten en business partners in het team, alsook met andere afdelingen die nood hebben aan zakelijke data inzichten en ondersteuning in data visualisatie.




Wat ga je bij ons doen?




In jouw rol als BI expert ondersteun je VRT in haar data gedreven werking. Je zorgt ervoor dat data vertaald wordt naar inzichten en dat deze inzichten makkelijk te vinden zijn voor iedereen binnen de organisatie. Je hebt hierbij niet alleen impact op onze technische processen en systemen, maar je speelt ook een rol bij het begeleiden van besluitvorming. Je gebruikt hiervoor geavanceerde query's en past data visualisatie technieken toe in een Big Data context.




Wie zoeken we?
Je hebt minstens een 2-tal jaar ervaring als BI Expert
Je hebt een uitmuntende kennis van SQL, je hebt ervaring met het development framework dbt, Python en je kan werken met Business Intelligence tools (liefst PowerBI,).
Je hebt kennis van ‚Äì en hands-on ervaring met data modeleren
Je kan kwaliteitsproblemen identificeren en terugkoppelen naar respectieve owners
Je hebt ervaring met het vertalen en implementeren van business requirements naar IT oplossingen op vlak van BI en je kan dan ook BI-oplossingen integreren in het IT-landschap
Ontwikkelen van rapporten, dashboards, en andere data-oplossingen zijn geen onbekende voor jou
Je deelt je kennis en coacht graag anderen om zelf query's te maken
Je bent sterk in het capteren van noden en kunt deze vertalen naar concrete acties
Je hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen en aandacht voor detail
Je hebt zin voor initiatief en bent bijzonder ondernemend. Je bent dan ook een teamplayer met goede communicatievaardigheden die daarnaast klant- en resultaatgericht is.
Extra pluspunten:
Kennis van Excel Power Pivot
Kennis van Power Apps
Ervaring in een financi√´le omgeving
BI ervaring binnen een beleidsondersteunende afdeling (finance, HR, ‚Ä¶)




Werken in een bruisende omgeving




Je krijgt een contract van onbepaalde duur.
Je komt terecht in een gedreven en gemotiveerd team die net zoals jij gebeten zijn door data, analytics, AI en personalisatie. Je krijgt een avontuur voorgeschoteld waarin geen week op elkaar lijkt en waarbij je goesting om een stap verder te gaan dagelijks geprikkeld wordt. Je bouwt mee aan de media van morgen en krijgt de kans om jezelf hogerop te tillen dankzij boeiende opleidingen.
We bieden je een afwisselende job, in een innovatieve context waarbij je de kans krijgt om mee te bouwen aan een VRT die zich richt op de toekomst en waarbij er veel aandacht is voor persoonlijke groei. Je krijgt hierbij ook interne begeleiding en coaching. We voorzien een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. een goede hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, kinderopvang tijdens schoolvakanties, een kinderkribbe en een bedrijfsrestaurant. Er is aandacht voor een goede werk-priv√© balans en ook thuiswerk behoort tot de mogelijkheden.




Is jouw interesse geprikkeld?




Wil jij een cruciale rol spelen in dit verhaal en herken je jezelf in bovenstaand profiel? Solliciteer intern via Auguste -> Mijn loopbaan of extern via en dit tot en met 15/02/2023 met je cv √©n motivatie




Voor de VRT zijn gelijke kansen belangrijk. Kwaliteiten van mensen zijn bij de VRT doorslaggevend ongeacht geslacht, afkomst, leeftijd of handicap.
