Title: HR Data & Insight Analyst (Associate Level)
Description:
ERM is seeking an HR Data & Insights Analyst to join our regional HR team that supports the EMEA business. The role will provide data and analytical insights to the Regional HR Director, the regional HR team and the wider regional leadership team. The role will be based in one of our EMEA office locations, on a flexible basis.




As a global sustainability consulting company, ERM has clear growth direction and has been investing heavily in building future skills in the areas such as low carbon economy transition, strategic environmental, social and governance (ESG) and product stewardship amongst other service offerings. The EMEA HR team plays a key role in enabling our business, and the HR Data & Insights Analyst will join us on our transformation journey to help design and implement the HR data analytics roadmap and to shape HR decisions across EMEA




The ideal candidate will have prior experience working with HR, finance and sales data, understand the challenges of pulling together data from different sources, be proactive in recommending areas that need focus and have the ability to visualise data insights in a clear and engaging way.




Role Responsibilities




Integrate finance, sales and HR data to create integrated insights which drive commercial decisions
Design and implement the HR data analytics roadmap
Take responsibility for a quarterly ‚ÄòHR Health Metrics‚Äô data pack for EMEA leadership team which shows how we doing against hiring, retention, high talent turnover, pay differentiation by skill sets etc
Support the EMEA HR Senior Leadership team by providing data & analysis at key points in the year such as compensation cycle, talent review, balanced scorecard setting etc
Respond to ad-hoc data requests & help develop a data self-service approach for the EMEA HR teams
Ensures existing Workday dashboards are fit for purpose & proactively identifies future needs




Skills & Experience




Intermediate/Expert in Excel functions
Expert in PowerBI or similar platform
Experience creating & running reports in Workday or other HRIS
Experience working with multiple data sources
Experience of standard operational challenges such as data accuracy, user adoption and adherence to processes
Knowledge of GDPR & data management
Understanding of HR Transformation & change management




Person Characteristics




Confident ‚Äì able to challenge the status quo and recommend where things need to be changed; open to being challenged themselves
Problem solving ‚Äì the ability to think something through and discuss possible solutions rather than just focusing on the problem
Adaptable, resilient and able to deal with ambiguity
Strong attention to detail
Well-organised and responsive with the ability to prioritise multiple requests
Approachable, inquisitive and looking to develop their career




To Apply




At ERM, we put our people first. We ensure that we create and maintain a supportive and positive workplace culture. We also offer a competitive remuneration package and flexible working to suit your life.




With a robust career framework in place, there are also great opportunities to advance your career at ERM.




We also offer our employees a diverse and inclusive culture in which differences are embraced and celebrated ‚Äì through, for example dedicated Employee Resource Groups. Please feel free to contact us if you wish to find out more about our diversity and inclusion culture, or if you would need special arrangements for your interview should your application progress to that stage.




Show more Show less

  • Intermediate/Expert in Excel functions
  • Expert in PowerBI or similar platform
  • Experience creating & running reports in Workday or other HRIS
  • Experience working with multiple data sources
  • Experience of standard operational challenges such as data accuracy, user adoption and adherence to processes
  • Knowledge of GDPR & data management
  • Understanding of HR Transformation & change management


Person Characteristics


  • Confident ‚Äì able to challenge the status quo and recommend where things need to be changed; open to being challenged themselves
  • Problem solving ‚Äì the ability to think something through and discuss possible solutions rather than just focusing on the problem
  • Adaptable, resilient and able to deal with ambiguity
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Well-organised and responsive with the ability to prioritise multiple requests
  • Approachable, inquisitive and looking to develop their career


To Apply


At ERM, we put our people first. We ensure that we create and maintain a supportive and positive workplace culture. We also offer a competitive remuneration package and flexible working to suit your life.


With a robust career framework in place, there are also great opportunities to advance your career at ERM.


We also offer our employees a diverse and inclusive culture in which differences are embraced and celebrated ‚Äì through, for example dedicated Employee Resource Groups. Please feel free to contact us if you wish to find out more about our diversity and inclusion culture, or if you would need special arrangements for your interview should your application progress to that stage.

Title: Business Intelligence Expert
Description:
We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to work for us remotely

Job Requirements
6-10 years of professional experience in each of the following 3 areas in the context of Artificial Intelligence (or Machine Learning or Data Science or Data Analytics) projects:
Data Analysis
Business Requirements Gathering
Project Management.
6-10 years of professional experience in each of the following 2 areas:
Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (R-RStudio, Python-Anaconda or Knime);
Dashboarding and Data Analytics (Power BI or SAP Analytics Cloud)
Minimum 6-10 years of professional cumulative experience in the following 4 areas (with a minimum of 1 year professional experience per area):
Database development, Data Modelling and SQL (Oracle RDMBS or SQL Server);
ETL tools (BODI or BODS would be an asset);
Business Objects
Data Warehouse

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team;
Ability to participate in multilingual meetings;
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects;
Excellent Team Player
High degree of discretion and integrity is required


EU-Nationality is mandatory for ALL our job openings

WHO ARE WE?

CRI Group belongs to VASS GROUP as of November 2021 (https://vasscompany.com/en/).

VASS is a leading digital solutions group of companies headquartered in Madrid, Spain, present in 25 countries in Europe, the Americas and Asia with more than 4,300 professionals.

VASS helps large companies in their digital transformation process, developing and executing the most innovative and scalable projects, from strategy to operations.

All our growth comes from our talented people, passion for innovation, and a constant search for improvement, always the VASS way: "Complex made simple".

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




Join this disruptive AI company leveraging the best practise in NLP and Computer Vision to help moderate online content and make the internet and social media a safer space.




As a Data Engineer you will build world-class models that can effectively understand content and power online safety.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and maintain cutting edge, robust machine learning algorithms across different modalities

‚Ä¢ Evaluate the huge datasets and create efficient data pipelines

‚Ä¢ Investigate possible model failure modes and how they can be solved




Their novel approach to AI interprets visual content in context and therefore is ensuring that moderation is accurate and appropriate - evolving the way in which AI is being used to safeguard the internet.




The role is being offered on either a hybrid or fully remote basis (whichever works for you!).




Apply today and have a huge impact!




Keywords: ML, AI, Deep Learning, kube flow, argo, knative, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, GCP, C#, Java, Python, Go, AI, Artificial intelligence, recommendation systems, recommender systems, Python, Machine Learning, Phd, MSc, BSc, computer science, engineer, programmer, developer, NLP, PyTorch, TensorFlow, AWS, GCP, Azure, Cloud, Infrastructure, Development, Developer, Programmer, Programming, Software, AI, Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, NLP, Natural Language Processing, Deep Neural Networks, DNN, Scientist, Research, Researcher, Cython, Modelling, Algorithms, Algorithmic, Team Work, Collaboration, Research, GANs, Deep Neural Networks, CNNs, Fairness, Ethics, Research, Scientist, Researcher, PhD, Post Doctoral, Research Fellow, Lecturer, Reinforcement Learning, ACML, NIPS, ICML, ICVPR, Publications, Conferences, Journals, Bayesian Inference, Generative Models

Title: Business Intelligence Analist
Description:
Business Intelligence Analist




Wanted: ervaren of niet.




Ben jij ge√Ønteresseerd in data & analytics? Kick jij op het analyseren van business processen en het bouwen van data producten die cruciale inzichten geven? Kan jij vlot de brug slaan tussen klanten en de technische ontwikkelteams? Werk jij graag met data en ben je verzot op het visualiseren ervan? Bouw je graag een verhaal op aan de hand van data?

Klinkt je dit als muziek in de oren? Aarzel dan niet om bij Datatune te komen werken!




Je bent een Datatuner, omdat

Je vriendelijk, eerlijk en betrouwbaar bent.
Je bent proactief, resultaatgericht en hebt een analytische geest.
Je hebt een basis kennis van data concepten en business intelligence. Je bent vertrouwd met SQL.
Je wil graag met data visualisatie tools werken zoals Power BI, Tableau of Qlik.
Je waardeert vakmanschap en bent verzot op nieuwe dingen leren.
Je bent oprecht ge√Ønteresseerd in de verhalen en interesses van andere mensen.
Je bent ervan overtuigd dat verandering goed is, je staat open voor innovatie, meningen en culturen. Je bent niet bang voor een open dialoog.
Je hebt een passie voor data en technologie.

Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

Bij Datatune kom je in een team terecht dat samen voor vakmanschap gaat.
We nemen iedere opdracht serieus en maken daarnaast zeker ruimte voor plezier.
Wij willen ons steeds goed voelen bij wat we doen, bijleren en ‚Äì ja ‚Äì genieten van ons leven naast het werk.
Wij geloven dat knap werk altijd beloond wordt. Een mooi salaris met extra voordelen op maat zijn vanzelfsprekend voor ons.
Je wordt niet gepamperd: samen met ons geef je Datatune vorm en je wordt begeleid wanneer jij dat nodig vindt.
Bij Datatune zorgen we ervoor dat je als consultant voldoende variatie en uitdagingen ervaart zonder je wensen op vlak van ¬†work-life balance uit het oog te verliezen.




Wat denk je? Ben jij klaar om mensen te verenigen rond data?




Solliciteer door je cv door te sturen naar hannes@datatune.be of laat het ons weten als je vragen hebt door een mailtje te sturen of te connecteren via LinkedIn.

Tot snel,




Bart & Hannes

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Hays Technology is looking for a BI Consultant to join a consultancy firm and to work on exciting and challenging projects across various industries




Your responsibilities as a BI Consultant

As a key member of our team, you'll lead BI & Analytics projects from start to finish, juggling multiple tasks and collaborating with a wide range of stakeholders. Additionally, you'll have the chance to mentor and guide junior team members, sharing your expertise and helping them reach their full potential.




What we are looking for

We are looking for an enthusiastic, driven and proactive individual with at least 3 years of experience in BI & Analytics with a professional services firm, internal strategy/analytics group or similar environment. You must have solid experience in Power BI and/or Tableau and be highly proficient in Dutch and English (spoken and written), French is a plus.

If you have experience in Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS) and SQL Server / Transact SQL, Azure: Synapse Analytics, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Data Factory, Talend, Alteryx, Qlik, Board, Augmented Analytics (Thoughtspot) & Process Mining (Celonis, Disco, PAFnow) it will be considered as a plus.




What you will get in return

In return, you will have the chance to work in a stable and financially strong company. You will be able to work on challenging tasks and obtain many career opportunities and personalised learning experience in a friendly and multicultural atmosphere.

You will get a permanent employee contract with a competitive salary and extensive benefits (car, eco-checks, meal vouchers, insurance pack, etc.).




Your new company

Join a world-leading firm based in Brussels that offers services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory.

A wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.




If you're interested, even if you don't match 100% of the requirement, don't hesitate to apply ! Your application is welcome!

If this vacancy is not exactly what you are looking for, but you are looking for a different position, please contact us for a confidential conversation about your career options.

Title: Freelance Functional Analyst BI
Description:
For a chemicals/logistics customer in Antwerp, I am searching for a Functional Analyst BI to add value to the company by providing insights into processes and business results through data, together with the BI data team







Responsibilities




You provide the business with their information needs. You analyse, design, define and record the functional requirements and wishes.
To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. An affinity with BI is a plus.
You provide the business with their information needs. You analyse, design, define, record and elaborate the functional requirements and wishes and provide documentation, conduct the meetings and provide presentations to share ideas and findings.
You are able to structure the requirements process
You ensure that the business wishes / requirements and the source data are translated into clear user stories for the developers. (frontend & backend), you know how to divide this into logical parts with the aim of quickly delivering added value to the business.
You will help that the delivered data products meet the quality requirements, together with the team (BI team, Data governance).
You will be the main contact for business stakeholders, building a bridge between business and the BI team.
You will provide support to the users during user acceptance testing
You ensure that you are constantly aware of evolutions and developments within your field and share this knowledge with the team. You use the best practices and guidelines.







Profile




Thorough knowledge of PowerBI and / or other data visualization tools for analysis purposes
Thorough knowledge of SQL scripting, BI & datamodeling methodologies
Thorough knowledge of Excel, Visio, other office tools, Adonis (BPMN2)
Thorough knowledge of all kinds of statistical functions & visualizations (graphs, etc.)
Thorough knowledge of the business processes and knows the systems that support the business processes
Relevant work experience with the independent analysis, description and support of business / information processes.
Good communication skills (written & oral)
Critical thinking and problem solving skills







Additional Details




START DATE: ASAP

DURATION: 6 Months w/extension

CONTRACT: Freelance

LOCATION: Antwerp

ONSITE POLICY: Flexible

HOURS PER WEEK: 40

LANGAUGES: English

INTERVIEW PROCESS: 1 Stage




If you are interested, please forward your updated resume to jay.kukoyi@vividresourcing.com to be considered.

Title: BI Visualization Consultant
Description:
The way we are gathering and storing data is evolving as never before. Data is everywhere. Are you passionate about data? Are you ready to create a story based on data? Are you ready to create a simple visualization of complex data?

As Stephen Few states: ‚ÄúWe are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven‚Äôt learned how to tame it.‚Äù Capgemini is looking for people who are able to visualize data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted. As Visualization Consultant you will have to understand the needs and requirements of the client, so it‚Äôs important you know which questions to ask. Next to this, you will also have to understand the data, so you will also have to know how to read a data model and how to query a database.

Working for Capgemini gives you the opportunity to benefit from merit-based promotion, build your network, grow your knowledge and participate in and contribute to a global team that acts with passion, commitment and integrity. Capgemini offers you the freedom to be outstanding!




Your profile

You have a bachelor/master degree or equivalent of relevant experience.
You have knowledge of visualization techniques, business requirements analysis
You have relevant experience and/or certificates in one or more of the following technologies: Microsoft PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau
Knowledge of data warehouse design and/or data modelling principles is a plus
You think of ‚Äòcontinuous learning‚Äô as a good thing
You are not afraid to ask questions
You have excellent communication skills. A good knowledge of at least one of the two national languages (French and Dutch) and English is important.




Desired Skills & Experience




Education

Bachelor, Master degree or equivalent through relevant experience




Soft skills

Team player
Active listening & comprehension
Customer oriented
Qualitative result driven
Pro-active, accurate, reliable, assertive, responsible and proud
Flexible
Leadership




Languages and mobility

Resident in Belgium
Fluent oral communication skills in French, Dutch and English
Fluent writing in mother tongue (Dutch or French) and English
Geographic mobility. You must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, and potentially abroad




We offer

A unique environment for your personal development
A career where high performance is rewarded and where freedom, industrialization, innovation and trust are in the spotlight
Wide range of training and development opportunities
A competitive salary package

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
MbarQ believes in a fundamental new way of doing AI. Many organizations today are still struggling in truly scaling AI across the company. As a result, the true potential of smart data solutions is often untapped. MbarQ has a mission to bring business & AI technology together to achieve truly transformational results.

MbarQ is a start-up that is part of the Bluu ecosystem, a Cronos cluster of companies. Bluu is a vibrant community of companies & start-ups all active in the area of digital transformation.

We believe that digital transformation cannot be done without AI. With your help, we embark on a journey to guide our clients in the right direction.




What will you do?

As a Data Engineer, you are a key link in building and using scalable data platforms for business teams.
You are the data expert. Data is your product. You get to know the customer‚Äôs data through and through, so you know exactly what types of data there are, whether they are reliable, in what form they occur, etc. You will also be able to monitor the quality of these data periodically.
As a Data Engineer you will work closely together with experienced colleagues on Data Services. You will develop high-performance data pipelines integrating data from different sources in batch and in real-time according to the predefined business logic.
You help industrialize machine learning models and make the results available to other operational systems.
You have attention for security, privacy and ethical aspects when building data solutions.




Who would we like to join our team?

You have experience solving data issues and streamlining data delivery via the use of data pipelines
You have experience with Azure or equivalent cloud ecosystems
You have experience using SQL for data querying
You have experience or want to learn Python
Knowledge or experience in using Databricks or related industrialization technologies is a plus
Experience with different types of data processing (batch processing, streaming analytics, etc.)




What do we offer you?

We combine the flexibility & joy-of-work of a start-up with the professionalism & job security of the largest IT-provider in Belgium. It is a unique experience that we are more than happy to indulge you in.
We offer you a fast-growing start-up where innovation & entrepreneurship are encouraged. You can make an impact on our future journey.
We care about you and want to grow with you. Together, we work on a personalized development plan to strengthen your soft & hard skills.
Backed by Cronos, we offer you an attractive salary including extralegal offers.
Do you believe in our mission to bring business & AI together? If so, embark on our journey!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




Hybrid working arrangement




Role Purpose

If you have an interest in financial services and have been waiting for an opportunity to become a data engineer, this could be your next role. Being part of the Data & Analytics team, you will be a promoter of our data within the Business. You will be a key element in building and maintaining a performing data infrastructure and helping the other squads to become more data driven.




What we‚Äôre looking for

Main responsibilities of this role include:

The set-up of the necessary flows (ETL techniques ‚Äì Alteryx)
Designing, developing, implementing and maintaining great quality dashboards using Tableau desktop & Tableau Online
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements around data engineering
Leverage and improve data to enable better business decisions
A close collaboration with the stakeholders in order to gather their requirements




What you already have

Minimum 3 years of relevant experience
Master or equivalent experience
Strong knowledge of English
Minimum 2 years of experience with SQL, data modeling and data pipelines
Experience with ETL - Alteryx
You enjoy turning business requirements into high quality SQL code
Capable of working with high volumes of data
Stakeholder management: experience working closely and communicating effectively with technical and non technical stakeholders




Skills

Prioritises problems by considering the impact on the business
Strong data analytics/ data management experience
Communication and influencing skills.
Able to controls emotions in conflict or any situation of intense stress
Curious mind and strong problem-solving skills
You have excellent English writing skills, good communication and influencing skills.




Additional benefits

A competitive salary, complemented by a wide range of extra-legal benefits (insurance, meal vouchers, extra-legal days off, etc.)Flexible working arrangements
A position in a responsible, socially engaged organisation where diversity and inclusion are the standard.




Send your resume or contact us for more details : 04 92 11 94 23 ;

Title: BI Consultant Qlik
Description:
(Belgium or Luxembourg)




As a BI consultant, you'll help clients deal with complex business situations and promote, develop and implement Agilos Solutions and Services. You'll provide the necessary business insights and enable the customer to optimize their operational performance.?




Your challenges




You'll interact with the key stakeholders to clearly define the requirements and be responsible for designing analytical BI applications for clients.




Develop the design for various reporting and dashboarding applications and solutions;
Take an active role in the data modelling process and help optimize data models for BI implementations;
Outline quality processes and creating solutions for data conversion and integration;
Assist clients by providing them with advice on improving their existing data management and delivery solutions;
Work on ways to improve data accuracy and viability by streamlining the data quality and data flow processes used across the enterprise.




Your talents




You have a practical and pragmatic attitude and are able to communicate at different levels. Thanks to your analytical skills, you quickly find solutions. You can work independently, but at the same time also enjoy teamwork.




Bachelor or Master degree in IT
You feel at home in a strongly growing organization
Good communication skills and commercial attitude
Analytical thinking
Knowledge of and experience with dashboarding and visualization products is a must, knowledge of Qlik is a plus
You have a good knowledge of Dutch/French and English.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Invest and/or Insurance Senior DATA Engineer

You have a solid relevant experience in Requirement gathering and analysis, in solution design and Data modeling, capturing, feeding, enhancing, reporting, big data?

You are passionate about Data, you are proactive and eager to learn, you know what it means to work in an Agile mode, and you want to join one of the key players within the banking sector? We look to strengthen our data engineering teams.

Within the Data Department, the Data Hub tribe is looking for experienced, motivated & proactive DATA Engineers. You have a solid relevant experience in Business Intelligence, Data modeling, capturing, feeding, enhancing, reporting, ? We will give you the opportunity to apply and develop your skills serving several of our internal customers to support fact based decision-making as well as improve business actions, throughout the whole Bank.

What do we do?

As part of the Data department, the Data Hub tribe is working closely with all the other departments of the Bank and plays a major role in :
providing business intelligence reporting and analysis services and maintaining the related assets:
for all the bank‚Äôs business lines and functions such as Retail & Private Banking, Corporate Banking, Finance, Risk, Compliance, Human Resources Management, Security, Easy Banking Application, Easy Banking Business.
for all product-related domains such as Payments, Credits, Invest, Cash, Cards & Accounts, Shared Service Centre Cost and Accounting.
for regulatory reporting like FATCA/AEOI, PSD2,Mifid, ‚Ä¶
providing prepared and well designed data stores to be consumed by eg API‚Äôs, reportings, analytics.
knowing our ‚Äì mostly internal - clients and always ready to help them or introduce them to new services. This happens in collaboration with transversal teams, following standard Tribe guidelines in terms of methods and approach.
providing raw as well as prepared data pipe lines to support ad hoc as well as industrialised advanced analytics
respecting the data protection rules and managing carefully the risks: we collect and process important data in the name of our clients.
providing state of the art data management guaranteeing compliant, secured, well documented and governed data assets, tools and platforms


Your future job

You join the ‚ÄúInvest, Insurance and Private Data‚Äù squad and as Senior DATA Engineer, you are a key contributor in preparing and making data available in a safe and secure manner, for multiple usages by Businesses and Functions, and for multiple purposes : reporting, analytics visualization, API.

You contribute to the productivity of all Data Consumers by delivering well designed and running Data Assets, to be used at various levels: for specific local needs and usages, bank-wide for global usage, or within a specific Business or Function.

You focus on the functional design of the solutions to be built and/or to be integrated in the existing ecosystem, ensuring that the solution will be in line with company standards concerning quality and performance, and resource usage.

You elaborate and document the chosen solution, translate the functional requirements in technical requirements.

You follow up the development and testing to ensure coherence between the functional specifications and the developed solution.

You feel comfortable communicating with the different stakeholders in a project within the bank (analysts from other departments, legal, compliance, developers).

You are open for T-shaping, supporting flexible engaging on the different tasks to be handled within the squad and tribe.

As a senior profile, you actively contribute to maintaining and improving the standards, guidelines and good practices on data engineering. You coach more junior profiles and you like to share your experiences and good practices within the chapter of data engineers.

Highlight your strengths

You have a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT (Informatica, Computer or industrial engineering), in business administration or equivalent by experience (> 5 years).
You have a good understanding of the Invest and/or Insurance world (i.e., high-level knowledge of shares, funds, life insurances, bonds, etc.).
You have an excellent knowledge of English and preferably speak proficient on of the following languages: French or Dutch.
You have at least 5 years of experience with data in any of the financial service domain (product related, business related). Having a significant experience in Big Data technologies and platforms is an advantage.
You have a good knowledge of data modelling, structuring and sound data management. In this context, you are able to design and develop good practices for Business Intelligence and Big Data. You have an Agile mindset; you are a team player, you like sharing your knowledge, you learn and adapt fast. You are open to give and receive constructive feedback and inspire accordingly. You don‚Äôt hesitate to contribute to cross-functional projects, outside of the boundaries of your primary role. You can manage your time efficiently and set up priorities.
You are client focused and transform client wishes into documented solutions. You listen to the customer and you co-create adequate solutions for his needs together. You take a proactive approach, tackling problems immediately. You also inspire motivation and positivity. You are result oriented, a problem solver.
You like to take E2E ownership of the activities you are carrying out


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them have their own experience and identity. HTML:
Invest and/or Insurance Senior DATA Engineer

You have a solid relevant experience in Requirement gathering and analysis, in solution design and Data modeling, capturing, feeding, enhancing, reporting, big data?

You are passionate about Data, you are proactive and eager to learn, you know what it means to work in an Agile mode, and you want to join one of the key players within the banking sector? We look to strengthen our data engineering teams.

Within the Data Department, the Data Hub tribe is looking for experienced, motivated & proactive DATA Engineers. You have a solid relevant experience in Business Intelligence, Data modeling, capturing, feeding, enhancing, reporting, ? We will give you the opportunity to apply and develop your skills serving several of our internal customers to support fact based decision-making as well as improve business actions, throughout the whole Bank.

What do we do?

As part of the Data department, the Data Hub tribe is working closely with all the other departments of the Bank and plays a major role in :
  • providing business intelligence reporting and analysis services and maintaining the related assets:
    • for all the bank‚Äôs business lines and functions such as Retail & Private Banking, Corporate Banking, Finance, Risk, Compliance, Human Resources Management, Security, Easy Banking Application, Easy Banking Business.
    • for all product-related domains such as Payments, Credits, Invest, Cash, Cards & Accounts, Shared Service Centre Cost and Accounting.
    • for regulatory reporting like FATCA/AEOI, PSD2,Mifid, ‚Ä¶
  • providing prepared and well designed data stores to be consumed by eg API‚Äôs, reportings, analytics.
  • knowing our ‚Äì mostly internal - clients and always ready to help them or introduce them to new services. This happens in collaboration with transversal teams, following standard Tribe guidelines in terms of methods and approach.
  • providing raw as well as prepared data pipe lines to support ad hoc as well as industrialised advanced analytics
  • respecting the data protection rules and managing carefully the risks: we collect and process important data in the name of our clients.
  • providing state of the art data management guaranteeing compliant, secured, well documented and governed data assets, tools and platforms

Your future job

You join the ‚ÄúInvest, Insurance and Private Data‚Äù squad and as Senior DATA Engineer, you are a key contributor in preparing and making data available in a safe and secure manner, for multiple usages by Businesses and Functions, and for multiple purposes : reporting, analytics visualization, API.

You contribute to the productivity of all Data Consumers by delivering well designed and running Data Assets, to be used at various levels: for specific local needs and usages, bank-wide for global usage, or within a specific Business or Function.

You focus on the functional design of the solutions to be built and/or to be integrated in the existing ecosystem, ensuring that the solution will be in line with company standards concerning quality and performance, and resource usage.

You elaborate and document the chosen solution, translate the functional requirements in technical requirements.

You follow up the development and testing to ensure coherence between the functional specifications and the developed solution.

You feel comfortable communicating with the different stakeholders in a project within the bank (analysts from other departments, legal, compliance, developers).

You are open for T-shaping, supporting flexible engaging on the different tasks to be handled within the squad and tribe.

As a senior profile, you actively contribute to maintaining and improving the standards, guidelines and good practices on data engineering. You coach more junior profiles and you like to share your experiences and good practices within the chapter of data engineers.

Highlight your strengths
  • You have a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT (Informatica, Computer or industrial engineering), in business administration or equivalent by experience (> 5 years).
  • You have a good understanding of the Invest and/or Insurance world (i.e., high-level knowledge of shares, funds, life insurances, bonds, etc.).
  • You have an excellent knowledge of English and preferably speak proficient on of the following languages: French or Dutch.
  • You have at least 5 years of experience with data in any of the financial service domain (product related, business related). Having a significant experience in Big Data technologies and platforms is an advantage.
  • You have a good knowledge of data modelling, structuring and sound data management. In this context, you are able to design and develop good practices for Business Intelligence and Big Data. You have an Agile mindset; you are a team player, you like sharing your knowledge, you learn and adapt fast. You are open to give and receive constructive feedback and inspire accordingly. You don‚Äôt hesitate to contribute to cross-functional projects, outside of the boundaries of your primary role. You can manage your time efficiently and set up priorities.
  • You are client focused and transform client wishes into documented solutions. You listen to the customer and you co-create adequate solutions for his needs together. You take a proactive approach, tackling problems immediately. You also inspire motivation and positivity. You are result oriented, a problem solver.
  • You like to take E2E ownership of the activities you are carrying out

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them have their own experience and identity. Title: Power BI Consultant
HTML:
Ben je ambitieus en klaar om je in snel tempo te ontwikkelen? Wil je ervaring opdoen bij diverse bedrijven en onderdeel worden van een data focused consultanty?

Profiteer dan van ons high quality network van opdrachtgevers met een inspirerende data community!


Wij op zoek naar een ervaren Power BI consultant om ons Visser & Van Baars Data team te vervolledigen. Als je gepassioneerd bent rond alles wat met Microsoft BI te maken heeft en energie krijgt van het bouwen van Power BI Dashboards zijn wij potentieel een goede match!


Als consultant zal je de verantwoordelijkheid hebben voor het ontwerpen, implementeren en onderhouden van geavanceerde Power BI-rapportages en -dashboards voor onze klanten. Je zal zowel in on-premise omgevingen werken als in cloud omgevingen met Azure. Daarnaast transformeer je functionele en technische requirements in MSBI ontwerpen.



Onze ideale kandidaat ziet er als volgt uit:

  • Een achtergrond in IT en 2-3 jaar ervaring binnen Business Intelligence;
  • Minimaal een eerste ervaring binnen Power BI en SQL;
  • Ervaring in DAX en M language? Dikke plus!
  • Kan complexe modellen ontwerpen en visualisaties bouwen;
  • Heeft ervaring met data integratie en transformatie;
  • Nederlandstalig en een goede kennis van het Engels;
  • Is proactief, communicatief vaardig en een teamplayer.



Ons aanbod

Als Power BI consultant bij Visser & Van Baars, zul je de kans krijgen om te werken aan uitdagende projecten bij grote organisaties en je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een organisatie die gefocust is op data (dus nee; geen algemene IT projecten!). Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk salaris met een volledig extralegaal pakket incl. company car. Zin om je skills te upgraden? Dan kan je profiteren van ons uitgebreid Learning & Development platform.

Ben jij de Power BI consultant die wij zoeken? Reageer dan met je cv. We kijken ernaar uit om van je te horen!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description




Data Wizard. Analyst. Developer.




Main goal? Simplifying the large amount of complex data into more practical data, so that the right strategic decisions can be made! As a Data Engineer for Sarens Group you‚Äôll be co-managing 3 specific domains (Data warehouse ‚Äì Microsoft Azure ‚Äì handover to Power BI) to support the business analysis team and other business stakeholders. A challenging job with visible achievements, great responsibility, nice stakeholders who‚Äôll appreciate your work and a lot of learning opportunities!




Join the force behind #Nothing too heavy, Nothing too high.




The Business Intelligence Team Itself Consists Of Three Positions




In this position as Data Engineer, you are part of the Digital transformation team, and together with your colleagues you‚Äôll support our internal business stakeholders.




Data Engineer
Business Intelligence Analyst
Team lead Business Intelligence




Data warehouse (70% of your time)




Managing our Microsoft technology-based Data warehouse to support the business analysis team and other business stakeholders in their reporting requirements which are used daily in our decision-making processes.
Contributing to the data modelling and data architecture design & implementation of our data warehouse which contains data from our different ERP (D365, SAP, AX2009, Navision) and other systems.
Creating and maintaining all interfaces, managing the performances, and making sure all required security is in place.
Designing and implementing data integration, data quality and data conversion.
Designing of data pipelines for data ingestion and data transformation.
Managing and optimizing the data platforms of data streams, both in batch and real time.
Documentation of solutions, configuration, and program modifications according to internal standards.




Microsoft Azure (30% of your time)




Supporting the business by providing stable, secure and up-to-date technologies hosted in Microsoft Azure.
Managing, building and optimizing modern data architectures based on the Microsoft Azure Platform (Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage, FTP, Integrations‚Ä¶) and making sure all required security is in place.
Keeping an eye on related costs and implementing cost reductions where applicable.




Profile




We are looking for a Data Engineer who likes to take on new challenges and is willing to go the extra mile with a ‚Äòcan-do‚Äô mentality. An independent thinker and worker who can work on several projects at a time. With a solution-oriented attitude and strong analytical skills you‚Äôre solving problems and searching for optimizations. You‚Äôre a team player with good communication skills (written and verbally). You‚Äôre very passionate about data.




The profile requirements




Bachelor in Computer Science, IT or comparable
2-5 years‚Äô experience with SQL servers, Microsoft BI and/or Azure.
Experience developing and deploying ETL solutions on Premises and/or cloud.
Good understanding of data modelling and data architecture.
Deep knowledge of SQL/T, SQL scripts.
Experience with data visualization in PowerBI is a plus.
Database knowledge of SAP, AX2009, Navision and D365 is a plus.
Fluent in English (oral and written), Dutch is a plus




We offer




As a Data Engineer you‚Äôll get the chance to shape an interesting and progressive datasystem infrastructure at Sarens. The various tasks, the team spirit and the visible, practical achievements ensure great job satisfaction!




A contract of indefinite duration ‚Äì fulltime position (40 hours/week) with flexible working hours.
Legal holidays and public holidays + 12 additional compensatory days.
An attractive salary with numerous benefits such as meal vouchers, net expense allowance, company car with fuel card, medical insurance DKV, group insurance, laptop‚Ä¶
Interesting training and career opportunities. ‚Äì You own your future!
Nice working atmosphere and helpful colleagues!
Place of employment: Belgium, 1861 Wolvertem or on one of our other sites across Belgium.




Contact




Excited to join our Sarens team as a Data Engineer?




Don‚Äôt hesitate and apply online: www.sarens.com




Your application will be handled quickly, discreetly and professionally




Attachment

Title: Data Analyst Engineer for new technology applications (Kortrijk, Leuven, or Lommel)
HTML:
You use data analytics and machine learning techniques to predict machine behavior and derive the optimal settings for robots, autonomous vehicles and industrial machines.

 

For the development of high tech machinery (f.e. compressor, 3D printer, self-guided robot, autonomous vehicle‚Ä¶), you will:

  • Work together in a research team that combines expertise in artificial intelligence with the operation and control of machines and vehicles;
  • Take the lead in developing predictive algorithms, to process the data and derive the optimal settings of the machine (Model Based Data Analytics).

 

Use computing power for high tech applications

 

Flanders Make research engineers are experts in developing new technologies for machines and vehicles. Automotive companies and machine builders in Flanders are looking for predictive control and data analytics for the next step to take in their innovation process.

 

What if you could predict machine failure by analyzing measurements?

Why do certain automotive parts result in better performance?


More concretely, you:

  • Understand the goal of the measurement campaign and discuss how to gather relevant data with the team (f.e. temperature signals, accelerometer signals, energy measurements, failure signals,‚Ä¶);
  • Provide structure and insight into the raw data;
  • Find ways to process the flow of data;
  • Use current methods of data analytics, machine learning and deep learning techniques to search for relevant connections between input signals (f.e. which environmental factors could be influencing the energy efficiency of the machine?); 
  • Use and Model predictive algorithms and interpret the results;
  • Draw conclusions and suggest improved parameters, for better performance or to influence the energy efficiency.

 

Experienced engineers can also coach young researchers and lead projects. (Technical Project Manager job description on jobs.flandersmake.be.)


Statistical mind with passion for technology

 

You have

  • A Master or PhD degree in Engineering (Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics‚Ä¶,‚Ä¶);
  • At least 3 to 5 years of experience in an industrial or academic environment;
  • Relevant experience with experimental design on a real life (non-virtual) technology application (machines, vehicles, robots,..);
  • Knowledge of or the ability to use a wide range of methods in data analytics, machine learning (including but not exclusively deep learning), and data wrangling techniques, f.e. random forests, support vector machines, and (convolutional/recurrent/deep) neural networks);
  • Experience with at least one machine learning toolkit (Scikit-learn, Mahout, SparkML, Caffe, Tensorflow, R, KNIME, ...) and Matlab/Octave.
  • Knowledge of one general purpose programming language like Java, C#, C++.
  • A mathematical and statistical mind with a touch of ‚ÄúData Intuition‚Äù;
  • Communication and Data Visualization skills are a plus.

 

You are

  • passionate about the technology of machines and vehicles;
  • creative;
  • a good communicator;
  • an active listener who can build sustainable relationships.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
DATA ENGINEER/ARCHITECT | Azure




Do you enjoy the challenge of creating a complete Azure Data environment in collaboration with an external party?

Within this software company, you will work with a 30-strong IT team to support the strong daily growth of an innovative port company. This logistics player is an international market leader with over 1,200 customers in Belgium, Ireland, Portugal and the UK, among others.




DATA ENGINEER/ARCHITECT ‚Äì Tasks

You will work with Element61 to build an Azure data platform on top of their own databases to replace current reporting solutions.
You will translate the business requirements into a data warehouse model.
To do this, you will collaborate with a team of data analysts working on Power BI.




DATA ENGINEER/ARCHITECT - Profile

You have gained experience in a similar role. Therefore, you have knowledge of Databricks and Azure Data Factory.
You like to work independently, but also in a team.
You are fluent in Dutch and French




DATA ENGINEER/ARCHITECT - Offer

A challenging position, where your personal development is central. Necessary training is provided so that you become the expert in your field!
Attractive salary of up to approx. 70K‚Ç¨ on an annual basis with bonuses depending on your knowledge and experience, as your efforts will certainly be highlighted and rewarded!
The freedom to choose your own car (including fuel card) with an attractive budget provided.
Hospitalization insurance for you and your family members! On top of that, an advantageous group insurance, a peace of mind for later.
You will also receive meal vouchers and eco-vouchers to keep you spoiled!
As soon as you start work, you will receive the extra equipment you need, such as a laptop and a smartphone.
Your work-life balance is important. Take advantage of flexible working hours and home working days.

Title: Data Engineer
Company: PHIRI - Population Health Information Research Infrastructure for COVID-19
Description:
Sciensano (The Belgian Public health institute) is looking for a data engineer!

The EU Health Information System Unit of Sciensano (Department of Epidemiology and Public Health), is involved in international projects in health information including the Population Health Information Research Infrastructure (PHIRI), HealthyCloud and the European Health Data Space 2 pilot. These projects aim to facilitate and support data-driven research by sharing health information across European countries. In specific use cases federated research infrastructures are built and tested to allow federated analysis of data sets. Our newly created position of Data engineer will be responsible to carry out these use cases. Additionally, metadata catalogues are being built using standards. You would be responsible to build out the standards with a European team.

Your specific tasks to develop within the project:

Develop metadata catalogues ensuring machine readability
Design and implementation of data management processes (including extraction, integration, quality analysis and maintenance and management of metadata)
Design and implementation of distributed analysis codes
Performance optimization of data management processes and queries
Diagnosis and resolution of incidents
Execute process mining techniques and analyse their results




Profile:

A specific training in the areas of Information Systems, Computing or Software Engineering
Practical knowledge in: languages, libraries and specialized environments in data science (R, Python+Pandas, etc); data management: design and use of relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, etc.), incl. SQL language; design and use of non-relational databases (Cassandra, MongoDB, etc.); design of ETL processes
Knowledge in the field of health information systems: applications, coding standards, etc.
Knowledge of: data quality analysis and evaluation techniques and processes; specialised libraries for Big Data processing (Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, etc.); machine learning/deep learning libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.)
Languages: fluent English (plus French or Dutch)




We offer:

A challenging position in a well-known scientific institute
Fixed-term employment contract (+/- 2 years)
Betting scale : SW10 Benefits : free season ticket or 100% reimbursement of commuting by public transport; hospitalization and group insurance; meal vouchers; benefits via FED+ (www.fedplus.be); other social benefits
Other : flexible working hours in a 38-hour week; possibility of teleworking and training




Deadline for application extended to the 31st of January 2023.

Application: https://jobs.sciensano.be/content/jobpage.asp?a=DETAIL&jdkid=1045&l=DUTCH

French: https://jobs.sciensano.be/content/jobpage.asp?a=DETAIL&jdkid=1045&l=FRENCH

Title: Power BI Expert
Description:
Our client has an important reporting need in order to ensure an optimal client service. A couple of years ago the reporting has been switched from Excel to power BI. In the coming
years we will switch the reporting source to a new Datawarehouse. In parallel with this, the demand for reports is constantly growing.



The objectives are:
* Analysis of new reportings. Acquiring knowledge regarding the business department will be
necessary.
* Seek the information source needed to build the new reports.
* Create and test new powerful reports in POWER BI.
* Implement automated versions of those reports.
* Understand the existing reports and be able to maintain them.
* Be able to communicate in a structured and clear manner to the management of the department.




Desired Skills and Experience

Mandatory
* Power BI : Mid-level (2 y - 5 y)
* MS Office : Mid-level (2 y - 5 y)
* BI-Reporting : Junior (0 y - 2 y)
* FR OR NL + EN

Preferable
* Power BI Senior : (5 y - 8 y)
* Power Automate : Junior (0 y - 2 y)
* Insurance knowledge
* Health Insurance knowledge

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer







What if you joined Apside Belgium to work on the challenging projects of tomorrow ?







ABOUT YOU ?




You are used to work according to rules, standards and guidelines in Banking sec
torYou have very good communication skills, and enjoy working in a team




This Data Engineer position is made for you!







THE MISSION




Develop ETL flows within the new information system. The different components will be integrated using Python and will be running on a (MAPR) Cluster. This new platform will be used to replace an existing ecosystem which is based on a traditional ETL tool (Ab Initio). As we are mostly dealing with Asset management related data (Orders, Trades,...), the flows need to be resilient and have a low latency. Auditability is also key.




Deliverables




ETL flows written in Python to replace the existing AbInitio flows of one of the applications.







YOUR PROFILE




Technical skills




- Python development - Unit/Integration test coding

- Hadoop/S3 open source components

- Cloud development

- Technical Architecture: ETL flow design

- DevOps: building CI/CD pipelines




Similar experience: Minimum 3 years




Languages: English and French mandatory




Prior experience in IT infrastructure department with some technical backgroundOptional : ETL

Tools: Ab Initio/DataStage/Informatica, Python




You are stress resistant, pragmatic and enjoy working in a team.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Ebury is a hyper-growth FinTech firm, named in 2021 as one of the top FinTech's to work for by Glassdoor and AltFi. We offer a range of products including FX risk management, trade finance, currency accounts, international payments and API integration.

Our Tech Team hub is located in M√°laga, Spain, and we are all fully remote workers! Our team members are based in more than ten countries.

Your background


You have experience with complex data systems and migrations. Our core data solution technologies are BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Kafka, Python, DBT and Airflow, but it is also ok if you are more comfortable with other languages, databases and streaming platforms including the data services of cloud providers such as Amazon (AWS) and Google (GCP).
Since you will work side by side with colleagues from different countries, you will be able to communicate clearly and concisely your ideas in English both written and spoken.
We look for data engineers that can model challenging business concepts and data flows.
You will have experience in data interrogation and validation using tools and techniques.
Quality is important to us, we expect our engineers to be familiar with the regulatory requirements on data systems and have worked in environments with mature data governance and life-cycle management.


The Project
You will contribute to the development of a transactional banking platform, focusing on receiving and issuing payments in more than 140 currencies.
Our platform is a single platform (20+ Services) with 3 distinct channels for users to access our core functionality:
A variety of in house and third party systems acting as data sources
Help in defining, communicating and driving the data architecture within Ebury and its engineering teams.
Implementation of solutions with an audit by design ethos to ensure Ebury‚Äôs regulatory obligations are fulfilled.
Build and Run services in production. Using tools such as Jenkins, Terraform, Sentry, Prometheus, ELK.. you and your team will be responsible for achieving Service Level Objectives for your code.
Work with cross-functional product and technology teams across the company to build new features at large and multi-region scaleAll of these run smoothly in Docker containers on AWS ECS and Kubernetes.

What We Offer


You will be part of a remote-first distributed technology team that cares deeply about people, culture and best practices, and believes in agile principles. Take a look here and see what our team say about us!
You‚Äôll have continuous professional growth thanks to our career progression framework with regular reviews.
You‚Äôll improve your personal development through training and certification.
You‚Äôll contribute to our technical design through our open and collaborative Request For Comments (RFC) process.
We are Open Source friendly, following Open Source principles in our internal projects and encouraging contributions to external projects.
An in-depth onboarding process to make you feel part of the team from your first day.


Due to our remote-first organisation and our remote-focused onboarding system, you will feel a crucial part of the team since day one. Curious about what working remotely is like at Ebury? Take a look and see what our team say about us!

If there‚Äôs something that you can do in our Tech team, it is growing professionally: thanks to our career path and our collaborative and cross-team working, every day is a new adventure. Get ready to take your career to the next level

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1300 staff with a presence in more than 20 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a ¬£350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Use your data skills to work on the most important challenge of our time: supporting the world to a net zero carbon society

¬†

Climact is an independent energy & climate company, using models and data to drive down carbon emissions for both private and public organisations. We develop sophisticated, user-friendly and open-source models on the energy and climate systems at the global, national and city levels - and use our findings to improve energy and climate policy. We're looking for enthusiastic new colleagues to join us at a period of rapid growth, to be part of an innovative team that‚Äôs having a global impact in tackling climate change with our asset-based consulting. Models can truly support the energy transition. The whole Climact team is focused on leveraging them towards climate action. See examples of our work at¬†www.climact.com¬†and¬†LinkedIn.

¬†

Climact is recruiting a talented data engineer who will support the development of our existing tools with the rest of the technical team. Climact's vision is to be able to provide top notch modelling of the energy system based on open-source models and data, and to be able to leverage these assets for our consulting practices, supporting both public and private actors towards a carbon-free energy system. The technical team is growing as we expand our current models to more countries to cover all major economies, and also expanding the type of analysis and services we can provide (e.g., the impact on power and gas networks at the European level, minerals, air quality, water use). Your role will be to support the increasing role and quantity of data in our models.

¬†

The current Climact technical team will give you valuable support to complement your technical competency with programming and data, leveraging your ability to impact. The role will report to this technical team and the wider management.

¬†

Role and responsibilities

The new position, within the technical team, includes the following responsibilities:

Contribute to the development of existing tools (e.g.¬†Pathways Explorer,¬†EUCityCalc,¬†EUCalc,¬†My2050)
Orchestrate and automate existing ETL pipelines
Distribute data through API
Manage related infrastructure (including cloud infrastructure and database)
Automate release process of existing tools
Contribute to the data science and some architectural design on various programming tools, in co-creation with the energy and climate consultants
Contribute to developing analytics and data science expertise on Climact consulting engagements

¬†

Potential applicants should present the following experience and skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong sense of creativity and autonomy
Engineering and/or IT degree.
Ambition to contribute to the climate change challenge through energy models which help objectify the debate.
Strong Python programming skills
Version control knowledge (Git)
2 years of relevant experience in programming/modelling/architecture design is an asset
Technical experience in the following is an asset:
ETL pipeline
Knowledge of database management and SQL
Cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS)
Containerization (e.g. Docker)
REST API
Workflow orchestration
DevOps and CI/CD
Optimisation (pre-running of code components, storage vs speed optimisation, complexity of operations)
Capability to harmonise best practices
Good communication skills (EN & FR or NL)
Ambition to evolve and grow in programming, modelling, and architecture within Climact

¬†

Proposal

We offer a full-time position with a competitive salary package.
Mobility solutions are provided.
Telecommunication tools and flexible home teleworking available.
Offices in Brussels and Louvain-la-Neuve.
Customers can be in Belgium and Europe; some (limited) travelling may be necessary.

¬†

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment and diversity of our workforce. Our recruiting process includes discussions and potential analytics, data science & consulting cases interviews.

¬†

To apply for this position please follow the link : Data engineer

¬†

ÔªøOnly applications received via this link will be processed. Thank you

HTML:
Use your data skills to work on the most important challenge of our time: supporting the world to a net zero carbon society

 

Climact is an independent energy & climate company, using models and data to drive down carbon emissions for both private and public organisations. We develop sophisticated, user-friendly and open-source models on the energy and climate systems at the global, national and city levels - and use our findings to improve energy and climate policy. We're looking for enthusiastic new colleagues to join us at a period of rapid growth, to be part of an innovative team that‚Äôs having a global impact in tackling climate change with our asset-based consulting. Models can truly support the energy transition. The whole Climact team is focused on leveraging them towards climate action. See examples of our work at www.climact.com and LinkedIn.

 

Climact is recruiting a talented data engineer who will support the development of our existing tools with the rest of the technical team. Climact's vision is to be able to provide top notch modelling of the energy system based on open-source models and data, and to be able to leverage these assets for our consulting practices, supporting both public and private actors towards a carbon-free energy system. The technical team is growing as we expand our current models to more countries to cover all major economies, and also expanding the type of analysis and services we can provide (e.g., the impact on power and gas networks at the European level, minerals, air quality, water use). Your role will be to support the increasing role and quantity of data in our models.

 

The current Climact technical team will give you valuable support to complement your technical competency with programming and data, leveraging your ability to impact. The role will report to this technical team and the wider management.

 

Role and responsibilities

The new position, within the technical team, includes the following responsibilities:

  • Contribute to the development of existing tools (e.g. Pathways Explorer, EUCityCalc, EUCalc, My2050)
  • Orchestrate and automate existing ETL pipelines
  • Distribute data through API
  • Manage related infrastructure (including cloud infrastructure and database)
  • Automate release process of existing tools
  • Contribute to the data science and some architectural design on various programming tools, in co-creation with the energy and climate consultants
  • Contribute to developing analytics and data science expertise on Climact consulting engagements

 

Potential applicants should present the following experience and skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong sense of creativity and autonomy
  • Engineering and/or IT degree.
  • Ambition to contribute to the climate change challenge through energy models which help objectify the debate.
  • Strong Python programming skills
  • Version control knowledge (Git)
  • 2 years of relevant experience in programming/modelling/architecture design is an asset
  • Technical experience in the following is an asset:
  • ETL pipeline
  • Knowledge of database management and SQL
  • Cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS)
  • Containerization (e.g. Docker)
  • REST API
  • Workflow orchestration
  • DevOps and CI/CD
  • Optimisation (pre-running of code components, storage vs speed optimisation, complexity of operations)
  • Capability to harmonise best practices
  • Good communication skills (EN & FR or NL)
  • Ambition to evolve and grow in programming, modelling, and architecture within Climact

 

Proposal

  • We offer a full-time position with a competitive salary package.
  • Mobility solutions are provided.
  • Telecommunication tools and flexible home teleworking available.
  • Offices in Brussels and Louvain-la-Neuve.
  • Customers can be in Belgium and Europe; some (limited) travelling may be necessary.

 

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment and diversity of our workforce. Our recruiting process includes discussions and potential analytics, data science & consulting cases interviews.

 

To apply for this position please follow the link : Data engineer

 

ÔªøOnly applications received via this link will be processed. Thank you

Title: Data Analyst/ Senior Data Analyst (Statistics/Python/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Overview:




The Agoda Content department is currently looking for a curious and questioning self-starter and proactive analyst, who will help drive decision making with insights from content, marketing and partner performance data.




You will get the opportunity to own analytical projects to direct our department‚Äôs focus, and prioritize our actions. By joining Agoda, you will become part of a truly international team, with leading experts of different backgrounds coming from 50+ countries around the world. This is a genuine opportunity to gain valuable experience in a challenging and cutting-edge tech environment. The ideal candidate would have a passion for high-converting content, great user-experience, data and analysis tools and methods. This position reports to the Associate Director of Content Operations, in Bangkok, Thailand.




Main responsibilities:




Understand Content goals and KPIs and be able to align reports and insights based on them. Identify and investigate trends, anomalies and opportunities to improve Agoda‚Äôs Content strategy
Identify content opportunities that drive customer value, bookings and conversion
Help build business cases around the opportunity and get buy-in from stakeholders
Ensure appropriate data/tools/dashboards to measure execution and enable deeper analysis
Track execution and report up in regular updates
Work with product, data/BI team and IT to create data resources and build appropriate reporting
Work with Content team leads to understand their business needs and identify opportunities in terms of team actions prioritization and focus
Use multiple data sources to report Content projects insights and impact; support Content tests and experiments
Encourage and train the Content team in best practice use of Agoda data, analysis techniques and interpretation
Coordinate with other Cross Functional departments like Analytics, Partner Services, and Product Owners
Use Web-Analytics for Research and Analysis




Requirements:




Bachelor degree or higher
2+ years of relevant experience
Experience / knowledge in statistics, SQL, Python/R, Tableau and advanced Excel ‚Äì required
Ability to demonstrate data manipulation using data warehouse and create meaningful insight and visualization
Experience / knowledge in Vertica and / or Impala ‚Äì advantage
Experience in generating data and / or preparing experiments for product development ‚Äì advantage




Professional characteristics:




Attentive to detail and committed to data integrity
Keen and curious nature; able and willing to share your opinion
Organized; able to manage multiple, competing priorities and deliver results under tight deadlines
Able to communicate effectively; fluent in English ‚Äì both spoken and written

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.


We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .


To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Power BI Engineer
Description:
Company Description




Tessenderlo Group is a diversified industrial group that focuses on agriculture, valorizing bio-residuals, energy and providing industrial solutions with a focus on water. The group employs approximately 4,800 people, is a leader in most of its markets and recorded a consolidated revenue of 2.1 billion EUR in 2021. Tessenderlo Group is listed on Euronext Brussels and is part of Next 150 and BEL Mid indices.




The philosophy that ‚ÄòEvery Molecule Counts‚Äô defines the unique attitude to sustainability and continuous practical innovation within each department of Tessenderlo Group. As an international company with Belgian roots, Tessenderlo Group also promotes personal and local entrepreneurship, creating opportunities for all of our employees to take on challenging roles and real responsibilities. On top of this, our people are encouraged to further develop their competencies through regular training initiatives and are rewarded with competitive compensation and benefits packages.




Job Description




To deploy reports & dashboards in Power BI, the Tessenderlo Group global ICT department, located in Brussels, is looking for a Power BI Consultant. In this role you:




Have to understand business requirements in the BI context and design data models to convert raw data to meaningful insights.
Will create dashboards and visual interactive reports using Power BI.
Will identify KPIs with clear objectives and monitor them consistently.
Can analyze data and present it through reports that can help in decision-making.
Are able to convert business requirements into technical specifications and plan a timeline to accomplish tasks.
Will design, develop, and deploy Power BI scripts and perform efficient detailed analysis.
Can perform DAX queries and functions in Power BI.
Will create charts and document data with algorithms, parameters, models, and relations explanations.
Will conduct data warehouse development.
Will perform SQL queying for best results.
Can use filters & graphs for a better understanding of the data.
Will define & design new systems by analyzing current ETL processes,
And make technical changes to existing BI systems in order to enhance their working.




You report to the Global BI Teamlead.




Qualifications




Bachelors‚Äô or Masters‚Äô degree in Computer Science, Business Engineering or a related field.
Between 3 & 7 years‚Äô experience as Power Bi engineer.
Skills in BI tools and BI systems, such as Power BI, SAP, Tableau, etc., creating data-rich dashboards, implementing Row-level Security (RLS) in Power BI, writing DAX expressions, developing custom BI products with scripting and programming languages such as R, Python, etc.
Good experience with BI tools or any data-specific role with a sound knowledge of database management, data modeling, business intelligence, SQL querying, data warehousing, and online analytical processing (OLAP.)
In-depth understanding and experience with Microsoft BI stacks such as Power Pivot, SSIS, SSRS, and SSAS.
The ability to drill down data and visualize it in the best possible way through charts, reports, or dashboards.
Understanding of software development architecture as well as technical aspects.
Skills of ETL/ELT and experience using Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse and/or Data Bricks is a plus.
Knowledge of SAP BW is a plus.
Eager to learn & adapt new technologies.
Service minded team player with good communication skills in Dutch-English or French-English, both written and verbally.




Additional Information




Our offer:




A role with responsibilities and a wide variety of activities;
Ambitious challenges;
A competitive salary with fringe benefits;
Activities that make sense, in building a better world, because every molecule counts.
In an optimistic environment.

Title: BI Consultant Microsoft
Description:
(Belgium or Luxembourg)




As a BI consultant, you'll help clients deal with complex business situations and promote, develop and implement Agilos Solutions and Services. You'll provide the necessary business insights and enable the customer to optimize their operational performance.?




Your challenges




You'll interact with the key stakeholders to clearly define the requirements and be responsible for designing analytical BI applications for clients.




Develop the design for various reporting and dashboarding applications and solutions;
Take an active role in the data modelling process and help optimize data models for BI implementations;
Outline quality processes and creating solutions for data conversion and integration;
Assist clients by providing them with advice on improving their existing data management and delivery solutions;
Work on ways to improve data accuracy and viability by streamlining the data quality and data flow processes used across the enterprise.




Your talents




You have a practical and pragmatic attitude and are able to communicate at different levels. Thanks to your analytical skills, you quickly find solutions. You can work independently, but at the same time also enjoy teamwork.




Bachelor or Master degree in IT
You feel at home in a strongly growing organization
Good communication skills and commercial attitude
Analytical thinking
Knowledge of and experience with dashboarding and visualization products is a must, knowledge of Microsoft is a plus
You have a good knowledge of Dutch/French and English.
