Title: Business Intelligence Analyst in WOLVERTEM
Description:
De job

Jouw taken

Verzamelen van zakelijke en technische vereisten (40% van je tijd)

Je gaat actief in gesprek met de afdelings- en BU-hoofden om hun rapportage- en analysebehoeften te onderzoeken en te documenteren.
Op basis van input van verschillende eindgebruikers zal je de business noden en issues begrijpen om hen te voorzien van relevante rapporten en inzichten.
Je voorziet de Data Engineer en ERP Developers van gedetailleerde technische analyse documenten en geeft eerstelijns advies over data modellering, bron naar DWH inzichten en andere vereisten.
Op dagelijkse basis werk je nauw samen met de Data Engineer om vragen te beantwoorden en ondersteuning te bieden waar nodig.

Power BI ontwikkeling (40% van je tijd)

Op basis van de eerder verzamelde requirements en het datamodel in het datawarehouse stel je Power BI Dashboards en rapporten op.

Project Management (20% van je tijd)

Samen met de Data Engineer geef je status updates over je voortgang aan de Team Lead Business Intelligence.
Je bespreekt werkbare tijdslijnen met de interne stakeholders en managet verwachtingen omtrent project deadlines en oplevering.
Beheren en optimaliseren van de dataplatforms van datastromen, zowel in batch als real time.
Documentatie van oplossingen, configuratie en programmawijzigingen volgens interne standaarden.

Aanbod

Als Business Intelligence Analyst krijg je de kans om vorm te geven aan een interessante en vooruitstrevende datasysteem infrastructuur. De diverse taken, de teamgeest en de zichtbare, praktische realisaties zorgen voor veel jobplezier!

Een voltijdse functie (40 uur/week) met flexibele werkuren.
Wettelijke vakantie- en feestdagen + 12 extra compensatiedagen.
Een aantrekkelijk salaris met tal van voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, netto onkostenvergoeding, bedrijfswagen met tankkaart, ziekteverzekering DKV, groepsverzekering, laptop...
Interessante opleidingen en doorgroeimogelijkheden. - Je bent eigenaar van je toekomst!
Leuke werksfeer en behulpzame collega's!
Plaats van tewerkstelling: 1861 Wolvertem of op een van de andere sites in heel Belgi√´.

Jouw profiel

In dit plaatje pas jij

Wij zijn op zoek naar een Business Intelligence Analyst die graag nieuwe uitdagingen aangaat en bereid is om een stapje extra te zetten met een 'can-do' mentaliteit. Een zelfstandige denker en werker die aan meerdere projecten tegelijk kan werken. Met een oplossingsgerichte instelling en sterke analytische vaardigheden los je problemen op en zoek je naar optimalisaties. Je bent een teamplayer met goede communicatieve vaardigheden (schriftelijk en mondeling). Je hebt een grote passie voor data.

De profielvereisten

Master in economie of wiskunde, of vergelijkbaar
1-3 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie
Learning on the job en actief op zoek naar nieuwe kennis-mentaliteit
Basiskennis Power BI is een pr√©
Sterke excel kennis is een must
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels (mondeling en schriftelijk)

Zo scoor je extra punten

Sector kennis

Het bedrijf

Corebusiness

Onze klant - een sterk uitgegroeide Belgische KMO - is volop in beweging; als creators and explorers innoveren ze continu! De indrukwekkende realisaties, de interessante techniciteit, de leuke werksfeer, de variatie in het takenpakket... maken de job plezant en boeiend op lange termijn! In deze functie als Business Intelligence Analyst maak je deel uit van het Digital transformation team, en samen met je collega's ondersteun je onze interne business stakeholders. Het Business Intelligence team zelf bestaat uit drie functies: Data Engineer Business Intelligence Analist Teamleider Business Intelligence

Grootte

50 - 199 werknemers

Troeven

Internationale speler
Bedrijf in volle groei
Vaste waarde binnen de sector
Verschillende vestigingen
Doorgroeimogelijkheden
Opleidingsprogramma
Werkmateriaal

Jouw contract

Vaste indienstname na interim

Title: Data analist intern
Description:
What we are looking for

Transport & Environment (T&E), the leading Brussels-based NGO promoting cleaner transport in Europe, is offering an internship position for a period of one year, starting in February 2021.




The successful candidate will be working with T&E's Trends and Analysis team, supporting T&E‚Äôs in-house quantitative analysis on Aviation and Shipping.




The successful candidate will have a strong foundation in programming (Python is a plus) and ideally have some knowledge of transport modelling, large data management and visualisation, an interest in environmental conservation and an aptitude for developing policy recommendations that would lead to positive environmental outcomes. Good interpersonal skills are essential as is a good level of English (the working language). Candidates should be able to work autonomously and collaboratively.




Candidates with an engineering or economics background are strongly encouraged to apply, though anyone with relevant skills and interest will be considered.




What will you do

As part of the internship, the successful candidate will undertake one or several specific research projects with the exact scope of the project to be agreed at commencement. The projects would be dependent on the skill set and experience of the person. Some examples of potential projects are:




Analysis of European shipping emissions. This will entail an optimisation of T&E‚Äôs in-house Python program to calculate ship GHG emissions, validation of its outputs against real-world reported emissions and setup of a ship emissions database for T&E‚Äôs advocacy and campaigning work.




Analytic support to our Travel Smart campaign and development of T&E‚Äôs database tracking business travel reduction commitments of companies over the world.




Data collection and research on various work streams of the Aviation and Shipping teams (aviation demand, LNG use in shipping, national data, etc.)




In addition, the selected person would also help with other projects within the team to gain a more fulfilling experience in working in the organisation.




What do we offer

The position is full-time, with a contract running from early February 2023 to early February 2024, although the dates are subject to discussion. The internship is paid according to the Belgian legal framework of ‚ÄúConvention d‚ÄôImmersion Professionnelle‚Äù (remunerated with approximately ‚Ç¨1400 net a month). T&E is an equal opportunities employer.




The deadline for applications is midnight 5th of February, and interviews will take place in the week of 13nd of February.




How to apply

Applications should be sent by email to vacancy@transportenvironment.org with the application form (downloadable below), cover letter and CV, all within one document and in the following order: application form, cover letter and CV. Please name the file as follows: Firstname_Lastname_TAAS2023_intern. Also, please ensure the title of the job vacancy is shown in the subject line of your email.




The cover letter, of one page maximum, and completed application form should explain the motivation and commitment to work with Transport & Environment‚Äôs aims, and also highlight examples from your previous work or studies that show us that you have the skills and competencies outlined above.




Transport & Environment offers great flexibility in work schedule and modality. However, preference will be given to candidates able to come work regularly on site in Brussels.




We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we are only able to contact those who have been shortlisted. Only applicants with the existing right to work within the EU will be considered.

Title: Global Data Engineer
Description:
Job description:

About Umicore

Reducing harmful vehicle emissions. Giving new life to used metals. Powering the cars of the future. As a global materials and technology group, we apply our specialist knowledge to offer materials and solutions that are essential to everyday life. We aim to be a clear world leader in materials for clean mobility and recycling and have turned our sustainability approach into an even greater competitive advantage. With ambitions like this, imagine what you could do?



About Rechargeable Battery Materials

We are all on the move. Umicore‚Äôs Rechargeable Battery Materials (RBM) give people autonomy and connectivity. We are a pioneer in battery materials that give added range and performance to electric vehicles. Our materials also ensure longer battery life for portable electronics. To enable our customers to produce even better performing batteries we cannot stand still. We need to find new ways to do things, discover new solutions and develop new ideas. Which is where you come in.



What you will be doing
Project Involvement as project core team member:
Work in close collaboration with the business project coordinator, the global domain managers, business key users and the RBM Global data steward in the definition of the best conceptual data model
Build best-in-class ETL packages and dimensional models for self-service BI solutions
Define test scenario and perform unit and integration testing
In some cases, act also as project coordinator
Coordinate efforts with external consultants
Act as main contact for IS (BI center of excellence team) during all system implementations
Business Support and going concern role:
Maintain and administer global and local aspects of the ETL solutions
Provide first level support. Ensure that all health checks have been created and are closely supervised
Support the business needs in a timely and efficient manner, tenacity and commitment to quality and excellence
Manage incoming demands on improvements of existing applications: analyze request, organize functional analysis, estimate and plan developments
Participate in the Data Engineer circle and share best practices
Work with other stakeholders to optimize ETL scheduling
Change request initiation and follow-up ‚Äì clear communication between IS and business on business needs & requirements. Provide feedback to business regarding approval (or rejection) of changes
Safeguard process and application know-how
Who we are looking for
An analytical colleague with:
Master‚Äôs degree in applied computer sciences, in information technology sciences, mathematics or economy
A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in the ETL and Datawarehouse domains
Good understanding of self-service BI governance
You can rely on technical knowledge in the following:
Data visualization: Qlik Sense and/or Power BI
Data warehouse: Azure SQL Server, Azure Data Lake
ETL: TimeXtender (optional: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks)
Working experience in a service driven, customer oriented environment.
Knowledge of the ETL/DWH automation/Data preparation tool of choice (TimeXtender for the POCs)
Business Process minded
Good technical knowledge about DB connectivity to access different data sources
Interest in and exposure to industrial activities, processes and technology
What we offer

We aim to lead the way. Not just for our customers, but for our employees too. That is why we strive to create a collaborative environment in which we can all succeed, and a culture through which we can all share ideas, develop our expertise and advance our careers. We engage in building an inclusive work culture that offers equal opportunities for all employees irrespective of their diverse backgrounds. As you would expect from a world-leading organisation, we will also reward your contribution with a competitive salary and benefits. With all this and more, imagine what you could do?



If our battery materials can power electric vehicles, IMAGINE WHAT YOU COULD DO?

¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†

  • Good understanding of self-service BI governance
  • You can rely on technical knowledge in the following:
    • Data visualization: Qlik Sense and/or Power BI
    • Data warehouse: Azure SQL Server, Azure Data Lake
    • ETL: TimeXtender (optional: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks)
  • Working experience in a service driven, customer oriented environment.
  • Knowledge of the ETL/DWH automation/Data preparation tool of choice (TimeXtender for the POCs)
  • Business Process minded
  • Good technical knowledge about DB connectivity to access different data sources
  • Interest in and exposure to industrial activities, processes and technology
What we offer

We aim to lead the way. Not just for our customers, but for our employees too. That is why we strive to create a collaborative environment in which we can all succeed, and a culture through which we can all share ideas, develop our expertise and advance our careers. We engage in building an inclusive work culture that offers equal opportunities for all employees irrespective of their diverse backgrounds. As you would expect from a world-leading organisation, we will also reward your contribution with a competitive salary and benefits. With all this and more, imagine what you could do?

If our battery materials can power electric vehicles, IMAGINE WHAT YOU COULD DO?

Title: Data Warehouse and Reporting Developer
Description:
DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS

The following tasks will be performed:

Development and maintenance of Enterprise Data Warehouses (EDW)
Gathering business requirements
Designing ETL processes
Data modeling
Design and development of reporting applications
Physical DB design
DB performance analysis
Design of Data Quality and Health Monitoring processes
Elaboration of test programs
Writing of technical documentation
Assistance with the deployment and configuration of the system
Participation in meetings with other project teams




LEVEL OF EDUCATION

The minimum educational qualification is the level of education corresponding to Level 6 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a bachelor‚Äôs degree of 3 years.

The following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:

Excellent knowledge of data warehouse design & architecture
Excellent knowledge of relational database systems applied to data warehouse
Excellent knowledge of SQL
Excellent knowledge of business intelligence reporting tools
Good knowledge of ETL tools
Good knowledge of modeling tools
Good knowledge of online analytical data processing (OLAP) and data mining tools

Ability to participate in multilingual meetings
Ability to understand, speak and write French and English
Ability to work in a team
Ability to work with a high degree of rigor and method and, more specifically, to follow naming conventions and coding standards
Ability to work in a multicultural environment, on a large project

Title: Technical Game Designer | AI & Data-Analysis | Remote, Flexible Hours
Description:
Provide technical game design support across CA projects in Age II in different game design related topics. You be involved in the technical development in a variety of different gameplay systems that directly impact player experience.

This will involve:

Developing Age II AI scripts
Data analysis on gameplay
Modelling game mechanics to inform gameplay design decisions
Creative problem solving


AI is an important part of the Age II experience and requires both technical skills and the ability to reflect and balance complex needs from different player groups. The ideal candidate would be a competitive Age II player, but as a minimum you should have a familiarity with competitive Age II and the willingness to engage deeply with this topic. Beyond pure technical understanding it is also important to understand what contributes to a fun and immersive game.

As a company we are committed to providing our team members with a great work environment and the tools necessary to help you succeed. You will therefore be encouraged to think critically about your working environment and provide structured feedback to our engineering and production teams about all aspects of your workflow.

We are working on a beloved franchise with a long history. The ideal candidate would also be an Age II player/fan, but as a minimum you will be willing to play the games you will be working on!

Skills & Experience

Required Technologies

Age II AI Scripting

Excel

Desirable Technologies

R (stats)

SQL

TypeScript

Python

Experience

Previous involvement with AI scripting in Age II

Background in data analysis / balance, ideally in Age II

Ideally have a broader background in both data science and game design

Compensation

As a remote international company, our compensation is determined by considering competitive market rates, experience, and cost of living.

Projects

As our projects are still in early stages, some details are limited but more information will be shared as applicants progress further in the interview process.

About CaptureAge

CaptureAge is a company that grew out of the Age II community and we are now partnered with World's Edge to develop spectating tools and provide game development services in both Age II and Age IV. We are looking for people to join us who share our passion for one or both of these titles.

Hours / Time Management

We have a flexible approach to time-management and we believe in giving team members the opportunity to control their own schedules. We'd like to see a world in which work can fit around your life, not the other way around! In practice this generally means a few pre-agreed sync points a week, with the rest of your working time entirely up to you.

Async Biased

As a company spanning many time zones we naturally tend towards async working arrangements and design our processes and working environment with this in mind.

Consensus Driven

We try to foster a genuinely collaborative and consensus driven approach to work rather than top-down direction and micro-management.

donn√©es est privil√©gi√©e pour stimuler la pr√©dictivit√© des incidents.

Enfin, cette √©quipe assure le reporting et l'analyse des incidents de ponctualit√©.

Taches

Ce volet est donc un r√¥le transversal au sein de l'√©quipe.

  • Service Management ¬ª

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
addData focuses on everything that deals with artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning, specifically in a marketing context. We bring data scientists and engineers with deep technical expertise together with marketeers, growth hackers, and marketing automation experts from our sister companies of the Customer Collective.

Together we bridge the entire value chain: we make sure we create value with intelligent use of customer data: from organizing the data to executing marketing campaigns and measuring incremental revenues.

Our customers want to use data science in their marketing and sales operations, and we support them by all means. Our drive is to create impact with quantitative solutions.




After the onboarding, you will start working on one or more client projects. Our clients have clear ambitions to become heroes in their fields by adapting data science in their marketing and sales.¬†You will be in a hybrid team that consists of other data scientists, data engineers, and marketers. You will also be assigned a Career Advisor, someone from our Leadership team who will closely mentor and coach you during these first years of your career. This role will boost your career, and it will allow you to learn fast and build expertise in the Data Engineering field. You will further develop your consulting skills by running end-to-end processes. You will learn from some of the most engaging experts in the industry and get extensive training on technical matters and soft skills, and project management. Most importantly, you will have an immediate and visible impact on the business.

Over time, you can pursue different career tracks, becoming a data engineering expert, data scientist or project manager, or account manager. Next, you can grow towards more growth hacking or even more towards marketing within our Customer collective group.

¬†




As a Data Engineer, you will design and develop data solutions and be responsible for making them run resiliently in diverse computing environments (Azure / AWS / on prem). You will also have to manage their build and delivery lifecycles (build scripts, deploy scripts, monitor setup).

¬†

We're looking for hands-on thinkers with an open DevOps mindset that can contribute to the design of the IT solution at all levels of granularity and get their hands on the keyboard to get it done, tested, shipped, and running.

¬†

More concretely, you will:

¬†

Design and write data computing components along with their required storage layers
Define the data flows and data requirements to serve our analytic and operational use cases
Operate our data solutions on real user data in production
Provide deep technical support, guidance, and advice to a diverse team of great individuals
Become part of our DataOps practice participating in everyone's growth

¬†

Skills required:

have a EU work permit, willing to live in Belgium
You have experience designing and coding a data processing solution and shipping it to production. Our clients work primarily with MS Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Python, SQL.
As our solutions are data science driven, you have notions of data science and have strong analytical skills.
You are used to work in agile teams and you are a real team player
You are fluent in English and have a solid technical academic background.




¬†

Our Offer

¬†

The opportunity to shape your analytical career and to grow as rapidly as we do. You will get a personal training budget that you may spend however you like, as long as it honors your skills.
On-project coaching by one of our experts.
Challenging and fun projects for the most influential brands and companies out there.
A mixture of working on team projects and individual expert projects. Sometimes your office will be at the client on-site (Antwerp, Brussels, or Ghent in most cases), and other times you will work at home or in the offices in Diegem, Mechelen, Antwerp, or Genk. We will also consider international, full remote candidates.
An extensive salary package, supplemented by a whole series of fringe benefits such as net expense allowances, meal vouchers, mobile phone subscription, etc.
A very nice company car with a fuel card or a flex package if that fits you better.

As a Data Engineer, you will design and develop data solutions and be responsible for making them run resiliently in diverse computing environments (Azure / AWS / on prem). You will also have to manage their build and delivery lifecycles (build scripts, deploy scripts, monitor setup).

 

We're looking for hands-on thinkers with an open DevOps mindset that can contribute to the design of the IT solution at all levels of granularity and get their hands on the keyboard to get it done, tested, shipped, and running.

 

More concretely, you will:

 

  • Design and write data computing components along with their required storage layers
  • Define the data flows and data requirements to serve our analytic and operational use cases
  • Operate our data solutions on real user data in production
  • Provide deep technical support, guidance, and advice to a diverse team of great individuals
  • Become part of our DataOps practice participating in everyone's growth

  • have a EU work permit, willing to live in Belgium
  • You have experience designing and coding a data processing solution and shipping it to production. Our clients work primarily with MS Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Python, SQL.
  • As our solutions are data science driven, you have notions of data science and have strong analytical skills.

Our Offer

 

  • The opportunity to shape your analytical career and to grow as rapidly as we do. You will get a personal training budget that you may spend however you like, as long as it honors your skills.
  • On-project coaching by one of our experts.
  • Challenging and fun projects for the most influential brands and companies out there.
  • A mixture of working on team projects and individual expert projects. Sometimes your office will be at the client on-site (Antwerp, Brussels, or Ghent in most cases), and other times you will work at home or in the offices in Diegem, Mechelen, Antwerp, or Genk. We will also consider international, full remote candidates.
  • An extensive salary package, supplemented by a whole series of fringe benefits such as net expense allowances, meal vouchers, mobile phone subscription, etc.
  • A very nice company car with a fuel card or a flex package if that fits you better.

Title: Data Analyst, Strategic Partnerships( Bangkok based)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Key Areas of Focus:




In this role, you‚Äôll get to:




Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.




Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.




Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.




Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers




Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.




Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.




Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.




What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:‚ÄØ




4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields
Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations
Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areas
Entrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on‚ÄØon‚ÄØthe work
Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment‚ÄØ
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders‚ÄØ




It‚Äôs Great if you have:‚ÄØ




Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn‚ÄØ
Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus

Title: Junior Security Engineer
Description:
(Permanent Position)




Where are you going to work?

1000 Brussels (40%) & Homeworking (60%), hybrid & flexible!




Who are we?

As a division of Fednot, the service unit ICT develops state of the art solutions to help the notaries in their daily activities.




We build solutions, platforms and e-portals, to help the notaries and their employees serve the citizen. We also simplify interactions between notaries, their clients and public services. The automation and administrative simplification of the notaries‚Äô workflow is key to succeeding in this endeavor.




What makes us unique are the notaries‚Äô profession and its legal context that make for constant and complex challenges we face every day. Aspects of data privacy, information integrity and security, make it even more challenging.




Do you have a passion for what you do, do you fully commit, think and act in a flexible way, and want to contribute to the success of our organization ? Then this could be your next step.




We're hiring! Security Engineer (m/w/x), Full-time, Hybrid




The job




As a Security Engineer, you‚Äôre in charge of installing, administering, and troubleshooting security solutions.

You are end-to-end responsible for the daily operation of security systems and can handle things like systems monitoring; setting up, deleting and maintaining user accounts and developing organizational security procedures.




You will be...

Defending systems against unauthorized access
Configuring and supporting security tools
Testing and supporting tool upgrades
Following up the tool evolution
Documenting security awareness/procedures
Providing technical security advice
Analyzing and establishing security requirements, together with our security department
Consulting with staff, managers and executives on best security practices
Collaborating in close cooperation with the Infosec. Team
Aware of market movement in the security domain and follow trends

You have...

A bachelor's (or master's) degree within ICT or equivalent through experience
You have a background in Computer Science and you can look back on a first experience in a similar position
Experience with SDLC, Agile
A keen interest to get deeper knowledge about authentication protocols and providers: SAML, OpenID, Itsme, LDAP, AD
A good knowledge of concepts such as identity and access management, Privileged Access Management
A proficient working level of English
Knowledge of Public Key Infrastructure (a plus)
Knowledge in Trustbuilder (a plus)
Knowledge in Digital Signature: knowledge about signature policies, Eidas (a plus)
Previous experience in network security (a plus)
Security management experience on cloud providers (a plus)




We offer...

Challenging and interesting projects to work on, using the latest methodologies and technologies, within a growing and economically stable sector.
Room for future development, room for employees to develop creativity and autonomy, fostering an open atmosphere.
Competitive salary package, extralegal advantages, insurance coverage, car, bonus and net allowance, public transport, luncheon vouchers, and the possibility to build up holidays.




Where to find us?

We‚Äôre located right in the center of Brussels, next to the Saint Michel & Gudule Cathedral. The Metro Station is right by the corner and the Central Train Station is just two blocks away. We are settled in new offices within the Marquis building.




INTERESTED? Please apply online before February 28th, 2023.

If you apply with us, your CV and motivation letter, which include identification details, details related to the profession and academic curriculum, will be kept in our database for 3 years for reasons of justified interest (e.g. contacting us for a new job). These data will not be exchanged with third parties, unless there is a legal obligation to do so. You can always exercise all rights included in the GDPR in particular, right to access and information, right to data erasure, right to limitation of processing, right to rectification, right to objection and right to lodge a complaint with the supervising authority, by contacting info@privanot.be. We ensure that all your personal data are treated in accordance with the applicable privacy legislation.

You can always exercise all rights included in the GDPR in particular, right to access and information, right to data erasure, right to limitation of processing, right to rectification, right to objection and right to lodge a complaint with the supervising authority, by contacting info@privanot.be. We ensure that all your personal data are treated in accordance with the applicable privacy legislation.

Title: Junior IT System Engineer
Description:
Wat je gaat doen

Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de interne AVA-gebruikers van alle IT-materiaal en -toepassingen, zowel remote als on-site.
Samen met het IT-team sta je in voor de continu√Øteit van de systemen. Dit wil zeggen onderhoud, optimalisatie. Ook bekijk je de bestaande vragen zodat je ondersteuning aan de gebruiker kan verzekeren.
Voor de registratie en de opvolging van alle aanvragen, maak je gebruik van ons ticketingsysteem.
Je helpt de eindgebruikers zo goed mogelijk verder binnen jouw expertise. Voor problemen of nieuwe aanvragen die niet deel uitmaken van jouw kennisgebied, staan jouw andere collega‚Äôs en externe partners klaar voor verdere actie.
Op termijn kan je worden ingeschakeld om interne opleidingen te geven over het ERP-systeem, kassa-oplossingen, office programma‚Äôs,‚Ä¶
Tot slot stel je HOW TO‚Äôs en interne handleidingen op in eenvoudige mensentaal zodat de eindgebruiker zelf een aantal uitdagingen kan oplossen zonder beroep te doen op de helpdesk.




Wat je ervoor krijgt

Een happy job in een Belgisch familiebedrijf met een hart voor hun werknemers.
Ervaring opdoen in een complexe IT-omgeving met moderne technologie√´n,¬†multi-sites en cloudoplossingen.
Ons volle vertrouwen vanaf dag 1.
Een warme en dynamische omgeving met doorgroeikansen.
Een vast voltijds contract.
Tot 32 dagen verlof #worklifebalance.
Topcollega‚Äôs die graag met je samenwerken.
Jobzekerheid. Want AVA blijft maar groeien en dat al meer dan 65 jaar.
Je wordt tewerkgesteld op ons hoofdkantoor in Temse




Wie wij juist zoeken

Je bezit een diploma van een IT-geori√´nteerde opleiding.
Je hebt een gezonde interesse in IT, computers en software toepassingen.
Je hebt kennis van MS Windows , Hyper-V, Office, Netwerk(basis).
Je bent spontaan en een kei in organiseren.
Van multitasken word je blij en stress kan je goed de baas.
Je bent bereid je bij te scholen en je bent flexibel naar werktijden toe.
Je bent goed tweetalig (Nederlands-Frans).
Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs B.

Title: Data Engineer in WOLVERTEM
Description:
De job

Jouw taken

Data warehouse (70% van je tijd)

Beheer van ons data warehouse op basis van Microsoft technologie om het business analyse team en andere business stakeholders te ondersteunen in hun rapporteringsbehoeften die dagelijks gebruikt worden in onze beslissingsprocessen.
Bijdragen aan de data modellering en data architectuur ontwerp & implementatie van ons data warehouse dat data bevat van onze verschillende ERP (D365, SAP, AX2009, Navision) en andere systemen.
Het cre√´ren en onderhouden van alle interfaces, het beheren van de performances, en ervoor zorgen dat alle vereiste beveiliging op zijn plaats is.
Ontwerpen en implementeren van data integratie, data kwaliteit en data conversie.
Ontwerpen van data pipelines voor data ingestion en data transformatie.
Beheren en optimaliseren van de dataplatforms van datastromen, zowel in batch als real time.
Documentatie van oplossingen, configuratie en programmawijzigingen volgens interne standaarden.

Microsoft Azure (30% van je tijd)

Het ondersteunen van de business door het leveren van stabiele, veilige en up-to-date technologie√´n gehost in Microsoft Azure.
Beheren, bouwen en optimaliseren van moderne data architecturen gebaseerd op het Microsoft Azure Platform (Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage, FTP, Integraties...) en ervoor zorgen dat alle vereiste beveiliging op orde is.
Het in de gaten houden van de gerelateerde kosten en het doorvoeren van kostenreducties waar nodig.

Aanbod

Als Data Engineer krijg je de kans om een interessante en vooruitstrevende datasysteem infrastructuur vorm te geven. De diverse taken, de teamspirit en de zichtbare, praktische realisaties zorgen voor veel werkplezier!

Een contract van onbepaalde duur - fulltime functie (40 uur/week) met flexibele werkuren.
Wettelijke vakantie- en feestdagen + 12 extra compensatiedagen.
Een aantrekkelijk salaris met tal van voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, netto onkostenvergoeding, bedrijfswagen met tankkaart, ziekteverzekering DKV, groepsverzekering, laptop...
Interessante opleidingen en doorgroeimogelijkheden. - Je bent eigenaar van je toekomst!
Leuke werksfeer en behulpzame collega's!
Plaats van tewerkstelling: 1861 Wolvertem of op een van onze andere sites in heel Belgi√´.

Jouw profiel

In dit plaatje pas jij

Wij zijn op zoek naar een Data Engineer die graag nieuwe uitdagingen aangaat en met een 'can-do' mentaliteit een stapje extra wil zetten. Een zelfstandige denker en werker die aan meerdere projecten tegelijk kan werken. Met een oplossingsgerichte houding en sterke analytische vaardigheden los je problemen op en zoek je naar optimalisaties. Je bent een teamplayer met goede communicatieve vaardigheden (schriftelijk en mondeling). Je hebt een grote passie voor data.

De profielvereisten

Bachelor in Informatica, IT of vergelijkbaar
2-5 jaar ervaring met SQL servers, Microsoft BI en/of Azure.
Ervaring met het ontwikkelen en implementeren van ETL oplossingen op Premises en/of cloud.
Goed begrip van datamodellering en data-architectuur.
Diepgaande kennis van SQL/T, SQL scripts.
Ervaring met datavisualisatie in PowerBI is een pluspunt.
Databasekennis van SAP, AX2009, Navision en D365 is een pluspunt.
Vloeiend in Engels (mondeling en schriftelijk), Nederlands is een pluspunt

Zo scoor je extra punten

Sector kennis

Het bedrijf

Corebusiness

Onze klant - een sterk uitgegroeide Belgische KMO - is volop in beweging; als creators and explorers innoveren ze continu! De indrukwekkende realisaties, de interessante techniciteit, de leuke werksfeer, de variatie in het takenpakket... maken de job plezant en boeiend op lange termijn! In deze functie als Data Engineer maak je deel uit van het Digital transformation team, en samen met je collega's ondersteun je onze interne business stakeholders. Het Business Intelligence team zelf bestaat uit drie functies: Data Engineer Business Intelligence Analist Teamleider Business Intelligence

Grootte

50 - 199 werknemers

Troeven

Internationale speler
Bedrijf in volle groei
Vaste waarde binnen de sector
Verschillende vestigingen
Doorgroeimogelijkheden
Opleidingsprogramma
Werkmateriaal

Jouw contract

Vaste indienstname na interim

Title: Data Analyst, Partner Development ‚Äì (Statistics/ML/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Get to Know our Team:




Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda‚Äôs accommodation partners and promote Agoda‚Äôs top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.




In this role you‚Äôll get to




As a Data Analyst in the PD Analytics team, you will be using data and modeling techniques to identify opportunities and build models and tools to improve efficiency and effectiveness for Agoda‚Äôs supply team.




Key activities involved include but not limit to:




Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendations
Own end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner Development
Build dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team‚Äôs performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvements
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identified
Support global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization




What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
3-6 years experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy role
Excellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using data
Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills
Coding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)
Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choice
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

Title: Analyst - Brussels
Description:
Analysis Group is one of the largest international economics consulting firms, with more than 1,000 professionals across 14 offices in Europe, North America, and Asia. For over 30 years, we have provided expertise in economics, finance, health care analytics, and strategy to leading law firms, Fortune Global 500 companies, and government agencies worldwide. Our internal experts, together with our network of affiliated experts from academia, industry, and government, offer our clients exceptional breadth and depth of expertise.







We have a broad range of expertise and collaborate with leading academics to offer cutting-edge analyses and analytical tools to address business challenges that require rigorous, evidence-based research. We assist leading law firms in many different litigation contexts, including finance, antitrust, intellectual property and commercial damages. We advise corporate and government clients on a range of business issues that require expert interpretation of economic and financial data, including valuation of companies, and assets, securities and financial instruments and transfer pricing issues, market analyses, and evaluation of mergers and acquisitions.







About the Analyst Position:







As an Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work on complex business problems within a collaborative environment. You will have direct impact on casework in various areas such as competition, merger control, international arbitration, finance, transfer pricing, and intellectual property, in industries including banking, transportation, pharmaceuticals and life sciences, technology, insurance, and agriculture, among others. Analysts in the Brussels office will be part of a local team of diverse background and have the opportunity to collaborate with our other offices in London, Paris, Montreal, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Denver, Los Angeles, Menlo Park, New York, San Francisco, Washington DC and Beijing. Responsibilities and work experiences may include but are not limited to the following:

Analyzing economic, financial, and healthcare data using statistical programming in R, Stata and other programs
Developing data analyses using statistical methods and analytical tools including econometric estimation of models, survival analysis, and machine learning
Creating dynamic visualizations to rapidly explore data and models
Examining market and industry behavior through targeted research
Reviewing and summarizing academic papers, reports and client documents
Participating in meetings with clients, academic experts and case team members
Assisting in the preparation of expert reports and other client deliverables







The scope of the role may change over time due to business needs. Tasks are reviewed from time to time to follow trends and evolutions in the market. Analysis Group fosters a progressive and academically oriented work environment, with an emphasis on teamwork and collaboration across diverse areas of expertise. Specifically, we seek candidates who have:

A master‚Äôs degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, finance, mathematics, physics, epidemiology, or related subjects
Passion for using data and analytics to solve the economic, financial, and business challenges our clients face
Demonstrated analytical, quantitative, and organizational skills
Experience and a strong interest in statistical programming and data analysis
Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills
An excellent academic record
Effectively worked independently and within a team
Excellent attention to detail
A desire to continuously learn and develop professionally
Excellent command of English










The personal data provided during your application are processed by Analysis Group for the purpose of managing candidates for employment, for a period of 4 weeks from the transmission of the application, and then for a period of one year from any refusal.

As such, Analysis Group is likely to inform you for a period of one year of future opportunities that may be of interest to you. The processed data will not be communicated to third parties other than group companies. The processing of your personal data is necessary for the execution of the pre-contractual measures taken at your request, in that Analysis Group cannot process your application without this data.

At any time, you may exercise your rights of access, rectification, deletion, opposition, limitation of processing, as well as your rights to portability and to define the fate of your data by sending a request to the address: humanresources@analysisgroup.com

In the event of a violation of your rights, you can also file a complaint with the Belgian data protection authority.

Title: Power BI Developer

Functie




Het doel van deze opdracht betreft het tijdelijk aanwerven van een ervaren Power BI / SSAS consultant voor de verdere migratie naar Power BI alsook de verdere ontwikkeling van nieuwe modellen en rapporten in Power BI Premium binnen het Data & Analytics team.

Optimalisatie van reeds bestaande modellen met het oog op de beste performantie en gebruik van de beschikbare capaciteit op het platform.

Ondersteuning bieden bij vragen van eindgebruikers.




Functie-eisen




De voorgestelde kandidaat moet ten minste 4 jaar ervaring hebben in implementatieprojecten binnen Power BI en moet volgende technologie√´n/technieken beheersen




Power BI Premium
SSAS Tabular
DAX
T-SQL
SQL Server (2016 e.v.)
Dimensional Modeling
Ervaring met Microsoft Power Platform is een plus
Ervaring met Azure Data Factory is een plus
Ervaring met Synapse Analytics is een plus
Ervaring hebben in:




Vertalen van complexe business vraagstukken naar concrete oplossingen binnen Power BI.
Het raadplegen van gegevens in een Data Warehouse
Algemene governance principes binnen een Power BI platform
Ontwerpen van data marts volgens de Kimball methodologie.
Bouwen van geoptimaliseerde OLAP cubes en het schrijven van DAX
Data Visualisatie

Bij ons word je verloond naar werk, kennis & competenties. Nous vous offrons par ailleurs un package salarial attrayant que vous pouvez constituer en partie selon vos propres besoins, avec en outre de nombreux avantages extral√©gaux tels qu‚Äôune assurance groupe, une assurance hospitalisation, des ch√®ques-repas, un abonnement aux transports en commun, une r√©duction sur les produits bancaires et d‚Äôassurance, etc.

Title: Data Integration Engineer (hybrid/remote) Internal
Description:
This company has 200 IT er‚Äôs to support their financial and risk insurance business. They are part of a global group and have a growing innovative organisation, in which they are seeking for motivated, optimistic people who want to learn and develop their potential. You will join the IT Delivery team that designs, develops and runs all applications for the company. They do this in an ‚ÄòAgile‚Äô manner, thereby working together faster and smarter. In this environment, there is a lot of room for initiatives, and together we can achieve visible results in a challenging context.

As a Data Integration Engineer, you will work in the domain responsible for the maintenance and development of all applications which support the Finance & Risk departments. You will be part of a 25 persons team, all working on implementing the architectural roadmap, with the aim of simplifying the landscape and preparing it for the future.

The Data integration engineer will shape and simplify new and existing data solutions into innovation and meaningful data products. You will work in a newly created team who are clearly focused, enjoy what they do, and where the focus is on ‚Äògetting things done‚Äô.

You will help design, develop and continuously improve the Azure cloud platform in a DevOps, CI/CD and Agile way of working. The aim is to offer ‚Äúautomated data intelligence solutions‚Äù to the business.
You support the onboarding of new data sources into our data solution and make sure they are compliant.
Enable data quality set-up and provide this data via the publishing platform where data users can compile their reports.
This is done with a focus on the continuity, scalability and security of our Azure cloud platform in a cost-effective way.
You support in the pursuit of architectural consistency, security compliance and you apply standard blueprints, industry best practices and Azure native solutions & services.
As developers and analysts, we work closely together in close collaboration with the internal data business teams.
What competencies do you use to make a difference?

You have a passion for technology & data and actively participate in the team to achieve the teams goals. This is done in an agile environment where collaboration and continuous improvement are key.

You have already taken your first steps in data engineering.
Strong knowledge of English, with additional good knowledge of Dutch or French.
Communication in this role is key, both to your teams and to your stakeholders.
Collaboration, taking ownership and a positive drive motivate you.
We greatly appreciate a hands-on approach.
Experience with Azure cloud platform and solutions such as Azure AD, Azure Devops, VNET, Subnet, App service, Network domain routing, Azure IaaS, PaaS and serverless application, ARM templates, Azure CLI and scripting.
Experience with Azure Databricks/Azure Data Factory/Azure Integration Sevices, a plus is Azure Certification(s).

Above all, you want to continue to learn and challenge yourself. We support you in these development opportunities, and you work with (international) colleagues who like to share knowledge.

Title: Power BI Developer
Description:
The purpose of this assignment is to temporarily recruit an experienced Power BI / SSAS consultant for the further migration to Power BI as well as the further development of new models and reports in Power BI Premium within the Data & Analytics team.




The following tasks are the responsibility of the Power BI Developer:




Profile:




4 years of experience in implementation projects within Power BI and must master the following technologies/techniques:




Design and development of optimized Tabular models in Power BI Premium based on the data from the Data & Analytics Platform.
Support of business BI teams in the development of Power BI solutions.
Optimization of existing models with a view to the best performance and use of the available capacity on the platform.




Close collaboration with business teams to translate the functional and technical requirements and provide expertise where necessary.
Following best practices in a development lifecycle
Further developing a governance model and applying and applying it to the various business BI teams.
Develop data mart based OLAP cubes.
Writing optimized DAX.
Writing technical and user documentation.
Provide support for end user queries.
Power BI Premium
SSAS Tabular
T SQL
SQL Server (2016 onwards)
Dimensional Modelling
Translate complex business issues into concrete solutions within Power BI.
Consulting data in a Data Warehouse
Designing data marts according to the Kimball methodology.
Building optimized OLAP cubes and writing DAX
Data Visualization




DAX Level Intermediate Most recent experience This year

Microsoft Power Platform Level Beginner Most recent experience Any time

Power BI Level Intermediate Most recent experience This year

SQL Level Intermediate Most recent experience This year

SQL Server Level Beginner Most recent experience Any time

SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) Level Intermediate Most recent experience This year

languages




Dutch or French Level Native or bilingual proficiency

English Level Professional working proficiency

locations




Main address rue belliard, 25 - 1000 Bruxelles

Hybrid/Remote option

Title: Data engineer
Description:
Werken bij Korian, dat doe je met een groot hart!

Werken bij Korian betekent veel meer dan werken in de zorg. Bij Korian draag je dagelijks je steentje bij aan het welbevinden en de levenskwaliteit van ouderen en kwetsbare mensen, waar je ook werkt: in √©√©n van onze woonzorgcentra, in de thuiszorg, of op het hoofdkantoor.




‚ÄòIn Caring Hands‚Äô is het hart van onze organisatie, de missie van ons allen, waar ieder van ons zich dag in en dag uit voor inzet. ‚ÄòIn Caring Hands‚Äô geldt niet alleen voor onze bewoners of cli√´nten. Bij Korian dragen we graag ‚Äòzorg voor hen die zorg dragen‚Äô. Het welbevinden van onze medewerkers staat voorop. Gelukkige medewerkers zorgen voor gelukkige bewoners en cli√´nten. En dat is tenslotte waar het om draait!




Functieomschrijving




Bij Korian werken we het liefst data-gedreven aan innovaties. Ook vinden we het belangrijk dat alle data goed beschikbaar is zodat onze collega‚Äôs de beste inzichten krijgen. De verantwoordelijkheid van ‚Äòjouw‚Äô team is dan ook om de data logisch weer te geven.




Als Data Engineer speel je een sleutelrol in het structureren en verwerken van al onze data. Daarnaast voer je analyses uit om tot strategische inzichten te komen en onze business te helpen met deze informatie. Deze tweedeling maakt je werk uitdagend en gevarieerd.




Het Data & Analytics team is een technisch team op een waardevolle plek binnen de organisatie. Je staat goed in contact met de business teams van Korian Benelux, en zult hier een verbindende rol spelen door op een voor iedereen begrijpelijke manier met data onderwerpen aan de slag te gaan.

Hierin krijg je een zelfstandige functie met veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief, en een plek waar je jezelf volop kunt ontwikkelen. En niet onbelangrijk; de waardering voor jouw werk is hier sky-high.




Een aantal concrete voorbeelden uit jouw takenpakket:

Het bouwen aan- en onderhouden van het Enterprise data platform: binnenhalen, transformeren, structureren;
Inzichten verkrijgen uit grote hoeveelheden data;
Verkregen data omzetten tot begrijpelijke informatie samen met de BI specialist en data analist;
Je gaat aan de slag met data modelleringen;
Schakelen met de business teams binnen Korian om hen te voorzien van de juiste informatie;
Het bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling van onze data strategie

De snelle groei in de Data & Analytics afdeling van Korian betekent dat de organisatie verder ontwikkeld moet worden. Dit brengt veel kansen, zoals dat je bijvoorbeeld een sterkte invloed hebt op de data strategie en werkwijzen, maar dit betekent ook dat er nog geen strak plan klaarligt van waaruit jij uit de startblokken kunt.




Profiel




Dit is wel iets voor jou wanneer‚Ä¶

je houdt van pionieren
je ziet mogelijkheden in het ontwikkelen van een Data & Analytics organisatie
je graag aan de slag gaat met het maken van data pipelines en datasets
je het niet erg vindt wanneer de regels nog niet vastliggen; deze kun je dan zelf immers mee bepalen.

Dit is niet iets voor jou wanneer je‚Ä¶

liever landt in een strak georganiseerd team
niet van koerswijzigingen houdt

Jij bent succesvol binnen Korian wanneer je als teamplayer zelfstandig en proactief te werk gaat. Dit zal betekenen dat je jezelf soms terugtrekt om aan complexe analyses te werken, en soms met interne stakeholders op zoek gaat naar technische oplossingen.

Je bent enthousiast om jouw ervaring en passie voor data in te zetten om het Data & Analytics team van Korian verder te ontwikkelen.




Hiervoor vragen we het volgende:

Een passie voor data
Bachelor of master ICT, toegepaste wiskunde, ingenieur ICT of gelijkwaardig
Je hebt kennis van data modellering (ERD modellen, conceptuele datamodellen)
Je hebt bewezen ervaring in MS Azure, Synapse, Data factory, MSSQL
Je werkt nauwgezet en gestructureerd, en documenteert je werk zorgvuldig
Je hebt al een eerste werkervaring in de data wereld achter de rug
Je hebt een goede kennis van Nederlands en Frans en je spreekt ook wel een aardig mondje Engels
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden







Wij bieden




Bij Korian willen we niet zomaar een werkgever zijn. Het is ons engagement om het beste in onze mensen naar boven te brengen.




Hoe we dat doen?

Je maakt onderdeel uit van een enthousiast en betrokken team binnen een snelgroeiende, gezonde internationale beursgenoteerde organisatie.
We vinden de ontwikkeling van onze medewerkers belangrijk en investeren daarom in een opleidingstraject op maat. Hieronder vallen data-specifieke trainingen, aangeboden door de Korian Groep.
Verder bieden we de mogelijkheid tot flexibel werken, bijvoorbeeld vanuit onze hoofdkantoren, locaties of vanuit thuis.
En last but not least, voor deze job is er een marktconform salaris aangevuld met extra legale voordelen, waaronder een laptop, telefoonvergoeding, ecocheques en een groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques, bedrijfswagen met tankkaart.

Voorziene startdatum: Januari 2023




We moedigen alle mensen aan om hun kandidatuur in te dienen ongeacht hun afkomst, huidskleur, geslacht, leeftijd, seksuele geaardheid, filosofische overtuiging, handicap, ...




Indien je aangepaste accommodatie nodig hebt, wat jouw handicap ook is, voor de selectiefase voor deze functie of daarna, aarzel dan niet om contact met ons op te nemen.

Title: Data Warehouse and Reporting Developer
Description:
Job Responsibilities

Definition and recommend improvement on solution design for datawarehouse solution
Preparation of technical specification for ETL, data modelling for the datawarehouse
Management of maintenance on the datawarehouse and ETL data flows developed
Development and maintenance of Datawarehouse, ETL jobs and data flows
Coordination and review of the task assigned in a good team spirit
Reporting of progress and activities ongoing to support a good project management
Assistance with Reporting and data scientist in the team
Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers
Gathering business requirements
Design of Data Quality and Health Monitoring processes
DB performance analysis
Elaboration of test programs.
Writing of technical documentation.
Assistance with deployment and configuration of the system.

Job Requirements (mandatory)

Very good knowledge of on ETL tooling and methodology, with good knowledge on Clouds and market offer. Here some main technology of interest: Azure, Synapse, Denodo, KNIME
Very good knowledge of in Database management/Datawarehouse: Oracle 11g/12c, MySQL, SQL server, PostgreSQL & PostGIS. With a good knowledge on Clouds Datawarehouse solution: Azure, AWS.
Sufficient knowledge of Business Intelligence tooling to understand the overall BI process. The main tools adopted is so far Power BI
Ability to handle development in one or more programming languages efficiently such as JAVA, CSS, XML/HTML, PERL/DBI/SVG and Python, Scala.
Ability to give business and technical presentations
Ability to apply high quality standards
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used and to
Very good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences
Analysis and problem-solving skills
Capability to write clear and structured technical documents
Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills

Job Requirements (preferable)

Knowledge of Data modelling and Data Architecture and tools like EA Sparks and Oracle Designer tools.
Knowledge of Microsoft Platform 365 Power apps, Power Automation
Knowledge of GIS systems to map indicators FME
Knowledge of Project management tools as JIRA.

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects
The consultant has to be fluent in English or French, with a minimum B2 level in the other language
High degree of discretion and integrity is required

HTML:
Job Responsibilities

  • Definition and recommend improvement on solution design for datawarehouse solution
  • Preparation of technical specification for ETL, data modelling for the datawarehouse
  • Management of maintenance on the datawarehouse and ETL data flows developed
  • Development and maintenance of Datawarehouse, ETL jobs and data flows
  • Coordination and review of the task assigned in a good team spirit
  • Reporting of progress and activities ongoing to support a good project management
  • Assistance with Reporting and data scientist in the team
  • Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers
  • Gathering business requirements
  • Design of Data Quality and Health Monitoring processes
  • DB performance analysis
  • Elaboration of test programs.
  • Writing of technical documentation.
  • Assistance with deployment and configuration of the system.

Job Requirements (mandatory)

  • Very good knowledge of on ETL tooling and methodology, with good knowledge on Clouds and market offer. Here some main technology of interest: Azure, Synapse, Denodo, KNIME
  • Very good knowledge of in Database management/Datawarehouse: Oracle 11g/12c, MySQL, SQL server, PostgreSQL & PostGIS. With a good knowledge on Clouds Datawarehouse solution: Azure, AWS.
  • Sufficient knowledge of Business Intelligence tooling to understand the overall BI process. The main tools adopted is so far Power BI
  • Ability to handle development in one or more programming languages efficiently such as JAVA, CSS, XML/HTML, PERL/DBI/SVG and Python, Scala.
  • Ability to give business and technical presentations
  • Ability to apply high quality standards
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used and to
  • Very good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences
  • Analysis and problem-solving skills
  • Capability to write clear and structured technical documents
  • Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills

Job Requirements (preferable)

  • Knowledge of Data modelling and Data Architecture and tools like EA Sparks and Oracle Designer tools.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Platform 365 Power apps, Power Automation
  • Knowledge of GIS systems to map indicators FME
  • Knowledge of Project management tools as JIRA.

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

  • Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team
  • Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects
  • The consultant has to be fluent in English or French, with a minimum B2 level in the other language
  • High degree of discretion and integrity is required

Title: Expert in AI/NLP/ML
Description:
The Client, in partnership with other Commission services and stakeholders, provides high-qualitycorporate solutions/information systems for the Research and Innovation Family, enabling the successful implementation of the Commission's Digital Transformation and EU policies. In close collaboration with other Commission services and its customers, the Client builds and operates solutions in the areas of grants, experts, and procurement management. The IT department of the CIC, eGrants and CORTEX teams request the services of one Expert in AI/NLP/ML, to cover the activities described in the following job description. The solution assignment may change over time, according to the portfolio/project/service needs.

DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS

The following tasks will be performed:

Architect, set up, and manage an MLOps infrastructure
Manage the lifecycle of ML models, including version control, build automation, CI, testing, monitoring, automation, disaster recovery
Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data when the case
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques when the case
Studies and developments aiming at improving the quality of machine translation (MT) engines for each installed language pair
Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality and integrity
Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of their performance
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
Design the IT architecture for solutions in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts
Analyse data architecture for consistency, completeness, accuracy, and reasonableness
Provision of security studies, security assessments, or other security matters associated with information system projects
Contributing to the analysis of data management vision, strategy, and policy and deriving the IT requirements
Contributing to the design of the IT architecture considering master- and meta-data management concepts




LEVEL OF EDUCATION

The minimum educational qualification is the level of education corresponding to Level 7 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a master‚Äôs degree of 5 years.




KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

The following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above-listed tasks:

Good knowledge of managing an MLOps / Big Data infrastructure
Experience with managing the full lifecycle of ML models
Good knowledge of application containerization, virtualization, orchestration
Good knowledge of TensorFlow (TFX), PyTorch, Kubeflow, or equivalents
Good knowledge of AWS and/or Azure
Good knowledge of Unix and Bash
Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies
Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies, and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality
Knowledge of query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc, and with information extraction
Knowledge of NoSQL databases
Experience in the field of corpus-based linguistics
Experience with alignment models and classification methods
Experience with data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes
Very good knowledge of cloud solutions for data warehouse, datalake and business intelligence solutions
Ability to give business and technical presentations
Ability to apply high-quality standards
Ability to cope with fast-changing technologies
Very good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences
Analysis and problem-solving skills
Capability to write clear and structured technical documents
Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills




Due to the particular nature of a large international organization such as the European Commission, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

The capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability, and experience in working in a team
Ability to participate in multilingual meetings
Ability to work in a multicultural environment, on multiple large projects
Excellent Team Player
The ability to understand, speak and write English C1 and French CI will be an advantage
A high degree of discretion and integrity is required as the applications managed and maintained contain personal and confidential data

Level 9

Deadline: 02/02/2023

Title: SAS Developer
Description:
Trasys International offers IT Consulting jobs at European Institutions and International Organizations.




We are looking for a SAS Developer with the following skills on the belt:




Strong knowledge of SAS programming language/SAS Macro programming skills
Able to develop from scratch a new SAS program and maintain existing ones
Good knowledge of SAS Enterprise Guide (at least 8.3)
Familiar with SAS management console
Strong expertise with SQL
Familiar with Oracle Database
Familiar with operation system like UNIX/Linux Commands
Good understanding of Business requirements
Very good level of English

Main responsibilities:




Create and maintain SAS programs
Run ETL process via SAS
Create Test cases and perform Testing activities
Elaborate documentation for SAS components




Nationality and Security Clearance

As a Personal Security Clearance of level "EU SECRET/SECRET EU" might be requested for this profile, only candidates with a valid EU citizenship will be taken into consideration.




About us

We are TRASYS International, NRB Group, an ICT company with over 30 years of a successful track record working with European Institutions and Agencies, offering IT consulting, solutions, and services.




Our Mission is to help our clients keep up with the challenges of digital transformation by providing the right talent at the right time for the right job. To this end, we are constantly looking for talented professionals who are interested in working on challenging international projects and able to deliver high-quality results within multicultural environments.




Our services include (but are not limited to) modernization solutions, digital workspaces, cloud technologies, and IT security. Our Headquarters are in Brussels and we have active accounts and offices across Europe (i.e. Luxembourg, Amsterdam, Athens, Stockholm, Geneva).

Title: Data collection and data management Engineer
Description:
Are you a data and code wizard looking for a new challenge? Look no further! Zensor, a startup that's shaking things up in the tech industry, is seeking a data collection nad data management engineer with at least 3 years of experience to join our team of not-so-ordinary monitoring specialists.

¬†

In this role at Zensor, you'll be responsible for both making sure that we can collect all the data required from sensors and existing data sources as well as for assisting in designing, developing, and maintaining the company's backend systems and infrastructure. We're looking for someone with experience in Python, while expertise in InfluxDB is certainly a big plus. Bonus points if you're familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.

¬†

Key responsibilities include:

-Setting up and configuring systems to collect data, including PLCs (aka, mining for magic dust)

-Designing, implementing, and maintaining the backend systems and infrastructure (aka, making magic happen)

-Optimizing our database systems, specifically InfluxDB (aka, making more magic happen)

-Collaborating with other teams to ensure seamless integration of the backend systems (aka, making even more magic happen)

-Providing technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members (aka, spreading the magic)

¬†

The ideal candidate will have:

-2+ years of experience in PLC programming or other edge devices (aka, experience collecting magic dust)

-2+ years of experience in backend development (aka, experience making magic)

-Strong experience with a variety of programming languages, specifically Python and C++. (aka, fluent in the language of magic)

-Expertise in InfluxDB and experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (aka, master of the magic of data)

-Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for technology (aka, always looking for new ways to make magic)

¬†

At Zensor, we're all about creating innovative products and services that truly change the way people in traditional industries interact with the machines they operate in their daily lives. So, if you're ready to join a team of like-minded individuals who are passionate about making a difference in the manufacturing industry, apply now and let's make some magic together!"

Title: BI Engineer
Description:
Job Summary

Work as a BI engineer in a dynamic environment and provide visualization

Key Responsibilities

Assess requirements for completeness and accuracy. Determine if requirements are actionable for team.
Conduct impact assessment and determine size of effort based on requirements
Extensive experience in development and support on Qlik, Oracle SQL, PL/SQL, Unix scripting.
Facilitate information gathering sessions and provide data analysis and data mapping.
Identify data sources, develop and maintain data architectures, constructs data catalog and data decomposition diagrams, provide data flow diagrams and documents the process.
Strong SQL knowledge and ability to write and investigate complex queries.
Develop solution in highly demanding environment and provide hands on guidance to other team members.

Essential Skills

As we work in an international environment, we expect you to be fluent in English, both written and spoken.
You need to have a curious mindset, a willingness to understand and not be afraid to dive into new matter.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and have experience in designing, developing and implementing integration solutions
You are able to cross train and explain complex scenarios to non IT team members

Nice To Have Skills

BI certification

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : Feb 03 2023

About Cognizant

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.
