Job ID: R-710295
Show more Show less
HTML:
Data Analyst/ SQL Developer, Alpha Operations


Why this role is important to us


The Alpha Operations team provides Alpha clients with investment, financial, and regulatory reports enabling our clients to make informed, data-driven decisions. The team ensures that the data is delivered to the client in an accurate, complete, and timely manner.


The Data Analyst/ SQL Developer will interact with clients and internal State Street parties to identify the best data validation solutions for the client. The role involves supporting multiple client relationships and client deliverables globally.


What You Will Be Responsible For


  • Perform daily checks on inbound and outbound data delivery
  • Develop and maintain data validation and reporting tools
  • Create SQL-based data validation checks on source and target data to confirm data has correct and expected values
  • Work independently and collaboratively to identify issues, perform root-cause analysis that would lead to proper and timely issue resolutions
  • Escalate data and technical related issues to proper teams and track until complete resolution
  • Contribute to data validation and system enhancement testing efforts
  • Ensure all activities are compliant with corporate standards
  • Communicate clearly and effectively with internal and external parties
  • Adhere to internal procedures and best practices at all times


What You Will Be Responsible For


  • Degree in computer science, finance, accounting, business, or technology and relevant industry experience
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong Technical skills in data management including SQL
  • Database Management and ETL development experience
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS/ Azure)
  • Strong communication skills
  • Self-motivated and adaptable and show initiative and a strong sense of task ownership
  • Flexibility and willingness to learn and work on new areas of expertise
  • Asset management experience, including investment operation
  • Flexible working hours may be required


About State Street


What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we‚Äôre making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we‚Äôve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.


Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You‚Äôll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.


Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees‚Äô diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.


State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.


Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers


Salary Range


$52,000 - $78,520 Annual


The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.


Job ID: R-710295

Title: Data and Resources Analyst
Description:
Data and Resources Analyst - ( 22000FBD )




Description




The Chelsea Soldiers‚Äô Home is seeking a self-motivated and highly organized individual to serve as a Data and Resources Analyst. The selected candidate will review and analyze data, confer with agency staff to identify needs and potential problems within the assigned department, and conduct special studies, projects, and reports. Other responsibilities include (but are not limited to): determining the methods to be used in report analysis and preparation; recommending changes in departmental methods, operations, and procedures; compiling information for database training and management usage; analyzing, assessing, and supporting software needs, as well as developing system job aids.




Duties and Responsibilities (these duties are a general summary and not all inclusive):




Performs data analysis and review, with the goal of devising methods that result in more effective and efficient operations.
Recommends modifications in departmental operations in response to changes in agency objectives, regulations, procedures, or policies.
Evaluates and compares data in order to provide information to management for making sound conclusions to solve problems, to plan course of action, and to formulate and define policies and procedures.
Assists Project Manager in department activities and assignments for special projects, database implementation, training and support as needed.
Determines the methods to be used in conducting studies/special project report preparation; designs forms and instruments to be used in collecting information; and evaluates results to ensure the validity, reliability, and integrity of data.
Compiles information for management use from automated records, reports and other sources, and disseminates this information in the form of reports, manuals, charts, graphs, tables etc.; defines each project purpose, scope and methodology
Attends (chair as needed) periodic ‚ÄúTrain the Trainer‚Äù (TTT) meetings for informational exchange of ideas and problem solving addressing ongoing training needs.
Serves as backup Subject Matter Expert (SME) to department databases (re: EMR database) to reconcile and review all residents and patients‚Äô files, including attachments (i.e. DD214s, photographs, etc.).
Participate in other duties as assigned.




Schedule




This is a full-time (37.5 hours/week) position working Monday through Friday with exact daytime hours to be determined before time of hire by the Hiring Manager
Note: This is 24 hour/7 days a week facility. The Chelsea Soldiers' Home may require this individual to be present during nontraditional hours when circumstances dictate the operational need.




Required Qualifications




Adept at analyzing and determining the applicability of data to draw conclusions and make appropriate recommendations.
Knowledge of the principles and practices of management science, including problem solving and decision-making, forecasting and planning, and work simplification methods.
Familiarity with general report writing and preparation.
Ability to understand, explain and apply the laws, rules, regulations, policies, procedures, specifications, standards, and guidelines governing assigned activities.
Working independently to achieve objectives where few precedents or guidelines are available.
Accurate information gathering via document/record examination and questioning individuals.
Adaptability to varying work situations to meet changing departmental requirements or a crisis/emergency.
Exercising sound judgment, communicate effectively, and give/follow oral and written instruction in a precise, understandable manner.
Discreet handling of confidential information.
Controlling workflow through periodic reviews and/or evaluations; determining training needs and providing or arranging for such training.
Highly Proficient usage of all Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, Outlook, SharePoint, and OneDrive, as well as other software required to develop and prepare reports and studies.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience working within a HealthCare setting or Long-Term Care (LTC) facility.
Understanding of Medicare/Insurance Billing, i.e., reporting, ICD codes, etc.
Project Management experience and/or certification
Proficiency with various HealthCare or Electronic Medical Record (EMR) software products




About The Soldiers‚Äô Home In Chelsea




The Chelsea Soldiers' Home is a state-funded, fully accredited health care facility that offers veterans quality health care, including full-time residential accommodations, and provides educational and social services for Veterans in the Commonwealth. The Soldiers‚Äô Home is staffed by approximately 330+ administrators, clinicians, nurses, certified nursing assistants, skilled trade, dietary staff, housekeeping staff, contractors, consultants, and general administrative personnel. The Home addresses the needs of a wide variety of veterans, including 24/7 care and treatment for terminal illness to the provision of residential, social, and educational services. Comprehensive inpatient and outpatient medical services are provided to these veterans in need. The patient population is generally categorized into the following categories: Alzheimer/Long Term Care; Domiciliary (residential). The tradition of service to the veterans of Massachusetts is surpassed only by a continued commitment to excellence in care for those who are in need now and in the future. Our mission is to provide ‚ÄúCare with Dignity, Honor, and Respect‚Äù to our Veterans. Learn more about our important work: http://www.mass.gov/che




Comprehensive Benefits




When you embark on a career with the Commonwealth, you are offered an outstanding suite of employee benefits that add to the overall value of your compensation package. We take pride in providing a work experience that supports you, your loved ones, and your future. Want the specifics? Explore our Employee Benefits and Rewards!




Pre-Hire Process




A criminal background check will be completed on the recommended candidate as required by the regulations set forth by the Executive Office of Health and Human Services prior to the candidate being hired. For more information, please visit http://www.mass.gov/hhs/cori




Education, licensure and certifications will be verified in accordance with the Human Resources Division‚Äôs Hiring Guidelines.




Education and license/certification information provided by the selected candidate(s) is subject to the Massachusetts Public Records Law and may be published on the Commonwealth‚Äôs website.




If you require assistance with the application/interview process and would like to request an ADA accommodation, please click on the link and complete the Reasonable Accommodation Online Request Form




For questions, please the contact the Office of Human Resources at 1-800-510-4122 and select option #2.




Applicants should upload a cover letter and resume for the Data and Resources Analyst position.




Qualifications




First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.




Minimum Entrance Requirements




Applicants must have at least (A) four years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in work simplification, management analysis, program analysis, methods analysis, economic analysis, fiscal analysis, financial analysis, budget analysis, program administration, or program management or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.




SUBSTITUTIONS




I. A Bachelor's degree with a major in business administration, business management, public administration, industrial engineering or industrial management may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required experience.*




II. A Graduate degree with a major in business administration, budget management, public administration, industrial engineering or industrial management may be substituted for a maximum of three years of the required experience. *




III. A Bachelor's degree or higher degree with a major other than in business administration, business management, public administration, industrial engineering, or industrial management may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required experience. *




Education toward such a degree will be prorated based on the proportion of the requirements actually completed.




NOTE: Educational substitutions will be permitted for a maximum of three years of the required experience.




Comprehensive Benefits




When you embark on a career with the Commonwealth, you are offered an outstanding suite of employee benefits that add to the overall value of your compensation package. We take pride in providing a work experience that supports you, your loved ones, and your future. Want the specifics ? Explore our Employee Benefits and Rewards!




Executive Order #595: As a condition of employment, successful applicants will be required to have received COVID-19 vaccination or an approved exemption as of their start date. Details relating to demonstrating compliance with this requirement will be provided to applicants selected for employment. Applicants who receive an offer of employment who can provide documentation that the vaccine is medically contraindicated or who object to vaccination due to a sincerely held religious belief may make a request for exemption.




An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.




T he Commonwealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Research suggests that qualified women, Black, Indigenous, and Persons of Color (BIPOC) may self-select out of opportunities if they don't meet 100% of the job requirements. We encourage individuals who believe they have the skills necessary to thrive to apply for this role.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Provides actionable insights to business operations through data modeling and analysis to streamline decision-making, strategy creation, and tactical execution. Works directly with internal customers to understand the business environment and needs. Design, develop, and produce statistical and other analytic reports.




Applies analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, using advanced statistical techniques. Perform rigorous model evaluation, design hypothesis tests, oversee test execution and result evaluation.




Develop actionable analytics and communicate insights via visualizations and dashboards (infographics, dashboards, custom reports, and recurring reports.




Model, predict, and classify consumer behavior and business metrics.




Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Provide recommendations for growth, cost reduction and optimization of operational performance. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made.




Translate complex analysis into actionable intelligence and recommendations to executives.




Support targeted business activities, including opportunities for product and process improvement with a focus on driving significant business growth.




Perform and manage all the steps required for analyses including requirements gathering, methodology development, data pulling, data processing, analysis, insight formulation and results delivery.




Serves as the subject matter expert for strategic data analysis, identifies insights and implications as well as make strategic recommendations.




Provides direct or indirect leadership to team members through coaching, mentoring, and review of work.




Other duties may be assigned.




Education/Licenses/ Certifications




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field, like Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing Research, or other similar fields; or 6-8 years of additional relevant experience




Experience




4+ years hands on modeling experience with Python/R/SQL and experience building attribution models




Experience leveraging test & learn techniques to evaluate business opportunities




Experience extracting data from large/complex databases using SQL




Skills & Abilities




Experience using PowerBI or other data BI/visualization tools




Think, Act & Be Safe.




Encourage, build, and maintain mutual trust, respect, and cooperation with others.




Ability to listen to, understand, and communicate with others by telephone, in written form, electronically, or in person.




Ability to apply sound judgement to produce appropriate outcomes to a variety of situations, including high volume and challenging situations.




Ability to analyze, model, and interpret data.




Ability to utilize data visualization tools proficiently.




Ability to present data to stakeholders.




Basic understanding of programming languages such as SQL, Python, etc.




Ability to add, subtract, multiply, or divide quickly and accurately.




Ability to operate a computer with relevant software applications.




Advanced Microsoft Excel skills including pivot tables, macros and v-lookup.




Ability to maintain confidentiality.




Ability to prioritize, organize, and accomplish work to achieve specific goals.




Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.




Ability to determine how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.




Ability to adjust actions in relation to others' actions.




Ability to monitor/assess performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.




Ability to operate a computer/mobile device with relevant software applications.




The pay range for this position in Rhode Island is $75,000 - $92,625. Base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Annual bonuses are some of the additional forms of compensation offered. Additionally, employees may participate in our award winning medical, dental, vision, wellness, financial (6% 401k match), and a wide array of other employee and membership benefits.

Title: Data Analyst, Data Management
Description:
30671-2

Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.

This Is What You Will Do

Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease Unit is looking to build the next generation of patient centric data analytic and application platforms. We are looking for a qualified individual whose passion is understanding how to best utilize healthcare data and platforms to drive business innovation!

This role is responsible for leading the effort on building and maintaining data management solutions with a focus on data quality and security capabilities and ensuring that the data used by the organization is accurate, consistent, and complete.

You Will Be Responsible For

Working with multi-functional leadership, IT Data Management and Architecture team to implement data management solutions
Support business in preparing SOP/Standard methodologies to improve and maintain data quality, privacy & security
Helping to shape the creation, testing, and refinement of ongoing business requirements and translate them into technical requirements for developers
Support Master and Reference Data teams in FAIR data concepts
Support data quality assurance/production performance metrics
Managing and working with internal customers, external customers, and vendors to ensure timely resolution of data issues and problems
Suggesting and participating in projects, offering skills and insights to bring value to the organization by leveraging approved technologies, platforms, and reporting infrastructure
Evaluating system performance and design, as well as its effect on data quality
Performing Ad-hoc data inquiry/request for leadership team

You Will Need To Have

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and a minimum of 3+ years of hands-on, mixed experience in managing data management projects around data quality, data analysis and BI technology and process excellence
Candidate must have technical experience in database structures, query languages, structured programming languages, and the ability to query large datasets using ANSI SQL/HIVE SQL and working with relational databases, analysis in R/Python
Proven experience of leading and working on data flow designs analysis and visualization
Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex methods and results to diverse audiences including leadership team.
Prior experience with BI tools and optimization techniques. Experience in Qlik Sense is plus

We Would Prefer For You To Have

Knowledge of Big Data Technologies like Hive, Spark, Scala, and HDFS and use of data and these technologies along with statistical tools like Python/R, etc.
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Qlik Sense, Power BI, Excel charts/reports
Working knowledge of the Salesforce CRM, data governance
Prior Experience in Pharmaceuticals or Healthcare industry and/or a Master‚Äôs in Computer Science

Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion has taken critical steps to protect colleagues, loved ones, and patients from COVID-19 and its variants. All US-based employees must comply with Alexion's COVID-19 vaccination mandate. Alexion provides exceptions based on applicable state law as well as reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding a legally required exemption or accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

As a leading employer in our industry, Alexion offers a highly competitive package of base and incentive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the health, wellness and financial security of our employees and their families. Benefits include group medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, and much more.

AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

HTML:
30671-2

Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.

This Is What You Will Do

Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease Unit is looking to build the next generation of patient centric data analytic and application platforms. We are looking for a qualified individual whose passion is understanding how to best utilize healthcare data and platforms to drive business innovation!

This role is responsible for leading the effort on building and maintaining data management solutions with a focus on data quality and security capabilities and ensuring that the data used by the organization is accurate, consistent, and complete.

You Will Be Responsible For
  • Working with multi-functional leadership, IT Data Management and Architecture team to implement data management solutions
  • Support business in preparing SOP/Standard methodologies to improve and maintain data quality, privacy & security
  • Helping to shape the creation, testing, and refinement of ongoing business requirements and translate them into technical requirements for developers
  • Support Master and Reference Data teams in FAIR data concepts
  • Support data quality assurance/production performance metrics
  • Managing and working with internal customers, external customers, and vendors to ensure timely resolution of data issues and problems
  • Suggesting and participating in projects, offering skills and insights to bring value to the organization by leveraging approved technologies, platforms, and reporting infrastructure
  • Evaluating system performance and design, as well as its effect on data quality
  • Performing Ad-hoc data inquiry/request for leadership team
You Will Need To Have
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and a minimum of 3+ years of hands-on, mixed experience in managing data management projects around data quality, data analysis and BI technology and process excellence
  • Candidate must have technical experience in database structures, query languages, structured programming languages, and the ability to query large datasets using ANSI SQL/HIVE SQL and working with relational databases, analysis in R/Python
  • Proven experience of leading and working on data flow designs analysis and visualization
  • Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex methods and results to diverse audiences including leadership team.
  • Prior experience with BI tools and optimization techniques. Experience in Qlik Sense is plus
We Would Prefer For You To Have
  • Knowledge of Big Data Technologies like Hive, Spark, Scala, and HDFS and use of data and these technologies along with statistical tools like Python/R, etc.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools like Qlik Sense, Power BI, Excel charts/reports
  • Working knowledge of the Salesforce CRM, data governance
  • Prior Experience in Pharmaceuticals or Healthcare industry and/or a Master‚Äôs in Computer Science
Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion has taken critical steps to protect colleagues, loved ones, and patients from COVID-19 and its variants. All US-based employees must comply with Alexion's COVID-19 vaccination mandate. Alexion provides exceptions based on applicable state law as well as reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding a legally required exemption or accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

As a leading employer in our industry, Alexion offers a highly competitive package of base and incentive compensation as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the health, wellness and financial security of our employees and their families. Benefits include group medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, and much more.

AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

Title: Data Analyst, Measurement & Evaluation
Description:
Who We Are




NewGlobe supports visionary governments to transform public education systems, the cornerstone of a prosperous, equitable, and peaceful society.




With a comprehensive system transformation platform and data-driven educational services, NewGlobe delivers rapid and dramatic improvements in learning outcomes at state and nationwide scale. Through building impactful partnerships and programmes, NewGlobe ensures that all children have access to an education that will develop their full potential and create a foundation for growth and prosperity.




NewGlobe leverages more than a decade of educational experience and proven impact in integrated school management, teacher professional development, instructional design innovation, technological system support, child-centered classroom practice, and parent engagement -- all grounded in learning science -- to ensure each teacher is empowered to engage children in transformational learning, and all children have the opportunity to develop to their full potential. Every day, NewGlobe supports governments to solve what were once seen as intractable problems, and by doing so, ensures this generation will be able to grow up to lead more fulfilled lives, while simultaneously building economic prosperity for themselves, their communities, and the globe.




NewGlobe‚Äôs high-touch, intensive professional development programs, along with integrated school management, teacher support, and assessment software, enable schools to succeed. NewGlobe works within state and national curriculum and syllabi, ensuring all children are empowered to learn their own history, and master local content, while being globally competitive in mathematics and languages. The science of behaviour change and the science of learning is at the foundation of all programming.




NewGlobe works with urgency because youth quickly becomes adulthood and relentlessly because improvement requires continuous problem-solving. NewGlobe is honoured to serve and to help rebuild trust in public systems.




NewGlobe‚Äôs work is all encompassing and will challenge you to use your full mind, and heart, each day. We need bright minds who want to be part of building a new globe -- a more equitable globe -- to join us.




Academics




The objective of the Academics group is to drive student achievement. To do so, we must know what is happening minute-by-minute for the typical child. The student‚Äôs daily experience, and thus the path to achievement, emerges from their relationship with the teachers and the content that is delivered in the classroom. Our team is collaboratively organized around these levers. We develop rigorous content pitched at the right level for students to be delivered by a teacher who is prepared to succeed in the classroom. Our Instructional Design department builds the content; our Leadership & Development department trains teachers and school leaders using scientifically-proven techniques; our Learning Innovation department looks at cutting-edge research to generate breakthrough learning gains. Underpinning all of this is the work of the independent Measurement and Evaluation group, which provides Academics with an empirical orientation toward improving that daily experience and, in turn, driving achievement.




Measurement & Evaluation




The Measurement & Evaluation team at NewGlobe is housed within the Academics group and collaborates across departments to help leaders assess the quality of teaching and learning at NewGlobe. We work to answer the core questions of ‚ÄúHow well are we doing?‚Äù, ‚ÄúAre we getting better?‚Äù, and ‚ÄúHow can we get even better?‚Äù. We blend quantitative analyses with qualitative field work to measure what matters most, provide feedback to NewGlobe school leaders and managers, assess our impact on student learning, and communicate the results to various internal and external audiences.




At the heart of our work is comparative analysis. We compare student learning at NewGlobe across time and place. In all of our locations, we examine how much faster NewGlobe students learn than their peers in similar schools. We examine how student performance today compares to student performance yesterday. We examine sub-groups of students to advance equity. We examine variability across our schools to determine which characteristics matter most to student learning. We help NewGlobe managers assess the impact of the changes they have made to accelerate learning.




We take pride in providing rigorous measurement, study design, and analysis. We also take pride in our ability to communicate clearly in words, tables, and data visualizations. We intend our work to make a difference in how NewGlobe managers and our government partners think and act. We judge our own work accordingly.




Collaboration sits at the heart of M&E at NewGlobe. We collaborate with our internal team members as well as with our government partners. With every product, we enter into a collaborative conversation with those who operate and those who study. M&E has established deep partnerships with the education ministries, with local research organizations, and with international researchers who focus on teaching and learning, especially those who focus on the aspects of schooling most relevant to the students we serve.




About The Role




We are seeking a full-time M&E Data Analyst to join our team. We are looking for someone eager to conduct impactful research, share their expertise, and build upon a tradition of evaluation and data excellence at NewGlobe.




The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the data analysis of different descriptive analyses and impact evaluations within the organization. These analyses can range from simple descriptive analyses using a few Excel formulas, to more complex work using multiple Stata or R scripts. To do this, the Analyst will need to manage all parts of the data analysis process - starting from the design stage through the execution of analyses, and the reporting of the findings to other internal stakeholders.




The analyst is responsible for the provision of high-quality data products that other colleagues can rely on, and build their own work on. As such, this role is at the core of a large portion of all the M&E efforts within NewGlobe, and in consequence, at the intersection of our evaluation efforts to continually deliver stronger education to our students. We view data and analytics as core to our ability to learn as an organization. We want to cultivate data and analytics rock stars, people who produce and use data to reveal actionable insights for NewGlobe‚Äôs rapidly growing network of schools. The person in this role will receive constant coaching and mentoring from the rest of the M&E and Data Analytics team, and professional development will be a core feature of this role.




The M&E Analyst should be willing to work in Cambridge, MA. The M&E Analyst will report to the Director, M&E. Significant travel is required.




What You Will Do




Clean and analyze data sets. These data sets can be used to answer questions from a wide range of topics like academic performance, impact evaluation studies, internal RCTs, among others.
Ensure the creation of proper data pipelines and best data management practices.
Contribute to a culture of data-driven decision-making by collaborating with various team members across territories.
Accommodate requests for quick analyses. Time-sensitive questions will come from the VPs and C-Level Executives, and usually take anywhere from a few hours to a few days. Oftentimes, you will need to direct your staff to use their best judgment in the face of imperfect data.
Other duties as required by the Directors and VP of M&E, and C-level executives.
What You Should Have




High data literacy and a strong background in econometrics and/or statistics. Previous experience in an academic or applied setting, such as being an analyst, research assistant, data manager, or consultant. Experience in data cleaning, analysis, and/or visualization.
A high level of proficiency with Stata or R, and Excel. Any other data analysis software or coding language is a plus. Experience with survey software like Qualtrics, SurveyCTO, or Google Forms is also a plus.
Undergraduate degree (or its equivalent) or Masters degree ‚Äì in a relevant academic discipline, for example (but not limited to) Economics, Public or Education Policy, or Statistics.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate complex ideas for non-technical audiences ‚Äì you will need effective verbal and written communication skills to provide valuable insights and research reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Belief in data-driven decision making.
Flexible and loves to work in a dynamic environment.
Passion ‚Äì for NewGlobe‚Äôs mission.
Bonus ‚Äì experience in extreme growth situations and dealing with complexity; worked/studied in a developing country, worked in a no-excuses charter school in high-poverty areas in the U.S., and/or experience implementing data collection projects, particularly for impact evaluations.
You‚Äôre also




A detailed doer ‚Äì You have a track record of getting things done. You‚Äôre organized and responsive. You take ownership of every idea you touch and execute it to a fine level of detail, setting targets, engaging others, and doing whatever it takes to get the job done. You can multi-task dozens of such projects at once and never lose sight of the details. Likely, you have some experience in a start-up or other rapid-growth company.
A networking mastermind ‚Äì You excel at meeting new people and turning them into advocates. You communicate in a clear, conscientious, and effective way in both written and oral speech. You can influence strangers in the course of a single conversation. Allies and colleagues will go to bat for your ideas. You have an existing network from prior experience in the country, preferably in the regulatory, education, or business sectors.
A creative problem-solver ‚Äì Growing any business from scratch comes with massive and constant challenges. On top of that, NewGlobe works in often fragile, sometimes volatile low-resource communities and with complex government systems. You need to be flexible and ready to get everything done effectively, quickly, and affordably with the materials at hand.
A relentless advocate ‚ÄìThe children we serve and teachers we empower never leave your mind. You know them, get them, have shared a meal with them (or would be happy to in the future). You would never shrink back from shaking a parent‚Äôs hand or picking up a crying child, no matter what the person was wearing or looked like. Every decision you make considers their benefit, experience, and value.
A malleable learner ‚ÄìYou believe you can always do better. You welcome constructive criticism and provide it freely to others. You know you only get better tomorrow when others point out where you‚Äôve missed things or failed today.
A curious investigator ‚Äì You ask why a lot. You don‚Äôt just take what you see and accept it. You wonder why it is that way, and are aware that the world we see is created by human choices and actions ‚Äì and it could be different. You wonder, and see the world as wonderful even when you want to change a part of it that is unjust.

Title: DATA ANALYST, Strategic Planning, Initiatives & Systems
Description:
Job Description




The University‚Äôs central Budget and Planning office is responsible for compiling university data relating to overall projections of enrollments, tuition, fees, & student financial assistance. The analyst will use both commercially available software as well as proprietary enrollment and tuition modeling software. Position requires strong analytical skills as well as the ability to effectively communicate results, and the implications of those results, to management.




Essential Functions:




Responsible for maintaining the enrollment and tuition models in the university‚Äôs STAT+ system, including updating entering student targets, tuition rates and reviewing continuation rates. (30%)
Provide support within the office and to external operational areas for activities related to the Tuition & Fee Advisory Committee. The Data Analyst will be involved with the annual rate development process and ongoing rate development activities. The annual process includes issuance of requests for recommendations, review of the materials submitted, follow-up to resolve issues, preparation of materials that will be reviewed by senior management, and notification of approvals to operational areas. The University uses an internally developed web-based system (TAFS) to collect and maintain the submitted and approved rates. (20%)
Using data from the University‚Äôs MicroStrategy Academic Data Warehouse and SAP Business Warehouse, create visualizations and analyze the results from various reports to support the Academic Planning processes. This will include data required for the University‚Äôs Graduate Revenue Sharing initiative and any ad hoc data requests. (15%)
Responsible for producing data to support the development and monitoring of the university‚Äôs financial aid budgeting. (10%)
Assist with production of various weekly reports used in forecasting enrollment and tuition. (10%)
Responsible for researching and compiling comparative data from peer institutions relating to tuition, fees, and housing and dining rates. (10%)
Participate in user testing of new and existing systems including the Enrollment and Tuition projection models (STAT+); Tuition & Fee System (TAFS); and the upcoming Student Information System (SIS). (5%)
Required Skills




Bachelor's Degree and 5-8 years of experience, or Master's Degree and 3-5 years of experience.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, PowerBI).
Experience with MicroStrategy, SAP, SQL, or SPSS preferred.
Strong analytical and communication skills.




Please note all newly hired staff and faculty will need to be in compliance with Boston University‚Äôs COVID-19 Vaccination and Booster Requirement within 30 days of date of hire. You must upload your vaccine documentation or request a medical or religious exemption (instructions). For further information on the University‚Äôs response to COVID-19, please visit the COVID-19 Resources site.




We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military service, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, or because of marital, parental, or veteran status. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Title: Strategy Data Analyst
Description:
About Generate Biomedicines

Generate Biomedicines is a new kind of therapeutics company ‚Äì existing at the intersection of machine learning, biological engineering, and medicine ‚Äì pioneering Generative Biology‚Ñ¢ to create breakthrough medicines where novel therapeutics are computationally generated, instead of being discovered. Generate has built a machine learning-powered biomedicines platform with the potential to generate new drugs across a wide range of biologic modalities. This platform represents a potentially fundamental shift in what is possible in the field of biotherapeutic development.

We pursue this audacious vision because we believe in the unique and revolutionary power of generative biology to radically transform the lives of billions, with an outsized opportunity for patients in need. We are seeking collaborative, relentless problem solvers that share our passion for impact to join us!

Generate was founded in 2018 by Flagship Pioneering and has received over $420 million in funding, providing the resources to rapidly scale the organization. The Company has offices in Somerville, and Andover with approximately 200 employees.

The Role:

As part of a growing Data Strategy team, the Strategy Data Analyst will have a high-impact role in supporting Generate‚Äôs platform for AI-driven protein therapeutic discovery. In this role, your mission will be to synthesize disparate thought streams into a cohesive understanding of the problem, what the data means, what Generate‚Äôs platform needs, and where the impact could be.

The ideal candidate is quantitatively rigorous and can understand and integrate various types of structured and unstructured data across multiple departments and levels of the organization. They are highly adaptable to change, an excellent communicator, and able to influence key decision makers. If you enjoy using your technical skills and systems-level thinking to build, improve, and value data, and have an interest in working at the interface of life science and technology, this role may be for you.

Key Responsibilities

Lead operational data analysis: model data flows across platform processes, develop solutions to address data gaps, and assess the health and quality of Generate‚Äôs data assets
Build new tools: create new data products to improve connectivity across the platform and build visualizations of data-generating processes
Value Generate‚Äôs data: quantify trends in the volume, velocity, and usage of Generate‚Äôs data assets, and work with business partners to drive the platform in high-value directions
Regularly present analytical results and strategy proposals to Data and Platform Strategy team members and to business partners, including senior leaders


Qualifications

Minimum Bachelors degree in a quantitative discipline (computer science, engineering, or similar)
3+ years experience in management consulting, data strategy or data scientist roles
Experience in healthcare or life science consulting
Experience in biotech/pharma is a plus
Data science (model building) or data engineering (pipeline building) experience is a plus


Skills

Proficiency with one or more programming languages, including Python, SQL, or similar
Experience with dashboarding and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) is preferred
Proficiency with one or more large scale data technologies, such as Spark, Snowflake, or similar is a plus
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals
Entrepreneurial spirit with the desire to work in a fast-paced startup environment
Ability to be independent in interactions with business partners, in managing meetings, and in managing simultaneous projects


Flagship Pioneering and our ecosystem companies are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

COVID Safety:

Generate Biomedicines enforces a mandatory vaccination policy for COVID-19. All employees must be fully vaccinated and have received a booster. The purpose of this policy is to safeguard the health of our employees, their families, and the community at large from infectious disease that may be reduced by vaccinations. The company will make exceptions to this policy if required by applicable law and will consider requests for an exemption from this policy due to a medical reason, or because of a sincerely held religious belief, or any other exemptions that may be recognized by applicable.

Recruitment & Staffing Agencies: Flagship Pioneering and its affiliated Flagship Lab companies (collectively, ‚ÄúFSP‚Äù) do not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to FSP or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Flagship Pioneering‚Äôs internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of FSP, and FSP will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.

HTML:
About Generate Biomedicines

Generate Biomedicines is a new kind of therapeutics company ‚Äì existing at the intersection of machine learning, biological engineering, and medicine ‚Äì pioneering Generative Biology‚Ñ¢ to create breakthrough medicines where novel therapeutics are computationally generated, instead of being discovered. Generate has built a machine learning-powered biomedicines platform with the potential to generate new drugs across a wide range of biologic modalities. This platform represents a potentially fundamental shift in what is possible in the field of biotherapeutic development.

We pursue this audacious vision because we believe in the unique and revolutionary power of generative biology to radically transform the lives of billions, with an outsized opportunity for patients in need. We are seeking collaborative, relentless problem solvers that share our passion for impact to join us!

Generate was founded in 2018 by Flagship Pioneering and has received over $420 million in funding, providing the resources to rapidly scale the organization. The Company has offices in Somerville, and Andover with approximately 200 employees.

The Role:

As part of a growing Data Strategy team, the Strategy Data Analyst will have a high-impact role in supporting Generate‚Äôs platform for AI-driven protein therapeutic discovery. In this role, your mission will be to synthesize disparate thought streams into a cohesive understanding of the problem, what the data means, what Generate‚Äôs platform needs, and where the impact could be.

The ideal candidate is quantitatively rigorous and can understand and integrate various types of structured and unstructured data across multiple departments and levels of the organization. They are highly adaptable to change, an excellent communicator, and able to influence key decision makers. If you enjoy using your technical skills and systems-level thinking to build, improve, and value data, and have an interest in working at the interface of life science and technology, this role may be for you.

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead operational data analysis: model data flows across platform processes, develop solutions to address data gaps, and assess the health and quality of Generate‚Äôs data assets
  • Build new tools: create new data products to improve connectivity across the platform and build visualizations of data-generating processes
  • Value Generate‚Äôs data: quantify trends in the volume, velocity, and usage of Generate‚Äôs data assets, and work with business partners to drive the platform in high-value directions
  • Regularly present analytical results and strategy proposals to Data and Platform Strategy team members and to business partners, including senior leaders

Qualifications
  • Minimum Bachelors degree in a quantitative discipline (computer science, engineering, or similar)
  • 3+ years experience in management consulting, data strategy or data scientist roles
  • Experience in healthcare or life science consulting
  • Experience in biotech/pharma is a plus
  • Data science (model building) or data engineering (pipeline building) experience is a plus

Skills
  • Proficiency with one or more programming languages, including Python, SQL, or similar
  • Experience with dashboarding and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) is preferred
  • Proficiency with one or more large scale data technologies, such as Spark, Snowflake, or similar is a plus
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals
  • Entrepreneurial spirit with the desire to work in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Ability to be independent in interactions with business partners, in managing meetings, and in managing simultaneous projects

The company will make exceptions to this policy if required by applicable law and will consider requests for an exemption from this policy due to a medical reason, or because of a sincerely held religious belief, or any other exemptions that may be recognized by applicable.

Title: Associate Analyst, Content & Insights
Description:
Per Executive Order 14042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment.

As a Associate Analyst, Content & Insights your priority is to turn data into insights and stories. You‚Äôll be part of the team developing the voice of Comscore and shaping how we position ourselves in the marketplace. It is a very exciting time to join Comscore as you will have the opportunity to experiment and put your own stamp on the content you create and deliver.

Are you passionate about data and turning them into insights? About the trends that are shaping our societies? About the constantly evolving world of media? If so, read on.

As a Content & Insights analyst your priority is to turn data into insights and stories. You‚Äôll be part of the team developing the voice of Comscore and shaping how we position ourselves in the marketplace. It is a very exciting time to join Comscore as you will have the opportunity to experiment and put your own stamp on the content you create and deliver.

This is a new and vital role within the Content & Insight group, which is comprised of content specialists, creators, and distributors of content. You will also work across and collaborate with other groups across the larger Marketing team including Product, Brand, and International Marketing.

What You'll Do

It‚Äôs an exciting time to be at Comscore. The media industry is experiencing a revolution, and we‚Äôre on the front line of redefining how brands, agencies and publishers reach their audiences. Within that context, you will‚Ä¶

Pull data from various sources within Comscore.
Write, curate and edit blogs, white papers, presentations.
Keep an eye on consumer and industry trends to inform content stories and fresh marketing ideas.
Continuously evaluate content performance and experiment with new topics, formats, etc.

What We Look For

You are a data lover and enjoy turning data into insights.
You are a deep thinker: you continuously try to go beyond the obvious and superficial to extract information that mere mortals often overlook.
On the technical side, you are not afraid of using excel. Nor do you hesitate to roll up your sleeves and learn to use the tools required to extract data. You don‚Äôt need to be an expert, and we‚Äôll train you on most in-house tools.
You are a good writer: your prose is structured, concise, and to the point.
You are interested in the world of media and advertising and stay up to date on new trends in this space.
You learn fast and you have an always-on learning mentality. As part of it, you are willing to take risks, test, fail, and then do it all over again.
You can prioritize high impact activities, work in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines and execute across multiple projects.

About Comscore

At Comscore, we‚Äôre pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients & partners. Though our roles and skills are varied, we‚Äôre united by our commitment to five underlying values: Integrity, Velocity, Accountability, Teamwork, and Servant Leadership. If you‚Äôre motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry‚Äôs emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. To learn more about Comscore, please visit Comscore.com.

EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

To comply with federal law, Comscore participates in E-Verify. Successful candidates must pass the E-Verify process after hire.

Title: Analyst, CKSI Advanced Data Analytics & Insights
Description:
2068569




Job Description




Are you passionate about using your analytical skills to derive insights and drive business strategy and success? Are you intrigued by being able to formulate the full picture by tying together seemingly disparate data points from multiple sources (e.g., customer attributes and behaviors, transactional history, call transcripts, digital activity, business financials) in to one cohesive story? Are you ready to drive experimentation & strategic insights to optimize every aspect of the customer‚Äôs experience?




If yes, we want you to join our forward-thinking team and make a real-world difference for Fidelity‚Äôs 40 million individual investors.




The Team




We are looking for an analytics professional to be a creative and collaborative team member, helping develop and lead data and hypothesis driven initiatives. As an indispensable member of CKSI (Customer Knowledge & Strategic Insights), you'll be embedded in a business unit and will work with an agile inter-disciplinary team with a diverse set of skills across analytics, engineering, data science, marketing, product development etc., to optimize and personalize the Fidelity experience.




The Skills You Bring




Ability to translate a business need or question into a hypothesis that can be validated via experimentation or data analysis.
Ability to use data to tell a story of customer experience, highlighting both successes and friction points to inform future initiatives and strategies.
Delivering insights from data to a broad audience in a simple, clear, and actionable way.
A cross-functional collaborator who can work across a team with diverse skills and abilities and find success for Fidelity and our customers.
Demonstrating a mix of analytical skills, you always focus on business use cases and customer needs.
Natural intellectual curiosity, initiative, and love for learning new skills and capabilities.





The Expertise We‚Äôre Looking For




3 + years of experience generating analytical insights to drive business actions, including experience with a range of analytical tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, etc.
Experience in designing and developing dashboards & reports by using Tableau, Power BI, Qlik etc.
Experience using and querying big data technologies such as Snowflake, Athena, etc.
Experience with digital analytics using tools such as Adobe analytics is a plus
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative / technical field such as Data or Business Analytics, Economics, Statistics, or Finance. MBA or MS degree a plus





The Value You Deliver




Continuously improving data analytics and insights capabilities and spreading that knowledge and expertise throughout the organization
Delivering data-driven and actionable insights to enable objective, informed business, and product decisions





Please see below for the salary range for work locations in Colorado only:




N/A




Please see below for the salary range for work locations in New York City, Westchester County, NY and Jersey City, NJ only:




N/A




Please see below for the salary range for work locations in California only:




N/A




Please see below for the salary range for work locations in Washington only:




N/A




Certifications




Company Overview




Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients‚Äô money.




Join Us




At Fidelity, you‚Äôll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples‚Äô lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees‚Äô Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2023. And you don‚Äôt need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity‚Äîwe offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you‚Äôve always imagined.




At Fidelity, our goal is for most people to work flexibly in a way that balances both personal and business needs with time onsite and offsite through what we‚Äôre calling "Dynamic Working."




We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.




Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.




Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

Title: Real Estate Data Analyst
Description:
The Americas Real Estate Data Analyst is individually responsible for creating and managing data analytics utilizing software applications, to frame, structure, and prioritize Real Estate strategies by comprehensive data sets and mining for usable information. Utilizing a developed knowledge of data processing and advanced experience with data software programs, such as Excel, Power BI, Oracle, SAP, and Salesforce, create graphs, infographics, and other visualization methods to ‚Äútell a story,‚Äù effectively.

As part of a team, the Americas Real Estate Data Analyst will collaborate with visual content creators and presenters to build compelling presentations and reports, based on recommendations and findings, creating thought-provoking stakeholder and executive leadership engagement for key project initiatives.

We are looking to add to our team a creative problem solver who can create opportunities for improvement, diversification, and optimization, through data-based arguments and solutions to solve complex problems. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply.

Key Responsibilities:

Create tools to measure productivity, accuracy, cost-effectiveness and efficiency of real estate operations and project management
Analyze and assess the current Real Estate portfolio, as well as new and ongoing transactions
Evaluate appropriate need, location, size, and purpose of offices based on analysis of multiple factors and data points
Synthesize key messages into business solutions and communicate effectively to leadership
Create, analyze and present financial and budgetary reports to include recommendations to leadership
Collect and analyze user requirements and ideal system business intelligence data
Performs business process workflow, analysis, and reengineering through automation
Ad-Hoc Reporting and Analysis
Assist with financial and business-related research and cooperate with other departme
Commercial/Corporate Real Estate, Financial Services, or Consulting experience
Experience in database development and maintenance
Experience with Oracle suite
1-3 years of experience performing data analysis
Strong research skills
High integrity, self-motivated, and strong work ethic
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Ability to connect disparate systems together to share and utilize large amounts of data into actionable information
Advanced technical skills including proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Access, and PowerPoint
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to create and interpret financial models
Ability to multi-task, prioritize completing projects and time-sensitive deliverables within a fast-paced work environment
Creative and strategic thinker
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills
Executive presence and presentation capabilities.

The base pay for this position is $70.000-85,000.

Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Medidata provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a commission under the terms of applicable plan documents, while many of Medidata‚Äôs non-sales positions are eligible for annual bonuses. Additionally, Medidata provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most and should help you care for those who matter most. For that reason, we provide an array of options to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life.

Equal Employment OpportunityIn order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Medidata are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Medidata is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. Medidata will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law. Covid StatementOur Company requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to provide documentation of full vaccination, unless qualified for a medical, religious or state-required accommodation or otherwise exempt consistent with applicable law. Although accommodation requests will be considered (and granted where appropriate/possible), it may be determined that a candidate is unable to adequately perform the essential functions of the position without imposing an undue hardship due to customer requirements, staffing needs, or other business reasons. Definition of full-vaccination: Employees are considered to be fully vaccinated two weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series or two weeks after a single-dose vaccine.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Lead Data Analyst, Data Management & Analytics - Load Forecasting

Job Function: Data Analysis and Analytics

Waltham, MA or Hicksville, NY, Brooklyn, NY, Syracuse, NY, or Albany, NY.

Lead Data Analyst, Data Management & Analytics ‚Äì Load Forecasting.

Job Purpose

As a Lead Data Analyst within the Data Management & Analytics team, you will support the development, presentation, and Defense of the gas and electric load forecasts for our US service territory by defining, managing, and executing all data-related tasks including, but not limited to data acquisition, transformation, and storage; software/script development; data platform management and maintenance; requirements collection and stakeholder communications.

Key Accountabilities

Assemble small and large individual data sets that meet internal business requirements.
Design and implement ETL processes to collect, transform, and store data from various data sources (databases, APIs, FTPs, SharePoint, Power Platform, Azure) using a range of technologies depending upon the use case (SQL, R, Python, PowerShell)
Develop, manage, and maintain the data platform, which includes database architecture, stored procedures, server task management, and reporting.
Drive the process to automate manual procedures and optimize data delivery for end-users.
Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, statistics, informatics, information systems, or another quantitative field. A Master‚Äôs degree is strongly preferred, with a background in computer science/data science and/or database architecture.
5+ years of experience in a data-heavy role
In-depth experience working with SQL databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL)
Ability to write code in one or more scripting languages: R, Python
GIS programming knowledge or experience is strongly preferred.
Dev Ops engineering skills a plus (e.g., distributed computing, data pipelines)
Experience with reporting/visualization tools like Tableau/Power BI preferred.
Successful history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from disconnected datasets
Excellent communication skills
Fully versed in various OS environments: Windows Server, Linux, Unix/AIX, system task scheduling, Bash programming
Knowledge of networks and firewalls preferred.
Ability to design and develop solutions that can be leveraged across multiple projects and have the scale for the future.
Relevant energy industry experience or experience in a regulated setting is preferred.
Highly motivated with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

Title: Lead Data Analyst- Customer and Financial Analytics
Description:
The Opportunity

We are looking for an analytical, detail oriented and collaborative individual to join our Financial and Customer analytics team. As lead data analyst, you will act as a trusted advisor working cross-functionally across Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, as well as senior leadership. In this role you will be responsible for deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers.

About The Team

The business intelligence team enables all groups across the organization to harness the power of data to make our customers more secure and drive growth for Rapid7. The team works as collaborative partners who provide actionable, accessible, and relevant data, insights, and predictive analytics.

About the Role

The ideal candidate will be an inquisitive learner with a passion for data and analytics who can collaborate with stakeholders across functional areas to review and optimize reporting, analytics, and data structure/data capture all while aligning to corporate objectives. This role requires a mixture of business acumen and technical expertise in SQL, and Tableau, along with an ability to build strong partnerships with business partners.

Collaborate with Finance, Customer Health, Business Ops, Product, and Senior Leadership teams to conduct deep financial and business analysis on our business performance, providing visibility into revenue and expense drivers, customer health and behavior, current pricing and packaging strategies in an effort to best support our customers
Understand existing customer economics, margins and utilization to support proposed changes to pricing models
Provide clear visualizations and present analyses to management and executive-level stakeholders, using Business Intelligence tools and predictive analytics to drive key decisions
Drive consistency in reporting and analysis across the company, reinforcing process, increasing visibility, and acting as a key point of communication between stakeholder teams
Develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business uses of data
Coach and mentor junior team members to become savvy with Tableau and visualization.
Advance BI team & corporate goals, promoting a data-oriented culture, insight generation and enablement of end-users

In this role you will bring

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Business, Economics, or related discipline required, Masters preferred.
At least 8 years work experience in a role that required regular business analytics; high tech, software, or mgmt. consulting company preferred.
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in Tableau with strong data visualization skills.
8 years of hands-on proficiency with SQL.
Strong business acumen, possessing the ability to understand cross-functional trends, and how those trends impact corporate KPIs; prior experience in an operational role a plus
Fast learner with high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality & business analytics

‚Äã

We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. Teams reflecting a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don‚Äôt be shy - apply today.




About Rapid7

Rapid7 (NASDAQ: RPD) helps organizations across the globe protect what matters most so innovation can thrive in an increasingly connected world. Our comprehensive technology, services, and community-focused research simplify the complex for security teams, helping them reduce vulnerabilities, monitor for malicious behavior, be in 10 places at once, and shut down attacks. We‚Äôre on a mission to make security solutions easier to use and access so we can bring safety and resilience to more people. With more than 10,000 customers across 140+ countries, Rapid7 is a leader in cybersecurity that has earned numerous industry accolades and recognition for our technology and culture.

#linkedInHybrid

Hybrid- Boston ( 3x days in office)







All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
